Reviews.Title: “A perfect romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: DCland
Reviews.Content: This hotel met and exceeded my expectations, by far!!!!! It's a great hotel that offers a lot of amenities!!! The staff is very friendly, professional and customer service oriented... from the Valet, to the Front Desk staff, to the restaurant staff, to the security guys, to the cleaning staff!! Rooms are clean and cosy, although not huge, the size was perfect for our romantic getaway!! I would return or recommend this hotel in a heartbeat!! The location is great, only 5 minutes walk to Robson street (lots of restaurants, shop) and about 10 minutes walk to the Skytrain and/or Gastown as well as Convention Centre. About 1 minute walk to the Olympic Flame and shore!!! This hotel is great and we'll definately be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Marriott Ever!”
Reviews.Author: jrjojo
Reviews.Content: While attending a conference in Vancouver I was lucky enough to stay at the Pinnacle. Wonderful service, totally professional, always willing to help. Restaurant is very good. Rooms extremely comfortable. Would recommend to everyone. One glitch: the international cheerleading contest was in town and the cheerleaders (all sizes, all ages) were dispersed throughout several floors of the hotel. The helicopter mommies shepherding their young charges had a tendency to sit around the hallways drinking wine while the little darlings tried to get to sleep following their daily adventures. Too bad for you if they picked your door to sit outside of.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: eligadd
Reviews.Content: We stayed there during a conference and it was great. It is a 3" walk to the conference center. The hotel staff is so delightful. The hotel is very nice and we were surprised that the workout facilities were so nice and free of charge. It is a great location, just 1-2 blocks off the waterfront. The hotel has a great view of the water, mountains, and Stanley Park. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: eztravelertoo
Reviews.Content: A very well-run hotel. The breakfast buffet is well worth the price and the service is excellent. Our waiter "Dwayne" not only told us about good city walks and Stanley Park, he fetched us a good map of the city to peruse during our morning meal. The hotel is located just a block away from the Convention Center and the square of the Olympic flame. Rooms are small but well equipped and clean. Internet is very pricey ($15 for 24 hours) but you can use the business center for routine Internet connection and printing. Cleaning staff is helpful and courteous. Biggest disappointment: TV does not get AMC, so we had to miss Mad Men!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: camihayes
Reviews.Content: Great service, great room, great gym, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, OK rooms, poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: Chapul
Reviews.Content: Location The location is excellent for access to the convention centre, the seaplane terminal and the business district. All are within easy walking distance (under 10 minutes for the most part) or a short taxi ride. Robson street shopping and Coal Harbour area stores and restaurants are a few blocks away. All of this makes the Marriott Pinnacle attractive to groups of convention goers - so calm is not one of the hotel's strong points Room Mine was comfortable and efficient, but surprisingly unfashionable for the price. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom is standard for a chain hotel. Service is spotty: housekeeping varied - on one day there were crumbs left on the desk, on another laundry bags were not replenished automatically. Reception/concierge service was generally less forthcoming with assistance that it ought to have been, and the tone of some of the interactions witnessed between the Front Desk and guests whose first language was not English made me cringe. (To be fair, this phenomenon may not be unique to the Marriott. Despite the multicultural, plurilingual reality, Vancouver's hospitality staffers' impatience with speakers of other languages may be more widespread than the city boosters like to admit. I heard it expressed sharply at the airport arrivals area and at the front desk in one other hotel.) Guests at this facility are probably overpaying for name recognition and there are many other hotels with lower rates and similar offerings nearby. I will stay elsewhere when next I spend 5 nights in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “good but nothing spectacular”
Reviews.Author: jasoncrh
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here this weekend. Priceline for $80 a night, so great deal. Staff were friendly and accommodating, and the location was great. I walked everywhere from here. Room was standard Marriott comfortable. I'd probably give it 3.5/4 starts, but had a minor problem. Had been out sightseeing all day and when I got back to my room at 7:30PM the room hadnt been cleaned. I was a little surprised. The staff took care of it promptly when I advised them, but something like this shouldnt be overlooked. Solid property, though.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and good views...”
Reviews.Author: Charleso3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location being a short ( 7 mins) walk to Gastown . On the way is the landmark "The Lookout" this is worth a visit. The views are great and the combination of mountains , sea , city all mix together and are worth the entrance fee. The hotel is also a short walk to the sea inlet, from here you can see the "float" planes/seaplanes taking off and landing. The rooms are really nice. The service was very good. Some of the rooms have mountain views as well although they do cost more.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, fairly good price, has some old world charm”
Reviews.Author: AnnArborMiBob
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference near the Vancouver Convention Centre, and was quite pleased with the proximity to that facility and with the hotel itself. By staying an extra block away from the waterfront (about two and a half instead of one) I saved much money, and don't think I got a lesser hotel. My single king room was what I would call "Marriott standard", which meant a nicely appointed room for the business traveler. Internet in the room was a little pricey, but it was free in the lobby, and an unexpected plus was that by accessing the Internet from the lobby, I was given a code online at signon time that let me return to my room and continue to access the Internet for the remainder of the hour after signon free of charge. That was fine for my purposes. The staff were quite pleasant, with everyone greeting me whenever I came by, and the service was top notch. This is my first choice if I should ever return for another conference at the Vancouver Convention Centre.

Reviews.Title: “comfy, clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: spontane0us_famly
Reviews.Content: this was by far, the best Marriott that I've stayed at...but what really impressed me was the carpets! they must have recently replaced the carpets so it was so very nice to walk on almost new carpeting. yes, call me a clean freak... the bed was comfy as usual and the room was nice and good sized. we were on the 26th floor, which had really nice views, but the concierge breakfast ended at 9am, which was too soon for me - hey, it's vacation, no need to get up too early =). the location is very convenient to most everything. with it being Feb and cold and wet and all, we didn't walk very far. the only thing that was off was the noise level from other rooms... it wasn't bad, just heard some sounds here and there. hotels need to make sure their walls and floors are thick! other than that, it was a wonderful stay!!

Reviews.Title: “This is as good as it gets at Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Marty M
Reviews.Content: Excellent, right from the front door bellman to the concierge and easy and freindy reception. I have stayed at many of the Marriott properties in Canada and this has to be the best when it comes to customer attention.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location, lovely room”
Reviews.Author: aark2947
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because of a LIving Social Deal. It's a great location, you can walk to anywhere downtown or to Stanley Park if you have any stamina at all. We were on the 8th floor, so the view was mostly of other highrises, but that was nice and we didn't mind not having the higher up view since we had gotten the bargain deal. The room was very nice, very pretty. There was a chair / ottoman, dresser, king size bed that was very comfortable. Very nice coffee service in the room. No fridge or microwave in case that matters to you. One complaint, they charge $15 a night for WiFi, and we just wouldn't pay it, and were inconvenienced by that. I would stay here again, if the price was the same, but I probably wouldn't pay $300 for the room. But that's just me. Except for the wifi, it was a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Our first visit ...”
Reviews.Author: ReneLes
Reviews.Content: This isnt our regular hotel while in vancouver, which was full ... so we went with priceline offered 75 for a four star amd landed at the marriot. So for the price it was a very good value. Rooms are a bit smaller that our regular vancouver hotel, and location isnt as good. great if your want to be near Coal Harbour. Very good staff and service. Room was very quiet, and clean. Only one noticable poor item was the bar soap ... such a minor thing but odd for a four star hotel . Very comfy beds and had a great sleep. We would return if our other one is full.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but condescending receptionists”
Reviews.Author: KristinaOX323
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night with a few of my friends for a night out. The employees at the entrance were very nice. The ones at the front desk, however, seemed very condescending as my friends and I checked-in with our snowboarding gear. The room we got on the 29th floor was amazing, though. Great view, clean, and comfy beds. Overall a good stay, but hated having to check-in/check-out. Front desk staff was condescending, all others were great and friendly. Also, I never received my final bill. It was supposed to be emailed to me... but that was already 2 days ago, luckily I can check my card activities online... I definitely would have rated this a 4 or 5 had it not been for some staff members. If you plan on staying here, definitely request a room on a higher floor and hope you get a friendlier staff to check you in and out.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with great staff.”
Reviews.Author: PerthKarmon
Reviews.Content: IFantastic friendly welcome and customer oriented attitude. a double/double and a king. Both very luxurious with crisp linens and a truly comfortable bed with lots of pillows. Bathrooms have seperate baths and showers, granite benches and the softest fluffy white towels. Big (42") flat screen TV, tea coffee making facilities, fridge, desk and chair and armchair with ottoman and side table. 2 x Bedside tables and a selection of lamps including personal book lights attached to the headboard. A gorgeous fluffy bathrobe is provided for use as well. (Interesting fact: most of the furnishings in the room are available for purchase including the bed!) Wi-fi is available in the lobby area at no cost. The buffet breakfast is great too.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good”
Reviews.Author: cfeb123
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel and well located for the waterfront, float planes, Stanley Park etc. also easy to reach by train from the airport and in the CBD too. Very friendly reception, rooms clean and comfortable. There are plenty of Starbucks if you want to save on breakfasts. Negative points - no washing line in bathroom, no magnified mirror in bathroom and lastly, no films - even though the Guest Service Directory tells you there are.

Reviews.Title: “Not a fan of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: LShe
Reviews.Content: I usually like Marriott Hotels. I was not happy with this experience. I was supposedly upgraded to a one bedroom suite and was assigned to the 5th floor. There was no view, there was no light given it's low placement, surrounding buildings, and of course, Vancouver cloudiness-it was a depressing room. The room itself was tired looking in great need of updating. The room on close inspection was also not clean--there was toothpaste "foam" on the faucet from a previous occupant, visible dirt on the carpet which had been missed by the vacuum cleaner. When inspecting the mattress, I noticed that it was well past it's expiry date and well worn. Also, the 1 bedroom suite is supposed to have 2 TVs. There was a TV in the sitting area, but the TV in the bedroom had obviously been removed. The remote was there, and the table to hold the TV was there, but there was no TV! Internet service which was part of the conference package was very slow. The shower took about 10 minutes to warm up to a reasonable temperature. I should mention that as I was leaving, there was work being done on the 5th floor, it appears that I was the only guest on the floor. I saw that they were changing all the mattressess in all the rooms on my wing. I was surprised to see a piece of paper on my door that said: "This Room Is Occupied. Do not change mattress. Quiet please.".I assume it was put there by the maintenance worker who walked into the room the previous evening without knocking. The pictures of the other rooms look nice. I might give this hotel a 2nd chance in the future, but would ask for a high floor with a view. Very disappointed this time! On the positive side. If you are booked on the 5th floor, your mattress will be new.

Reviews.Title: “Best Marriott I Can Remember”
Reviews.Author: jdr27
Reviews.Content: This is a very solid four star property, well located in Vancouver not far from the waterfront, shopping, dining, etc. The highlight is the bed, and I must say had the single best mattress I have ever slept on - just exquisite. Room was spotless and nicely furnished, bathroom more than adequate. The room was also very quiet - no street or hallway noise. Solid choice when visiting Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view”
Reviews.Author: travelingbeastofaman
Reviews.Content: Lets start with one word "view" I upgraded to the one of the top floors and had an amazing view of the mountains, water & stanly park. it was amazing. The location was close walking distance to the old olympic torch and a little further down was a cruise ship port and some shops. This part of town is not very stroller friendly. We had a 7 month old and a stroller and most of the places to eat required to go down some stairs. Elevators were hard to come by and broke. We ended up eating our first meal in the hotel. It was hotel food so its middle of the line three stars for qualiy and as usual 2 stars for price. service gets 4 stars. They tried. This loaction was more of a business district then a tourist district, so most of the shops and eating places were closed by 5pm. But there were many coffee shops that served amazing mochas and lattes. Specficially one by wal greens. It was amazing. We spent the day at stanly park. You can read other peoples posts about that though. It was amazing. We drove from Bremerton, WA. We ran into some ferry traffic at Kingston/edmonds ferry so we drove to winslow and caught the next ferry to seattle. We made great time out through Bellingham until we caught PM rush hour in Vancouver. The main route in was reduced from 5 lanes to 1 through a tunnel entrance. I recommend the "Bridge route". I think I love victoria more, but... It was still a lot of fun!

Reviews.Title: “Super for the Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: canuckcutie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was spectacular, and very quiet for a weekend. The rooms were spotless, the lobby was beautiful and the hotel was centrally located to everything Vancouver has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Room With A View”
Reviews.Author: TraveljohnsonJ
Reviews.Content: Make no mistake about it, views from the upper floor rooms may be the highlight of this hotel. But if you want to enjoy the full view, chances are you will have to move the sofa that blocks the window. The rooms are pure Marriott and configured for business travelers, complete with a scissor, paper clips and post-it notes in the desk drawer. Even the table lamp is bolted to the table so not to fall and injure a guest. And finally there is a hotel that has an ample number of conveniently located electric outlets to power a computer, phone charger, etc. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was very upscale with its separate glassed in shower area. The one part of this hotel that was very disappointing was the lobby and restaurant/bar. The combined space is cavernous, terribly drafty and downright frigid on a cold evening. For dinner you might want to consider using room service if you desire a peaceful and more comfortable environment. When there is a function taking place on the third level, the small open balcony allows a great deal of noise into the lobby which then echoes like you were in the Grand Canyon. If this was my hotel, I would install a glass wall to keep function noises from reverberating yet still offering a view of the lobby. You cannot help but feel sorry to the guest service agents in having to work in that bone-chilling and drafty lobby, especially when the double wide doors open on a chilly day or night. The hotel would save a bundle of energy if they installed an oversized revolving door like you often find at other Marriott’s. In the evenings, there really is not a lot of "action" in this neighborhood of office towers; but, you will be close the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel walking distance to most attractions. Expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: Summit_Seeker
Reviews.Content: We booked on priceline for about 40% off the hotel's website price. All the staff were friendly and helpful, and we were given a room with a peekaboo harbor view on the 8th floor. It's a business hotel, so things were quiet on the weekend we were there. The gym an pool area were nicer than what most hotels offer. My only real complaint is the extortionate rates for parking. About $37 USD per day when you include all the taxes and fees! Dear Vancouver, you are not Manhattan. Stop charging like it. Street parking is free overnight, and there are independent garages all around the hotel that charge less, but still expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: prts78
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel.Good location and service - rooms were clean and fresh every day. Nice view from the window. We really loved the breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay a night or two in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Trendchaser
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night here. Actually I have been to this hotel numerous times. Its always fantastic to stay here. We had a nice view from the 25th floor. The service here is spectacular. The staff even came in the room when we went for dinner and did a refresh service. Which means they made the bed again and straightened a few things in the room. Nice touch. The pool and hot tub is nice. Has one of the best fitness centers in a hotel I have ever seen. We ordered our room with a buffet breakfast package. Cooked to order egg station, smoked salmon cheeses, fruits. Anything you really wanted for a breakfast was there and it was all delicious. The location is one block from the waterfront. A few blocks from Robson Street where all the tourist shopping is. Stanley park is not that far away either. The only downsides is the room is a little bit on the small side and parking was $30 for the night after taxes. I recommend to park in a parking garage a couple blocks away and walk to the hotel. You will save yourself 20 bucks.

Reviews.Title: “General Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: RES00001
Reviews.Content: It spent the last 2 days at the Marriott on business. This is a "business" hotel. First- The TV didn't work - No power. Second - There was an empty soda bottle in the drawer of the desk. Third - There were hairs in the shower. (It had not been cleaned) Fourth - at the restaurant - Ask the waiter for the quickest breakfast possible. He suggested that I order a bowl of cereal. After 10 minutes, I leave and the ceral still had not arrived. I had to leave. Firth - There was a fridge in my room , but it was empty. I asked the front desk about the mini-bar in the room and was told that no hotel in Vancouver has a mini-bar ??? WTF. Just a bad experience. Too bad. The room was nice, the gym was good, great location, they just miss too many of the negatives.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: HDH
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in late December, rooms very comfortable – especially the bed. Bathroom very well equipped with all you’d need including free wi-fi. Bar and restaurant seemed very well attended even though we did try it ourselves. It’s very well located for the Seabus across to the City and to a great market and other shops. If you can get a good deal, I’d have no hesitation at all in recommending it . (Only thing that was missing was a magnifying mirror )

Reviews.Title: “Nice Marriott”
Reviews.Author: avillebud
Reviews.Content: I am not a huge Marriott fan as the colors in the lobby and bed rooms remind me of a cruise ship... despite the horrible colors I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The hotel is in a great location. Walking distance to shops, convention center, bay.... easy to get around the city from this location. The gym at this hotel is quite nice for a marriott... its not amazing but it has everything one would need for a four or five day stay. I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Octobertraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a standard big chain hotel and everything you would expect. Friendly service, comfortable beds, standard Marriott amentities. The location is really great- just a few blocks to the water and walking distance to everything in downtown. The rooms are a bit small, but that is to be expected in an area of high density.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Service Throughout Entire Stay”
Reviews.Author: inspiration100
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pinnacle Downtown over Christmas day and had a wonderful experience. Everyone who worked at this hotel pampered us. David at the front desk was especially helpful overall in service and restaurant suggestions. The customer service was top notch. The room had a great view and the hotel was well located for shopping. Very nice pool and workout area. Only complaint is the parking fees ($35 inc tax), but that is not the hotel's fault. Thank you to all the staff for making our Christmas so enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: Slavabo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in December during the conference, very convenient place, close to SkyTrain metro line and to the main attractions like Robson street and Stanley Park. The service was great and the room was clean and big. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet view... great location.”
Reviews.Author: Z Z
Reviews.Content: Stayed in town on a Thursday night - great location for getting around. Lots within walking distance... $40 cab with tip to airport... 15 minute walk to Granville St. and bars. Would stay again in a heartbeat @ same rate - $200 all in.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Timwit
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at Pinnacle in late November. We flew into Vancouver and did not have a car. The hotel is located downtown convenient to the convention centre and a nice walk to virtually anywhere in the city centre. Close to all the shopping and restaurants that you could want. The city transit can easily take you beyond the area to all kinds of neat places like Stanley Park and Granville Island. The hotel is very nice. We asked for a room on a higher floor and had a wonderful view. My wife loved the extra armchairs and ottoman from where she would relax and read while I did a little business. The hotel staff were wonderful from the bellmen, to the front desk, concierge and restaurant staff. Everyone we asked for help was glad to do it with a smile on their faces. The king size bed was very comfortable, we slept wonderfully. We would stay here again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Treat me well even if I book on Priceline”
Reviews.Author: SafeTravelAdvisor
Reviews.Content: I have stayed three times at the Pinnacle. Twice I booked through Priceline, the trip in between was booked as a regular Marriott rewards guest. They do not treat all guests as equals here and the bad review here is being given after the staff were dismissive of me at both Priceline stays but not at the Marriot booked stay? For the second time I watched several guests in front of me be offered extra amenities and information when they checked in free internet, newspapers, water etc, then when I book in nothing. Not a good practice Marriott. If I am at a 4 star I should be treated like I am at a 4 star, even if i paid less then other guests. The business center is small, hot and the printer smudges. They spray terrible green floral room deodorant that just stinks during cleaning. On a positive note the linens and blankets are awesome at the Marriott Pinnacle.

Reviews.Title: “everything is good here”
Reviews.Author: marny44
Reviews.Content: As noted by many reviewers, the location is fabulous. Many good and interesting restaurants within walking distance, two blocks to the harbor and seaplanes to Victoria, a bit of a walk but doable to Stanley Park, a few blocks to Vancouver's most famous shopping street. It was a little annoying that they charge for internet connection, but that seems to be the trend - free at lower priced accommodation (including other Marriott brands), expensive at the top end places. Nice clean room with very comfortable bed and bedding. Very nice pool and exercise area. Didn't try the restaurant as there are so many great places to eat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Room was small but view was large!”
Reviews.Author: s2rt
Reviews.Content: Hotel had a great location and I really enjoyed the harbor view - worth requesting if you can. Very central location made for easy access throughout downtown and Vancouver vicinity. The room was on the smaller side, but comfortable and up to the standard I expect from Marriott. Staff was courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Business or for Leisure”
Reviews.Author: amtrak58
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a terrific location... close to the water, Stanley Park, Robson Street, Convention Center. Our room was clean and comfortable, and had a wonderful view of the harbor. The staff was friendly and very helpful in recommending restaurants (great suggestions). Good exercise facility and pool... a plus was the steam room and the sauna. A great Marriott hotel in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: rlbarton
Reviews.Content: Just spent two nights at the Pinnacle, loved the location, the room was clean and the bed was great. the only issue I had was when the heat turned on there was quite a loud bang. The front desk staff were friendly and super helpful with giving us directions, everything you want to see is within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “a beautiful hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: readingaway
Reviews.Content: This hotel has many great things going for it: 1 block from the water, 1 block from the Olympic torch, close to shopping and surrounded by great restaurants. We had a problem with our TripAdvisor restaurant coupon but the hotel fixed that the day we got home so we are happy customers. We took the Canada Line train to YVR ...it was about a 10 minute walk to the station from the hotel. We had paid $40 for the YVR to hotel cab and were happy with the $5 (for 2 on Sundays) cost of the train to the airport for a 10 minute walk. Service and food at the restaurant was great. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Can't Go Wrong Here”
Reviews.Author: Dave_S_P06
Reviews.Content: First time staying at this hotel and it was a very good experience. My suitcase was pulled out of the cab before I was out, quick check in and all the staff were friendly. The room was clean and modern, including HD TV. Bathroom had a separate shower and tub and the bathroom products were of higher quality. All and all a good stay at this hotel. The only downside for me was the location. While downtown, it is a bit of a walking distance if you want to go up to Robson Street or Granville. Not a long walk if the weather is nice but with Vancouver rain it is further than some of the other hotels in the downtown core like the Delta I recently wrote about.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Concierge”
Reviews.Author: TheArtLover
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Marriott Pinnacle for four nights. The location -- right by the Olympic Cauldron and the Convention Center and centrally positioned within the city -- was perfect. Each day, we asked Curtis, the concierge, for his recommendation on where to eat for dinner. Based on the criteria we provided for cuisine type and price point, all four of his recommendations were great. We enjoyed each restaurant: Kirin Mandarin Restaurant, Takis' Taverna, Cactus Club Cafe, and Miku (sushi). Thanks, Curtis!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near the waterfront”
Reviews.Author: Debra F
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints about this hotel. The room was modern and clean, the bed was comfortable, and the staff was pleasant! The location is great, walking distance to the convention center/waterfront, as well as other attractions such as Robson Street, and Gas Town. If you're going to Vancouver, this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable rooms very good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ecd3007
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel friendly staff near stanley Park. Excellent breakfast comfortable rooms

Reviews.Title: “4 star everything... here's a tip on parking”
Reviews.Author: hoseman537
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location, great service! Parking is fairly pricey... $26/day or $32/valet. The meters in front of the hotel are free between 10pm-9am and are $5-6/hr there after. The surrounding area is all business district and also will be metered parking but... Just 2-3 blocks away on Jervis street, we found ample, free street parking every time.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: FROMFLORIDA_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel pre and post cruise. Location is ideal for the cruiseships as well as general sightseeing. It is a typical Marriott in decor - comfortable and familiar. The hotel restuarant is truly outstanding. We had dinner there several nights. The meals were different and delicious. Wonderful fish and that should not be taken for granted just because you'er in Vancouver. Service was also fabulous. My only complaint is that the room key which had to swiped for floor access often did not work resulting in a few rides up and down the elevator. If you want the location and the Marriott which I did -- this is a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: ADhalla
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriot over the long weekend in August. The employees were all so very nice and professional, rokms were modern, not too big or small. Beds were comfortable, big and clean, view was amazing. This hotel is very central in downtown, easy to find and get around. You can walk to the main streets, or take a cab to the beach for less than $7. The people all over Vancouver are friendly and staying at he Marriot was like the cherry on top. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Another great Marriott”
Reviews.Author: roadwar1
Reviews.Content: Another example of a great Marriott located in a city center. It's a full service property with all the amenities. Was there on business for a couple of days. Very clean. Great lounge (for golds/platinums), simple location and close to the water front and restaurants. Front desk staff is well trained, very friendly and responsive. Fully reccomend and would stay there again. Already planning my business trips close to the hotel. If you get the chance walk down to the waterfront and try one of the moblie gourmet food trucks. You'll thank me if you are a foodie!

Reviews.Title: “another good stay”
Reviews.Author: heb999
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here several times and always enjoyed the experience. Friendly, efficient staff. Good stylish rooms. The higher floors offer great views. Nice spacious bathrooms with seperate showers. Good choice of tv channels. Good location near the waterfront. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic business hotel.”
Reviews.Author: cosmos292
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days in early August on business, and was fortunate to be upgraded to a VIP room (top floor and view over the bay and conference centre). The hotel is in an excellent location for business being practically over the road from the conference centre. For sight seeing it's pretty central - and for going out in the evening as it's not so far from Gas Town and other bars and restaurants around downtown. The conceirge service was also extremely good. If here on business again I would probably return. I think if I were here on tourism I would be a bit disappointed in the hotel itself, as there communal lounge area by reception is quite limited. The breakfast buffet was one of the best I've had anywhere, and the same goes for the service. But at 30 CAD it is rather over-priced, and I would say the same for the hotel generally given my comments on the facilities and also the rooms were quite tiny even the VIP room. So, I would say - great choice for business - maybe not the best value or facilities for a getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, good staff, but you'll pay for it.”
Reviews.Author: msilvers50
Reviews.Content: This is a fine business-class high-rise downtown hotel in the Marriott chain. The lobby and ground floor restaurant are spacious and attractive the front desk staff are accommodating. We were on the 10th floor facing the water, although another office building across the street blocked our view. The room was large and modern. The bathroom was sparkling and had the latest marble and luxurious shower appointments. The breakfast buffet was good and had been included in our rate. We stayed over a weekend and given this is the business district near the harbor, there were not many restaurant options within walking distance so we ate breakfast here. We walked nearby to Joey's for one dinner (recommended) and took a taxi to Gastown where there are several options for dinner. Don't miss Stanley Park, preferably on a sunny day. Vancouver is a beautiful city to tour, and the Marriott is a luxurious place to stay although you pay for the privilege.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: NoraJG
Reviews.Content: Centrally located .. just one block from the water. Room was clean and well-appointed, however, quite small. Consierege quite helpful in obtaining boarding passes. No problem with the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but pricey”
Reviews.Author: lone_palm
Reviews.Content: I have nothing bad to say about this hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the room was very clean and well-maintained, and the room service food was good. Overall, my only negative would be value for money. I travel to Vancouver on business a few times a year. Considering the number of hotels available in the downtown area, there are always better rates to be had for a similar calibre property. For only that reason, I would not rush back to this hotel. The wireless Internet was reliable, but at $15.95 plus tax, it is difficult to justify. Same for valet parking at $32.00.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: sheryljean
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this wonderful hotel for 3 nights in late August.. Our room on the 28th floor overlooking the harbor was comfortable and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was very nice. The view would have been perfect if a tall apartment building wasn't being built in front of the hotel. The concierge was very helpful in booking restaurants, suggesting restaurants and booking tours.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: slatsp
Reviews.Content: There were some sour apple reviews but we found the hotel to be extremely nice. Room was upscale and had a very good mattress and furniture. Bathroom was nice with glass shower & separate tub and good amenities. Indoor pool, spa & steam room very nice & kept up. Hotel in good location to walk to various touristy areas. Concierge lounge very nice. My wife & I enjoyed this hotel very much. Nice grocery store w/prepared foods such as sandwiches, breakfast items & other meals just across street and down a block. People who said it was a "business traveler or corporate hotel" have a desire to be chummy with strangers. That's why we do not stay at B&B's very often and prefer the anonymity of this type hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely stay here”
Reviews.Author: JohntheLast
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. As the book says, ask for the "19" rooms. We had 3119 (top floor) which had one of the most spectacular views I've ever had (harbor, mountains, boats, etc). Restaurant seems to be ho hum. For those Marriott holders, the concierge room is very good, well serviced, and has great views of the city.

Reviews.Title: “It was a Christmas week end package deal.”
Reviews.Author: ray2joyce
Reviews.Content: It gave us chance to visit with Family before Christmas. A nice break for such a hectic time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic journey”
Reviews.Author: R0dger053
Reviews.Content: After flying into seattle and renting a car to make the easy drive to Vancouver, we found ourselves in excellent hands at the Marriott pinnacle hotel downtown. Easy walking to the waterfront, and short driving to the various hot spots around town, we were able to enjoy a lot of what Vancouver had to offer during our short stay before heading back to seattle. highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “More than a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Ed S
Reviews.Content: As a family of 5, including kids age 10, 12 and 15, we stayed here before/after our 2 week RV trip that took us to Banff. The hotel staff were consistently impressive with their enthusiasm, their attention to our individual needs and flexibility. They were also noteably young, but confident and very competent. For the second stay I had booked the Concierge level, but we quickly realised we should have stayed on the breakfast included tariff from the earlier stay (Concierge lounge was crowded and tables too small. Downstairs breakfast superb!). The manager (David) was very attentive and left a good impression. We had room service 3 nights in a row and the burgers were especially worth a mention together with Granville Island lager..! Nice indoor pool that was never busy. Our kids became big Marriott fans. Not cheap, but nice to receive such a high level of service. The hotel is well positioned for seaplane rides and also shopping at Pacific Centre, where the Food Court is excellent and the Chinese food restaurant worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Dependably Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Caren17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I used points for one of our two nights here (which helped since hotel is pricey) but found it to be worth it. The service from the front desk and the concierge and bellmen was excellent. The room was a little small but was clean, had a comfortable bed and a spectacular view of the harbor (ask for something above the 20th floor). We didn't use the restaurant since Vancouver has multitudes of excellent restaurants -- so many within walking distance of the hotel, including a coffee place around the corner with great teas and baked goods and a place to sit. The hop on/hop off bus stops right in front of the hotel and was a plus at getting us oriented. You need to pay for parking but that is a given in a city with little street parking but our car was always ready within 5 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Amazzing Price”
Reviews.Author: Nick B
Reviews.Content: I actually loved this hotel, I had 2 long days of work and by the time I got to the hotel, I was beat, but fell a sleep so fast in the comfortable bed, even though it was a queen, it was just perfect. The rate was diffinitly a steal for the value you pay. only thing I wished for was free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Would go again.”
Reviews.Author: Threefortheweekend
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable, nice pool and fitness room, friendly staff, good location. Four, not five, because the room keys were a pain and sometimes did not work, the restaurant was pricey with limited selection, and there was no airport transportation. We didn't have to pay, so I can't rate the value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: JPTAust
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay. Room on 22nd floor had fabulous view. Close to seawall and coal harbour. Easy access to city for business.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: trvellinggrandma
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after an Alaskan Cruise. The staff were very helpful in setting up tours of the city and nearby attractions. They also recommended great restaurants. The water views from the 27th floor were barely visible due to a new high rise apartment complex going up.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent restaurant, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gambit4Hire
Reviews.Content: Most importantly, I have to say how incredible the food is in this hotel restaurant. You have to eat here. The stay was wonderful, bed was comfortable, room large and clean. Ordered room service as a treat and it was also delicious. People at check-in were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Jill R
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this Hotel. It had a nice pool and a beautiful breakfast buffett that was included in the price. It was the best breakfast buffett that I have ever encountered. Checking i an out was quick and the staff were very helpful in finding us places.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: thetobo
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. We had booked 2 city view rooms using points and were upgraded to 2 harbor view rooms on a high floor that had excellent views. All of the staff were so friendly and helpful. Would definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but excellence”
Reviews.Author: rockiesho
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night. Front desk staff very friendly. Very quiet high end hotel with a super scenic view of water and mountains. Within walking distance of Stanley Park, Olympic Flame and Canada Place. Personal lost item was found within minutes of notifying front desk. Souvenir shop staff ver friendly. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Place!”
Reviews.Author: monatravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pinnacle for three nights. Our room was wonderful. We were on a high floor and had a magnificent view of the harbor area and the mountains across the Burrard Inlet. The room was exceptionally clean and comfortable. The staff was very helpful and pleasant. I would most definitely stay there again if we return to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Potentially excellent”
Reviews.Author: MDYREN
Reviews.Content: This Marriott has much of what it takes to be an excellent or better property Many of the staff are outstanding in their customer service attitude, this is particularly true of the concierge lounge team. Several front desk personnel made extra effort to attend to our issue but our sense is that these issues should not have come up in the first place. After an expensive unsatisfactory room the first night an excellent front desk staff member moved us to an outstanding but even more expensive room that provided concierge lounge access. THE HOTEL DID NOT EVEN OFFER A SHUTTLE TO THE Vancouver Convention Center just three blocks away!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: goldseashell
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three days last weekend and it was a lovely experience. We enjoyed the space in our corner room on the 16th floor because we were travelling with our daughter and there was enough space for all us. We were disappointed with view of the black building in front of us but we could see a sliver of the harbour. Hence "harbour view room"....... Ask for a room on a higher floor. However, the staff was helpful; the location is great and within easy walking distance to sights and public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Quality”
Reviews.Author: GeraldandMarie
Reviews.Content: We are loyal Marriott fans, and have stayed in Marriott around the world from Paris to Prague, to NYC, etc. This was typical Marriott. Good, but not exceptional, unfortunately. No wireless in the rooms which for a business person was tough.

Reviews.Title: “A good central hotel”
Reviews.Author: fizzyDorking
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we have stayed at the hotel. The location is very good, it is a shame you don't get great views of the water due to buildings partially obscuring the view. It is good that the swimming pool/gym is open 24hrs but the pool is looking a little tired. I also felt the rooms were too, the bathroom was a bit dated but it was clean. Overall though I would recommend this hotel but don't get too excited!

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: FoodieTravelFun
Reviews.Content: The location of this Marriot was quite good and some of the service was good, especially of the bellmen. However, overall our initial experience was far from what we would have expected of a Marriot and it left a bitter taste in our mouths. We arrived after 7:30 p.m. and were asked if we wanted an upgrade to a higher floor for an additional $30 a night. When we decided against it, we were told that there was no room available for us and we would have to wait, despite the fact that we had booked a room and called to confirm a late check-in and our status as loyal Marriot Rewards Members. To clarify, I confirmed that the other room was just a standard one with two double beds that happened to have a partial harbor view and was on a higher floor -- it was not a suite or a larger room. I expressed dismay that we were being asked to wait when it was so late in the day when a room was available. After an extremely sharp and snide comment we were offered the room. It was small and dated. All in all, there seem to be so many great hotel choices in Vancouver, don't bother staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, nightmare check in”
Reviews.Author: muckleloon
Reviews.Content: After 3 hours of being told rooms will be ready "shortly" I was somewhat irritated. By 4pm the lobby resembled a refugee camp full of sad and desperate guests waiting for a room. At 4:30pm I finally got a room and count myself as one of the lucky ones. Clearly they have a serious problem with the housekeeping dept. I travel on business every two weeks and I have experienced what I did today. To be fair to the hotel, the rooms and public areas are nice and the food is excellent. I will likely come back here in off-season but will avoid like the plague in the future during summer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, unfortunately hubby's Platinum Membership was not recognise”
Reviews.Author: DarumaDaruma
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at Marriott Pinnacle due to its strategic location in the city. It's pretty close to the major shopping strip and only a couple of minutes away from the winter Olympic cauldron. Our overall stay was just average: - the hotel we pretty full with patrons (I guess because of peak season) - the lifts didn't function well during NY Eve... it took us forever to wait for the lift (perhaps due to the count-down party on the ground floor) - plus point: the room where we stayed provided a vast array of stationery ie. scissors, spare network cable, paper clips, etc... which we found very unusual (but useful). - we didn't order any in-room dining so I couldn't comment on that; there's a pizza shop just around the corner and 7Eleven shop too. The only drawback was that this establishment somehow didn't recognise my husband's Marriott Platinum membership. Upon checking-in my husband had asked the lady at the reception if we're entitled to get free breakfast (which is very normal for Platinum member), but unfortunately not for this time. No welcome gift either, which is quite disappointing :(

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel; with nice service.”
Reviews.Author: valcarcejim
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to catch a cruise with my elderly mother. Very nice hotel. Very, very clean and great housecleaning and staff. Exercise room was also well maintained. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: raytat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marroitt for 2 nights and it was a lovely place. The room was large and the view was even better. We overlooked the float plane morings and got to see them take off and land. Food in the hotel was pricey but excellent. Staff at reception couldnt do enough for you, if you wanted a taxi the bellman would get it for you and we hardly touched our cases as as soon as they saw you with them they took over and placed them in the cab for you. All in all a great end to a brilliant holiday in Canada

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Winks6
Reviews.Content: OK so it's a bit like a corporate hotel buts it's very, very comfortable, great beds, lovely bathrooms and fantastic breakfast. The location is great just a block away from the water front, easy to get around downtown Vanvouver, really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Bebej1976
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed two nights at the Marriott Pinnacle. In terms of decor and public areas very  little glitz and glamour, more of the functional (which is fine by me). Everything is just 'good'. The rooms are comfortable. At first I was a bit disappointed about being on the 5th floor (there are thirty in total) but once I discovered the 5th floor rooms are the only ones with a balcony I was happy. I'm not the type of guy to make an issue out of a small hole in a sheet or a lose tile in the bathroom but I did take exception to a pillow that was literally covered in long dark hair. Luckily there were about six pillows on the bed so it wasn't a huge problem.  In room Internet was extremely quick (C$15 for 24hrs) and there is free wifi in the lobby.  I found all the staff to be really friendly and helpful. Especially in the restaurant at breakfast (which by the way was a fantastic buffet spread, good value at C$21).  All in all a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, modern, well appointed.”
Reviews.Author: FREEquentFlyerJake
Reviews.Content: Vancouver is a beautiful city with an incredible skyline. A great way to enjoy it is at a hotel like this one that features floor to ceiling, wall to wall windows (with perfect blackout curtains if desired). Rooms have been upgraded to include 40" HD TVs with Marriott's "connectivity panel", Adjustable LED bedside reading lights, and plenty of beverage service amenities (glasses, wine glasses, ice bucket, coffee/tea, etc). My room, 2111, is the smallest on the floor, but it was still spacious and I'd take it again in a second. The bathroom had a separate tub/shower, though I was disappointed the tub wasn't a soaking tub. Bathroom also had a window which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay, but not sure its worth the price”
Reviews.Author: kdd4
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a conference and this hotel was in a perfect location- less than five minute walk to convention center, also very convenient to Olympic Park and to Canada Place which is a popular starting point for city tours etc. The hotel room was comfortable enough and the staff was great, but $240 a night seemed awfully expensive for what it was, especially when they charge an extra $16 if you want to use the internet in your room and the hotel restaurant was so pricey we avoided it completely. If I ever come back to Vancouver and have to spend my own money for a hotel I'll be looking for someplace cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Impecible service”
Reviews.Author: mazereed
Reviews.Content: We were coming off the end of a 12 cruise/tour and chose to use my husbands marriott rewards points to extend our stay in Vancouver for one night. We were off of the ship and at the motel and checked into our room at 8:05 am. The staff at the Marriott were able to give us a room and even on a high floor with a city/water view since they had one available. Not many motels would let people check in this early, but the staff at the Marriott did!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: HMoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice on a recent trip both night before and nights after cruise. First room was small but had lots of furniture and a huge very comfortable bed. Second was a much larger room with all the same furniture. Seems luck of the draw as rooms different sizes and shapes. Shower separate from bath. Pool was good length great, if like us you get it to yourselves. Jacuzzi was good size and nice and warm. Seemed plenty of machines in gym and sauna and steamroom available. Staff helpful but had to put hotel card in lift to stop at your floor and would not work for other floors. Location great near sea front 5 minute walk to Stanley park, less to Robson street. Good breakfast places near, we did not eat in hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good location for convention center”
Reviews.Author: T.B.Patriot
Reviews.Content: It is your safe, good marriott hotel in a good location, walking distance to the convention center. Nothing really special but clean and safe. Had no wireless internet capability in the room as I had to go down to the lobby to use my laptop.

Reviews.Title: “We were impressed and will be back”
Reviews.Author: makawaomaid
Reviews.Content: Just a couple of blocks from the cruise ship dock, the location was perfect for us to spend a few days before leaving on our Alaska cruise. The front desk personel was very friendly, they have a business center and give you a 15 minute complimentary online credit if you didn't bring your computer with you and needed to get online. The rooms were updated, and have roomy bathrooms, thick towels, coffeemakers with "real" coffee mugs. I also enjoyed the workout facility which was open 24 hrs with your room card. Bellmen were very friendly and even suggested we use the coin operation feature for the parking lot instead of the hefty price if you paid at the front desk. Weekend rate was $7 by coin for the entire weekend vs apx. $30per day at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, cramped quarters, delays in checking in”
Reviews.Author: Coastguy
Reviews.Content: This was first stop on a Brendan bus tour of the Rockies. We arrived after a difficult plane flight but after the check-in time. The room wasn't ready. Staff tried to be accommodating during a long wait, even giving a free drink. When we got to the room, it was cramped... Nearly had to climb over each other on the bed to get to the bathroom or door. The ventilation was awful, either too cold or too hot and the vent funneled down on the bed. Yes, centrally located. But I've stayed in many many Marriotts in the States, and would never recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable accommodations with a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: nvtravel31
Reviews.Content: After disembarking from an Alaska cruise we stayed at this Marriott for one night. It is possible to walk from the cruise ship terminal to this hotel but we opted for a quick and inexpensive cab ride as we were toting some heavy luggage. Arriving at 8:30 a.m. I did not expect our room to be available - and it wasn't - but it was not a problem to store our bags. It feels as if the hotel attracts a lot of pre and post cruise travelers and even though there were a number of people checking in and out on a Saturday morning the staff was friendly, efficient and attentive to your needs. The hotel's location makes it easy to explore Vancouver for the day with the hop on/hop off bus and trolley conveniently stopping in front of the hotel. The concierge quickly arranged our tickets and was helpful later in the day with restaurant recommendations and directions. We got into our room at 4 p.m. which had a partial view of the harbor and we were able to see cruise ships pass under the bridge. Overall, the room was very nice with a spacious bathroom and comfortable beds. We did not eat at the hotel's restaurant so I am unable to comment about their food and unfortunately I did not have time to use the hotel's indoor pool facilities. The Marriott is a good choice with a convenient location if you are looking to stay in downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: dcg86
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel - clean, nice decor, excellent service. Very convenient location - we were able to walk to most of the main tourist sights downtown (convention center, Canada Place, seawall, Stanley Park, Gastown, Robson Street, etc...) and walked to many excellent restaurants. The rooms with a harbor view are a little obstructed due to a new high rise being built between the Marriott and the harbor, but still was a beautiful view. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Grandma51
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel located in downtown Vancouver, just a couple of blocks from the Convention Center , shopping, and great food. The hotel is very confortable, good beds and linens. Every staff member that we encountered were friendly and professional. When in Vancouver, we will go back.

Reviews.Title: “really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mulljac
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with my Marriott points so we actually got a great deal for only $50. We were asked at check in if we wanted to upgrade to a water view for an extra $30 and we did. The room was spacious for 4 of us. The view was great. They have a nice indoor pool with a hot tub, sauna and steam room. There is also a small gym with updated equipment. The staff were very friendly and helpful. There is a restaurant and bar. We thought the food was extremely expensive. We had breakfast for the 4 of us and the bill came out to $80 and we only had coffee, juice, bagels and cereal. This hotel is only a few blocks away from Canada Place pier and we were able to walk there with our luggage. Overall the hotel was clean and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Views & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: doremibeverly
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel gets an excellent rating from us. The staff was very friendly and helpful; our room was very clean and had a beautiful view of the harbor. We stayed here after an Alaskan cruise and found it very convenient - it is in downtown Vancouver and is only a short taxi ride from Canada Place. We also found a great online room rate! You can't go wrong here!

Reviews.Title: “Not What You Came to Vancouver For”
Reviews.Author: Holokauahi
Reviews.Content: Smallish rooms, the predictably sterile Marriott corporate appointments, a not particularly convenient location and pricey room rates make this a Vancouver spot to miss. Austere bar and restaurant, decent room service. Walking from the rail line, there are too many really nice hotels to make the trek to the Marriott worth while. Zero curb appeal, poor soundproofing that brings the neighbors to you. The diminutive mini-bar refrigerator was locked, but empty!

Reviews.Title: “Best view of a lifetime of travel”
Reviews.Author: JustCruisin11
Reviews.Content: We wheeled our bags from the cruise ship at Canada Place for three blocks, past the convention center, and it was a breeze. The view was incredible and each room has a window that opens for fresh air. Our huge room had a better than 180 degree view of the harbor and city lights; the hotel is circular and we had a huge room on the 27th floor. Float planes took off and landed while sailboats passed and cruise ships departed for Alaska. It was the kind of room we just didn't want to leave! We'd booked a room with a senior rate/high floor on the Marriott website, and they certainly exceeded our expectations! It wa pricy, but all harborside hotels in Vancouver are pricy, and this was the best of the four we'be tried. It's just an easy five block walk to the Waterfront Sky Train depot, which privided a $3.75 trip to the airport on the Canada Line. (For some reason it's $8.75 in the airport-harbor direction, though.) We can hardly wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Stacieccc
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently located to convention center. A little pricey, but rate included free wired Internet and long distance calling to states. Nice rooms -- would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service but NO WiFi”
Reviews.Author: JaniesWorld
Reviews.Content: The standout of this hotel was the service. Everyone was polite and friendly. They knew us by name by the end of the first day. They were very helpful and accommodating. Unfortunately, I didn't check to see if they had WiFi in the rooms (doesn't every big hotel by now), but they had it downstairs in the lobby. Very inconvenient, but we made the trip downstairs to connect. My husband could not connect and they asked him if he had an IPAD II and he did. For some reason, IPAD II's have a very hard time connecting. We asked for help and they still couldn't hook us up. We were never able to use the WiFi. The location is great, near the Sea Wall, Stanley Park, Robson St. and the Convention Center. We walked everywhere in the city. Very helpful Concierge service with written directions to Whistler, Butchart Gardens, Capilano Bridge etc. There is a car rental agency in the hotel and that was very convenient. Valet parking was very expensive at $35 a night. They overcharged us one night Valet Service but took it off immediately. They had free, big umbrellas for use in the rain which came in very handy. Overall Great Experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent (2nd Opinion)”
Reviews.Author: Mik505
Reviews.Content: In the time from my first review of the Marriott Pinnacle in downtown Vancouver I have stayed another 150 nights in the Downtown Vancouver area between various properties. When rates allow, my chosen place of rest is the Pinnacle. Construction of the Coal Harbor hotel next door is complete, allowing for full sidewalk access and reduction of noise. Views have been severly impacted by the rise of condominiums across the street, though not enough to dampen their enjoyment. Many rooms also enjoy a view of the Olympic Torch - lit on special ocassions. The remodel of the rooms has also been completed, new furnishings adorn each room I've visited recently. Conference rooms are undergoing some remodel, the only evidence of this is a sign in the lobby. The restaurant continues to be a significant area where improvement is necessary. The service is excellent, but the menu is significantly lacking and expensive. Parking is still more expensive than a rental car, but the convenience of the Canada Line terminus at the Waterfront station with direct access to the airport has led me to abandon driving in Vancouver altogether. The lobby wireless is poor but free, rooms rarely get wireless but are all wired. The concierge lounge wireless is adequate and is free for those with access. Marriott grants free access to their elite members in room as well.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Dflyboy
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd time at this hotel and the experience was great. Great room with partial view of the water. Room was what you expect from the Marriot with robes, bar fridge and flat screen TV. The steam room was a great place to unwind. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel, Horrible Beds!”
Reviews.Author: JaniceWa
Reviews.Content: This is a stunningly beautiful hotel. Our room was on the 28th floor facing the water. We could see the mountains, the float planes and a park. Sounds idyllic, right? Well, almost. This Marriott had the hardest bed I have ever slept on at a Marriott. I have booked Marriott hotels many times because of their usually good quality comfortable beds. This Marriott's bed was so uncomfortable that I slept poorly and woke up with sore back, shoulders and hips. I mentioned it to the desk clerk when she asked how our sleep was. She apologized but offered nothing. I was tired and glad I had only booked one night there and I didn't feel like bargaining with them for money off the bill or a discount on a future stay. I will probably not book another Marriott except as a last resort at this point because my last hotel stay was bad and was also at a Marriott affiliate (Renaissance, filthy room).

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service, beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: KDVictoria
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel just after 8 am for a conference. I asked if I could leave my suitcase at the front desk until check-in time, and was surprised that they gave me a room right away instead. The room was lovely with a large patio, very comfortable bed with reading lights, very good work station and excellent TV and A/V setup. The gym facilities are excellent. All of the staff, from the bellhops to the concierge, are extremely friendly and helpful. I had a great breakfast in the hotel restaurant. I look forward to my next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok really...”
Reviews.Author: Africandaisy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 3 times over the last few years - not because I love it, but because I'm working on my Marriott rewards. The hotel itself is standard Marriott, but value for money it is not. For a CAA rate of $179/night you get a smallish room with comfortable beds and a good sized bathroom. The heating/cooling unit is barbaric...it roars to life periodically through the night and is very disruptive. -On the one full day that we were there we were out of the room from 9am to 1.30pm and when we got back it still hadn't been made up. Not good enough - I had to go downstairs and get reception to chase up housekeeping.. -The concierge room for complimentary breakfast etc is not available over the weekend which is ridiculous. -The restaurant is over-priced and we waited almost an hour for a straightforward breakfast for 3 people. The pleasant wait staff was apologetic but it was annoying. -parking is expensive. I want to like this hotel and make it my base when I'm in Vancouver but the disadvantages as outlined above, outweigh the advantages (which are basically location and loyalty rewards) so I think I will try somewhere else next time. On a positive note the doormen/valet parking guys are very good - friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Returned to the hotel for a convention - noticeable improvements”
Reviews.Author: global_pov
Reviews.Content: Even though my last stay at this Marriott Hotel was less than something to be desired, this stay was met with noticeable improvements in the staff attitudes, which in turn made my stay bearably pleasant. Contrary to my last visit, on this visit I was provided with a quiet room that was specific to my Marriott profile, without having to remind the front desk of what my preferences were. This slight adherence by the hotel staff to Marriott's own operating procedures/policies n guest services is all that it took to make my stay so much more enjoyable than before. One issue that this Marriott Hotel has is that it doesn't provide free internet services or Wi-Fi. Instead you have hotel guest huddled together in the lobby area with their lap-tops opened so that they can access the free Wi-Fi that is available there. Not very convenient for someone who travels a great deal and doesn't want to pay the $13 /day that the hotel charges for in-room internet services.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: TheresaR13
Reviews.Content: This Marriott is conveniently located to the waterfront, gorgeous views of the Vancouver Skyline and near many good restaurants. I didn't care much for their restaurant or bar ( boring menu, expensive and really no atmosphere). Everything else was very good, front desk service, room cleanliness, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Without a doubt, I will stay here again the next time I am in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: zooch76
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a fantastic weekend in Vancouver which included two nights at the Vancouver Pinnacle Marriott hotel. I arrived at the hotel via taxi at around 10:30 PM on Friday and check-in was smooth and painless. I requested a king bed on a high floor and was given a king bed on the 21st floor facing away from the harbor. The room was in excellent shape but was a bit small. It had a great setup with corner windows, even though it wasn’t really on a corner, a sitting area and a huge bathroom. The bathroom had a separate shower and bathtub, which was a nice feature but kind of a waste as the tub wasn’t that deep or long so I couldn’t imagine using it for a bath. The stand-alone shower was a little snug and I managed to bump the faucet a couple of times, resulting in a sudden change in temperature of the water. If I was going to redesign this hotel, I’d make the bathroom a little smaller, have a traditional bathtub/shower combo and take the extra space and make the bedroom bigger. The location is excellent, less than a block from the Olympic cauldron, the convention center and BC place. This was my first trip to Vancouver so I didn’t know what to expect and since my room was facing away from the harbor, I didn’t notice any of the above places until I went exploring the first morning. Gastown is a ten minute walk and so is Waterfront Station. FYI - A taxi is about $40 (including tip – yes, you should tip a cab driver) from YVR to the hotel while the Canada Line subway is $2.50/person. If you don’t have much luggage, take the subway and then it’s a 10 minute walk from the station to the hotel. Both a taxi and the subway take about 25 minutes, with a taxi taking longer if there is traffic. Also, I had full cell reception on the subway ride to the airport which was great! I ordered room service for breakfast the first day and was pleasantly surprised by two things: 1) The substituted OJ instead of coffee/tea and didn’t charge me for it. Not sure if that was a mistake or not as I fully expected to pay for it, but it was very nice if it was intentional and 2) they don’t charge any service charges for room service – the price on the menu is the price you pay! That alone enticed me to order room service again the next morning as well. My one complaint about room service is that their “Overnight Menu” is pretty basic and when I wanted to order something at 3:30 AM after a night out on the town the one hot item on it (lasagna) wasn’t available. However, the room service lady was very apologetic and connected me to the local pizza place. They offer both wired and wireless Internet in the rooms (for a charge) but I couldn’t get either to work. However, the lobby has free WiFi so if you don’t have a ton of work to do, just camp out there for a few minutes with your laptop. Every single staff member was extremely helpful and pleasant whether it was giving directions or just saying “Good Morning” or “Welcome back”. Their customer service is A+++. All in all, I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel and will stay there next time I am in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: maldivesod
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel. My standard room seemed a little on the small side, but the bright cheerful decor, the view (floor to ceiling windows), and room confort level made up for the size! Very nice bathroom with separate bath and show, nice toiletries and lots of nice towels. The staff were all very nice and helpful. I would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice city and convention location”
Reviews.Author: Bags Packed to Go
Reviews.Content: Just a few minutes from the convention center. Standard business Marriott with all expected amenities. Somewhat indifferent staff unable to cope with large influx of arriving or departing guests at one time. Had a meal in the bar which was surprisingly tasty. Very nice, chatty barman - a plus for a business hotel where guests may be felling a bit lonely.

Reviews.Title: “So and so...”
Reviews.Author: Vassilis
Reviews.Content: I had a 4-night stay in this Marriott to participate in a medical congress held at the Convention Center, 100 meters away. The hotel is situated in the heart of downtown, near the Vancouver harbor and the sea walking promenade. Check-in was fast. My room was on the 16th floor, overlooking the sea and the city. The room was of rather small size but luxuriously decorated, creating a relaxing ambient, with flat screen TV, coffee maker, as well as a mini bar which was however totally empty. The bathroom was very small in size but it had all the usual amenities. The breakfast, served in the "Show Case" restaurant on the lobby floor, was relatively good but nothing special. It could be better in terms of variety and according to the Marriott hotels chain level. The hotel had also a fitness center and an indoor heated pool which however was not so "heated" and not so well organized (lockers, pool staff etc). The "Show Case" bar in the lobby floor was almost good for a short stay for an after dinner drink. The lobby lounge, in front of the reception area, was very small (a totally of 15 - 20 persons seating capacity). The most negative point of the hotel was that the public spaces, ie the restaurant and the bar "show case", were not so beautifully decorated and attractive to seat, giving a sence of overall poor quality. In contrast, guest floors and rooms gave a sence of luxury and really they were!. All the personnel was well trained, helpful and polite. In conclusion, a relatively pleasant stay in a very beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Job”
Reviews.Author: okwhere2now
Reviews.Content: Visited the Marriott Pinnacle Downtown for a quick trip and I have to compliment April for a great restaurant suggestion, Cactus Club Cafe. She gave us precise directions and it was the exactly what we were looking for. The room was very clean and the rest of the staff we encountered were very friendly and warm, Overall, Nice Job!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: jracleveland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a few days in early January. The rooms were very, very nice, extremely clean and looked as though they had been recently updated. The restaurant and bar in the lobby are pretty good and all of the staff were friendly and understanding during the duration of our stay. Our room was on the 17th floor and the views of the city were breathtaking. The hotel also has a great gym for those who like to keep up with their exercise routine while on vacation. The only real downside was that there was not free internet access in the guest rooms. The cost was about $16 per day. The hotel also charges a daily fee to park your car. All in all, I'd recommend this hotel if you're looking for a good value and a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous staff, the most gracious we have ever encountered”
Reviews.Author: TravelConnoisseurs
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very convenient location, close to all types of shopping and restaurants. The view is restricted to partial harbor views due to the new high rises in front of it. The rooms are nice but relatively small. Our stay was made absolutely perfect by the incredible staff at this property. From the moment we checked in to the moment we checked out it was a pleasure to be there because of the people at the hotel. Our 5 days were perfect (with the exception of the VERY LOUD New Year's Eve party of 1300 guests) , we are planning a summer return. Our only complaint was the hard bed, we did request a mattress pad & were happy with the results.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff - Very Accomodating”
Reviews.Author: Kalvik
Reviews.Content: Check-in went smoothly. Offered upgraded room with harbour view for a minimal cost increase. *** Well trained staff: emergency took place while staying at the hotel. Called front desk and they dialed 911 immediately. Ambulance arrived within minutes. Upon returning from hospital room was cleaned and front desk manager displayed true concern and professionalism. The only choice for a great hotel when staying in Vancouver, B.C.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints, almost...”
Reviews.Author: Canadoc
Reviews.Content: I was at the hotel for a conference. Nice facilities. My room was fairly standard but very clean. Nice linens and comfy bed. I would have expected a mini fridge for the type of hotel. Lobby etc very classy. Security is great. Parking was costly-$26 per day but I was told it isn't their lot. Oh well what can you do. Staff exceptional especially the people who brought room service and cleaned the room. I would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Marriott Service”
Reviews.Author: LUSKJU
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for just one night on a "Priceline" booking. Our check in was swift and courteous and, as always in Marriott Hotels, no mention of Priceline and certainly no "attitude". We were permitted to use our Marriott Card for "extras" and given a choice of king or 2 queen bed rooms. Chose the King and pleasantly surprised that our acomodation was 2 rooms, a bedroom and sitting room. Lots of space and immaculate with a peek a boo Harbour view. Had we been staying for more than 1 night we might not have liked the fact that there was no television in the bedroom. I really like this hotel except for the bar area. We had arranged to meet our family in the bar before dinner and there is just nowhere comfortable to sit - the tables are much more conducive to sitting down for a meal rather than relaxing with a drink. Too bad! Next time we'll have a drink elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view of the harbour”
Reviews.Author: Ivonne33
Reviews.Content: Loved the harbour view...Breakfast was good with orange juice zumo :)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mom2bandc
Reviews.Content: We only had the opportunity to stay in Vancouver for 1 night but this hotel was everything we needed! We had passed a place to eat on the way in and in asking the valet about it he suggested a "more local" place (The Mill Marine Bistro) that was right on the water. The food was fabulous and thanks to the valet we were able to enjoy it. This hotel is very clean and well maintained. Walking distance to the sea wall and convention centre. If you are arriving by sea plane you won't eve need a taxi!

Reviews.Title: “Great location to waterfront”
Reviews.Author: chuyllu
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this location for a conference in May 2010. It had the classic Marriott amenities including a very comfortable bed. It was just a half block to the waterfront where I arranged for a float-plane trip and bicycles could be rented. Easy walking to the park, Aquarium, trendy shops and restaurants. I used the train from the airport which is way cheaper than a cab. The nearest stop was a 10 minute walk from the hotel, which if you had to carry luggage would be a problem.
