My suitcase had wheels so it was no problem.

Reviews.Title: “one night before cruise”
Reviews.Author: IowaHawkgirll
Reviews.Content: Convenient location. Small room but clean and quiet. Close to grocery store to stock up on water/soda to take on board ship. Pricey for basic room without many luxury touches.

Reviews.Title: “Go to Priceline.com for a great deal. Promises to keep.”
Reviews.Author: GeraldinePasadenaCA
Reviews.Content: Great value; great hotel. Met and really exceeded expectations. Close to port of Canada Place where cruise ships dock. Easy walk (w/luggage) from hotel to boarding location. Good for Priceline and the 4-star hotel itself. A keeper.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: irish_cowgirl
Reviews.Content: Rooms and ameneties are beautiful, staff is helpful, perfect for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely views”
Reviews.Author: CoryDooley
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed over the 4th of July holiday, to get out of town (Seattle) and have a lovely holiday w/o kids. I will agree w/reviewers that the rooms are small, however we had marvelous views on the 29th floor (corner room)...plus I don't need much room, just like to lie around. Service was kind, room service for breakfast was doable (we only do tea and biscuits in the morning). Never had trouble w/front desk and we used Marriott points for the entire stay (3 days). Location for views was fantastic, location for walking to great restaurant was so-so. Overall, lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “If it wasn't for the service...”
Reviews.Author: CelesteDenver
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at 3 pm my room was not ready, so they held my luggage and I went for a bike ride in Stanley Park. I stayed on the concierge level, so the rooms may not be representative of what's in the rest of the hotel. My room was a little small, but not a problem. The rooms do have hair dryers which a prior review said they do not. I was upgraded to a harbor view which was nice (but would be better if the other highrises weren't in the way!) The shower was a little moldy and the bathroom generally could have been a little cleaner. The room did pass the bedbug check! The concierge lounge did not have milk cartons or computer access to print out boarding passes. The front desk however, was kind enough to print out my pass and bring it up to the room. Parking was 52 for slightly less than two days on top of an already high room price. The staff at this hotel made up for what was a slightly below average Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: cwberg
Reviews.Content: This hotel had fabulous service and was in a great location. We could see the sea planes taking off and landing from our window. There is a great little breakfast shop right across the street (can't remember name) but if you walk out the door, it's there.

Reviews.Title: “Very new, clean, busy, well located downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: hughseattle
Reviews.Content: I booked thru Priceline and we got a city facing corner room (they are smaller). Yes, there was traffic noise and no hair dryer (have to call for that). The place is well located for downtown access, the $23 parking fee was competitive with the area, and everything was very new and clean for a hotel. I would stay here again without hesitation. Room key was required to enter floor number on the elevator for security's sake (don't leave your floor without your room key!). I have seen complaints about the mattresses here -- they are on the firm side but I slept comfortably.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and good location downtown”
Reviews.Author: tennistraveler21
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Marriott. It is only 2 blocks from the convention center and the harbor walk, and close to numerous restaurants in the downtown area. It's about a 20 minute walk to Stanley Park. The rooms were modern and quiet (although on the small side) and the bed was comfortable. Only downsides are that you have to pay for Internet in their business center and parking is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good (and safe) location, clean rooms, close to waterfront”
Reviews.Author: lhaganmich
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within walking distrance to many of Van. top things to do. The waterfront is a block away from the hotel. Stanley Park is a short walk as is Robson Street. Granville Island is a longer walker- still very doable. Hotel is close to cruise ship terminal. Within walking distrance to public transportation. Hotel is standard Marriott. Clean, looks like it was recently redone. We did not upgrade, but you have the option to upgrade to a harbor view. The pluses (besides location)- umbrella in room, good concierge, nice gym with free apples and ear buds, big bus stop out in front! The minuses - internet airport check-in (would be a plus, but kiosk was down), hotel dining was so-so (many great restaurants within walking distance) and I thought hotel staff were slow checking in/checking out. Also you the tvs did not have on demand movies nor could you view your bill through the tv. All and all, very minor complaints. Great location and umbrella make up for it!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet and close to the business district and conference centre.”
Reviews.Author: dive-girl77
Reviews.Content: I regularly stay at this property or the Marriott Renaisance across the street. My preference is slighty greater towards to Pinnacle as I find the rooms a bit more spacious. The hotel is clean and housekeeping is thorough and attentive. The rooms are not huge but they are functional and the beds are comfortable - not too hard but not too soft. Ocean view rooms offer a nice view of Stanley Park and the harbour. As a business traveller I appreciate a quiet, clean hotel at a reasonable rate. This is the reason I keep coming back. While other guests have commented on the price of parking, internet and phone calls I do not use those ammenities so I cannot comment on them. The concierge desk is helpful and bellmen very quick to hail a taxi. On the odd occassion that I have encountered a problem (clogged shower drain) maintenance has fixed it before I returned at the end of the day. There are plenty of quick and delicious coffee shops in the same block and the hotel is within walking distance of the sea plane terminal, conference centre, sky train, and Robson Street shopping.

Reviews.Title: “A Scam of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MatthewEElliott
Reviews.Content: Will never return to this place. They decided to add a $250 charge for smoke damage in the room. Funny thing is I don't smoke, and am actually allergic to it; as in, my throat closes and i can't breathe. So, after 5 phone calls and an international phone bill that exceeds double digits, nothing is resolved. I have a colleague who had the same thing happen to him, and his money was never refunded. I think the Marriott simply plans on charging a certain percentage of their customers every year just to help the books. Not a way to gain returning customers... I wish there was a rating lower than terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great View”
Reviews.Author: sdsansky
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 nights at this hotel as part of a conference I was attending. My biggest complaint was the bed. Normally Marriott beds are pretty comfy, this one was hard as a rock. I didn't sleep great, but I also didn't ask for my room to be changed. Otherwise the room was fine, I had 2 beds and it was just me so plenty of space. Tub and shower were separate which was fine. Our entire conference was in this hotel and I have to say I was very impressed with the level of service and the quality of the food we were served. Both were well beyond what I would have expected. The location is great-just a block from the Olympic Cauldron, short walk to Robson Street for great shopping and food. Rob, the bellman was beyond great. Very friendly, helpful and gave excellent customer service. I would stay at this property again, even on a personal trip.

Reviews.Title: “Super Nice- Be Prepared to Pay for Extras!”
Reviews.Author: dandcg
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice and comfortable. We had a king size bed that slept amazingly. We booked through a site that gave us an outstanding discount so I wasnt too upset about the price of extras. But just know that parking is $35 a day and internet is $16 a day. We found a closeby cafe where we could use internet but were stuck with the expensive parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: iywv
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location; walking distance to most things you would be doing in Vancouver. We took a bus to UBC Botanical Garden; took the seabus to Lonsdale Quay Market; and took aquabus to Granville Island Public Market, but walked everywhere else. We recommend Sanafir (very lively; multinational cuisines), Jules (cozy; French bistro) and Rain City Grill (On the pricey side, but worth it) for dinner. They were all excellent restaurants within walking distance from the hotel. If you like wines, we also recommend that you bring back some B.C. wines since they are rarely distributed outside Vancouver. We liked those by Okanagan Vineyards and Mission Hill in particular. Parking is available in the same building for CAN26/day; again very convenient. The room had a great view of the harbor and it was clean. We got a bottle of water and a couple of chocolate pieces every night. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Very Expensive Parking- Leave the car at home.”
Reviews.Author: sjanes
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and comfortable although not that big, the sound proofing could certainly have been better as we could clearly hear the people next door talking. We had a partial water view from the 23rd floor and I liked the fact that you could open the window to let some fresh air in, unlike many hotels. The central location was great for walking around the city. Maybe it was just the poor exchange rate and the fact that Vancouver is a pretty expensive city but I felt that the price was excessive even though I got a good rate. The parking was very expensive (in fairness average for the city centre). We could not avoid having our car but if you can do without. If you like to swim it did have a decent sized pool you can actually do laps in.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could live here”
Reviews.Author: luxurylady99
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. It feels more distinct than other Marriott properties. The lobby is very pretty. Sometimes the desk staff are a little cold, but others are sweet as can be. Our rooms are always HUGE! Because its circular, you usually have floor to ceiling windows with a highe drape along the wall. The beds are like clouds. The bathrooms usually have a bathtub and shower. The pool deck is lovely--an indoor space with a small pool. Great sauna and whirlpool. Gym is serviceable. I wish the parking wren't so outrageous, but valet is fast. The restaurant never seems very crowded. We've stayed here 3 times and loved it each time.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: tri13
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. The location was really ideal - easy walk to the seawall, robson, great restaurants, etc. Perfect for excursions to Stanley Park - great location for a nice run. We brought our dog as well ($30 fee), who is rather large, and the room was clean and fresh. we had a wonderful view from the 30th floor of the harbor - which was amazing. and there even was a small window that opened for some fresh air! (kind of scary from the 30th floor, but still nice). We were only here for 1 night for the memorial day holiday but wish we could have stayed longer. the staff were incredibly helpful and friendly. Room was super quiet, even though the rooms right next to us were all occupied. Used Marriott Points so no idea what the value would be, but i'd use points here again for sure. Parking as a guest in the same garage the hotel uses for the whole weekend really was $5, including in and out privileges.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bill925
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our week vacation in Vancouver, B.C. where we stayed at the Vancouver Marriott Pinnacle Downtown. Not only was Vancouver a spectacular city, but the people were wonderful, and the hospitality was great. We had a room on the 24th floor with a full harbour view, and was amazed at the view every time I walked in the room. I stay at Marriotts about six months out of the year, and this was by far the best. The Concierge Lounge was wonderful, with a great selection of food items each evening. Every staff member at the hotel made us feel welcome, and made our stay enjoyable. The Marriott was right by the harbour with plenty of sights to see, and places to eat. The only drawback was parking which ran 26 Canadian Dollars per night, but it was the same everywhere. Anywhere you go in downtown Vancouver expect to pay for parking, as well as just about any place you go to visit. Even in Stanley Park it was about 2.50 Canadian Dollars to park for just two hours. I suggest you take a zodiac tour while there with the "Prince of Whales" tour company. They offer a 3 hour whale and wildlife tour which was great. Even though we didn't see a whale, it was great zipping across the water at high speeds. They do provide you with survival suits and goggles which came in handy with the rain. If you plan to go to Vancouver, by all means, stay at the Marriott, and get a harbour room view. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Best for carporate events.”
Reviews.Author: Nensukh
Reviews.Content: I had been to Marriot hotel, for town hall meeting of by company. We were around 200+ people. Everything was well arranged. We had lot of fun. Food quality was good. Located in very prime location of the downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service....masters of a dying art”
Reviews.Author: goodservicewanted
Reviews.Content: Any whim at your fingertips. Fantastic food. Beautiful views. Unbelievable service from bellboys, concierge, front desk, and restaurant waiters that remember your name after the first visit! Beautiful architecture. We were treated like royalty, thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable and Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: TN Travelr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pinnacle April 19-22 just before taking a Rocky Mountaineer rail trip to Banff from Vancouver. The staff was very nice and the door men very helpful when I ask for walking directions. My check in was quick and the lady who checked me in was patient and pleasant in moving me to another room when I found the first assigned room was odd shaped and had a noisy AC. The second room on 22nd floor was ideal with a great view of the bay and mountains of North Vancouver. My internet connection was quick and I did receive a daily paper. As a Marriott Rewards Gold member I was provided access to the concierge room on 25th floor which has a nice continental breakfast each morning including hot items such as scrambled eggs. My room even had a nice 42inch flat screen TV with HD. You just have to know that the HD channels are higher up the channel list since they also have the non-digital signal of the all the major local TV stations. I definitely would choose to stay at the Marriott Pinnacle if I return to Vancouver. I also recommend Land and Sea Tours for sightseeing since I took to all day tours to Vancouver Island and Whistler. Both trip and the driver guides were super.

Reviews.Title: “Another nice stay”
Reviews.Author: LadnerDad
Reviews.Content: Stayed downtown for two nights to take part in a couple of Playhouse International Wine Fest events. My wife chose this hotel because it is so close to the new convention centre. We had reserved using the Federal Gov't rate since I'm a civil servant, and were given a corner room on the 10th floor. The king bed was nice and comfortable to sleep in. Had breakfast there on our final morning and it was good, though the hotel charged a hotel rate for it. My one small quibble about the hotel was that there was no free newspaper in the morning. This is fairly standard at a lot of hotels I have stayed at, and being a newspaper junkie I needed my fix.

Reviews.Title: “This place was thrown together, and it shows”
Reviews.Author: hokiejonp
Reviews.Content: Ever get the feeling a hotel was built overnight? That’s exactly how my stay at this downtown Vancouver hotel felt. The disorganized staff struggled getting us a room (though were quick to offer a 30 dollar premium for a city view room), the parking though not unreasonable for the city – was a clunky and awkward process (and be sure NOT to pay 26 dollars a night if you are staying over a weekend were the public rates are lower). The Internet was spotty and failed me when I needed it. After checking with the front desk about the poor wired and wireless connection they told me that there was some kind of “server packet issue” and it was normal and just to wait it out (not the thing you tell to an IT Professional who knows better). Lastly, upon checkout I found that the elevator buttons weren’t working to get down to the lobby. I called the front desk and they said there was a fire alarm test going on and we wouldn’t be able to use the elevators for 20 minutes… nothing like lugging your luggage down ten flights of stairs to leave your hotel on time. I guess in the end it was a fitting end to the stay. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel - lost my bags”
Reviews.Author: tsukikage
Reviews.Content: During this particular trip, we stayed at 3 hotels, two Fairmont and this one. I think this was my least favorite, unfortunately. We arrived by car, and although there was a bellhop standing at the door, he neither greeted us nor came over to help us unload our luggage. We had arrived a little early, before check in time, and they didn't have a room ready, but that was fine. We had an appointment to get to, so we left our bags with the concierge and left. We returned later in the evening, had no problem checking in, and were told our bags would be delivered to us right away. The bags came up, but we were short one, so I talked to the front desk. They had someone search for it, and 20 minutes later I received a call stating that they could not find my bag, and could I come down to identify it? So down we went and walked all around their storage room, but the bag was nowhere to be found. By this point, it was getting late, we really wanted to go out for dinner, so with the front desk assuring us that they would find it, we went out for dinner. Thankfully, they had located it by the time we returned, and the front desk offered to buy us one item off the room service menu. Still, the stress and worry over our missing bag was just unnecessary. The rooms were small in comparison to the other hotels we stayed at, but the beds were comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service management, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: global_pov
Reviews.Content: This Marriott location does not seem interested in customer service, right from the check-in clerk, to the customer service manager who is responsible for the front desk..all the way to the General Manager, who failed to respond to my request to speak with him. The hotel didn't appear interested in fulfilling the requests guest profiles, so I suggest that any traveler stay away from this property, since there are other more accommodating hotel chains in the city of Vancouver, B.C.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, but here's a tip”
Reviews.Author: sspc
Reviews.Content: Great stay. Friendly staff, helpful concierge, clean well appointed room, nice locations, good view. All is well. But here's the tip. Parking is a rip-off. when you pull in, you think that the parking attached to to building is Marriott parking, but it isn't. It's public parking. If you pay for it directly yourself at the stall near the elevator, you pay $5 for 2 days. If you inquire at the front desk how to pay for parking, they will put it on your bill for $25/day. Be warned!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: MJSLovelyn
Reviews.Content: The stay was good, with complimentary breakfast - and it was good and hygeinic. Ambience was good

Reviews.Title: “Good, basic hotel for a weekend visit”
Reviews.Author: cashmyre
Reviews.Content: The Marriott hotel chains always delivers. This place had good service, nice clean rooms, and a good location. It's not a 5-star luxury hotel, but we were here with our 3 kids and our friends, and we were out and about the city most of the time, and not hanging out in the room too much. There is an indoor heated pool--always a must when we're somewhere with our kids. Room service and in-room movies on the flat-screen came in handy when one of our kids got the stomach flu and I ended up hanging out for half a day with her in the room. Quick walk to most everything you need in Vancity, although we drove up from Seattle, so we had a car to use when necessary. We got our room via Priceline, and paid only $125 for a Queen-Queen room.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: flyboyarl
Reviews.Content: We were looking for something nice downtown and this fit the bill perfectly. The staff, from the bellhop to the counter service personnel, to the door man were incredibly helpful and nice. We were there the weekend before the Olympics so maybe they were instructed to be extra nice. The elevators were efficient and the rooms came equipped with all the amenities you'd expect: flat screen tv (though no extra channels like HBO, etc.), hairdryer, safe, iron, and plenty of storage. The king size bed with the millions of pillows was also a dream to return to after a day of walking around. The only con I felt was its proximity to where all the action was, closer to Robson St area. It's only about 5 blocks away but it was uphill and with a baby in tow wasn't real convenient. Other than that, we loved our short stay and would definitely return (we also used priceline in conjunction with betterbidding so the price was perfect).

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: saylorchicLA
Reviews.Content: I didn't really like the Marriott Pinnacle. I was surprised that it received 4 diamonds. It didn't seem like a 4 diamond resort. The room was small and amenities sparse. The hotel did not offer any movie selections which was annoying. The light switches were strange - in order to turn on the bathroom light you had to turn on a strangely positioned light in the bedroom hallway. I guess it was based on a master switch, but it was annoying. Essentially the bedroom light had to be on in order to turn on the bathroom light. I was also surprised that they didn't have the comfy "Marriott beds". Our unpleasant experience was most likely intensified by the fact that they were testing the fire alarm while we were there. The location was fine, the view was great, and the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: ZumaMalibu
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on 12/26 with a friend after placing a bid through Priceline. The location is great, only a few blocks to many things to see/do. The room was clean and updated. The room included a wireless phone (you don't find that in the states), and the bathroom had both a separate tub and shower. The gentleman who checked us in was very heplful, recommending restaurants to try and even helping us to find local bars on a map I had heard about prior. He also let us know that we should park in the garage, but not as a hotel guest as it would save us money ($5 for the entire weekend vs. $26 a night as a hotel guest.) Be sure to park in level P3 or lower, as the elevators to the hotel don't go to the higher levels. Everyone here was extremely friendly!

Reviews.Title: “The staff is really exceptional”
Reviews.Author: guy_traveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, the view is really beautiful particularly with a harbour / north shore view. However, what really left an impression on me was the staff. They are professionally in their appearance, manner, and how they do their work. However, they are also down to earth, nice, and a pleasure to deal with. The young lady that checked us in was great, but later on, when she was finding out some store hours for us, the other young lady at check in went outside in the cold, in just her normal business attire, to flag us a cab. The woman in the concierge lounge had lots of work to do, but kept up with it, still made the effort to thank me when I put our plates where they were to go, was very personable and knew how to balance making the guests feel welcome and still keep up with making sure there was food and drink. We had room service - twice - and it was brought properly and in a timely manner. The woman who checked us out was so charming we wanted to come back. I've stayed at a lot of hotels, and most of the time I run into staff that is pretty good...but I've stayed twice at this hotel...and I really liked the staff, they made me feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “It worked for us!”
Reviews.Author: findthefairway
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for just one night, prior to our cruise. Even though we landed YVR after dark, we decided to try the airport shuttle instead of a taxi and were dropped off just across the street...no problem. I echo the other review about possible check-in lines being hit or miss...we had no problem...very brief wait. I was traveling on a discounted rate, and was fortunate to be upgraded to practically the top floor with a waterview...very nice. Our stay here was very brief, but we found the staff to be very helpful, and especially appreciated one of the young bellman's suggestions to try a nearby grocery market/eatery (very upscale with cheeses from all over the world). The bedding was great, the location was excellent for us. Would we have been staying here at regular rate? Probably not....as it was, however, we very much enjoyed the place and I recommend it if the rate suits you.

Reviews.Title: “A slightly above average Marriott”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: I am a Marriott Rewards Platinum member and I spend 100+ nights a year on the road. This hotel is a slightly above average Marriott in comparison of the other Marriotts that I have stayed at. I stayed for four nights at this Marriott hotel. I have stayed at this hotel in the past. Value: At $ 139.00 CAD (a trade show rate) plus taxes per night was a good value. Location: The location of the hotel was very good for me based upon my itinerary for my trip. It took less than 20 minutes (non-rush hour) for a taxi ride (~$ 30 CAD)from the airport. You can take the monorail from the airport within two blocks for $ 2.00 CAD. Front Desk Service: I have to give the front desk a good mark in regards to service. Room: I had a room on the 30th floor. The size of the room that I had was small to average. The shape of the hotel isn’t rectangle…there are curves and some rooms are smaller than others depending upon their location. The bathroom in my room was very small…it was for one individual only…it would have been impossible for two adults to be in the bathroom at the same time. When I stopped by the room of a business associate, the bathroom in his room was much bigger than mine. Room Desk: It has new Marriott desk\workspace. There were several outlets, various inputs to the TV, a CAT5 outlet and etc. It was outstanding. Refrigerator: There was no refrigerator in the room. TV: The TV was a flat screen. One of the two problems that I encountered was with the TV. When I arrived into my room around midnight on my first night, I discovered that the remote control didn’t work (batteries were dead) and you couldn’t use the controls (i.e. channels) on the TV…it was replaced the following morning. After a long flight, I like to rewind before hitting the sack. A few days later, the remote control stop working and they replaced it again. They need to check the batteries. Bed: It was very comfortable. Concierge Lounge: The food selection and quality has deteriorated from my previous visits. Billing: Within minutes of entering my hotel room, I signed up for the Wired for Business plan…high speed Internet service and free local and long distance (Canada and US) phone calls. The cost was $ 15.95 CAD per day (24 hours). This is a good deal since you can easily rack up $ 50 in roaming fees per day if you are using a US based cellular phone service and cell phone in Canada. After I signed up on line for this service, I immediately called the front desk to confirm my Wired for Business purchase as well. When checking out, there were $ 200 CAD of long distance phone calls to the US (the US based phone calls were listed on my bill) and at first, the person didn’t want to take off the charges by telling me that these calls were not US phone numbers and etc. Finally, they took the charges off. AC\Heat: There is a thermostat in the room and the temperature in the room was controlled to my likings. Wake-up Calls: Most hotels have a system that automatically makes the wake up calls. An actual person made my wake-up calls. One time, I hit the wrong button when picking up the phone therefore I didn’t answer the call…within a few minutes, they made a second call.

Reviews.Title: “Worth It If You Redeem Your Points And Stay For Free”
Reviews.Author: MindyLePooh
Reviews.Content: Right off the bat, I have to say that I horde Marriott points when I travel for business and redeem them to stay at Marriott hotels for free when I travel for leisure. On this trip to Vancouver I stayed at the Pinnacle for free, for two nights, and my conclusion is that I probably wouldn't have stayed here if I had to pay for it. I don't think any hotel is worth its rack rate (or even a discounted rate that you can get through hotwire.com). But having said all that, I really enjoyed my stay. The hotel is close to everything (waterfront, Stanley Park, Robson Street, Davie Street, Chinatown, etc.), the staff is attentive, housekeeping is spot-on, view is amazing (24th floor looking northwest). The room even came with a free umbrella that saved my behind as I didn't pack one and it poured the whole time I was in Vancouver. I did not try any restaurants on the property (too many cheaper and better choices elsewhere within walking distance) and I avoided valet parking (I lucked out on self-parking - the parking structure charges $6CAD to park all weekend, with in-and-out privileges; but costs during weekdays is astronomical). My advice is to stay here FOR FREE if you can and park/eat elsewhere. (The long lines due to airline crews checking in/out that other reviewers have complained about appears to be hit-or-miss -- we saw big crews huddled in the lobby a few times but we checked in with nobody else in line and check-out was a non-issue as we just left our room keys inside the room and walked out.)

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay in Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: sforeman886
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff provided us with lots of options for great places to eat and visit while we were in downtown Vancouver. The staff gave us directions to the Olympic venues in downtown and in Whistler. The hotel is in a great location in downtown Vancouver near the waterfront, Stanley Park, Gas Town, and Robson street.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: planada
Reviews.Content: Great lobby, right on the harbor, fun to watch the sail planes coming in and taking off. Easily walkable to restaurants on the water front and wonderful patient concierge services.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: retired and travlin
Reviews.Content: very friendly,,,super rooms,and staff,,,,great restaurant.....and close to the Cruise Docks, takes about 15 walk,,, we really liked it there!

Reviews.Title: “A HUGE disappointment and poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: YYZGuy99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Pinnacle in Vancouver the evening of 23 September. Our three person team elected the property based on the recommendation of our travel agent and what we read on TripAdvisor. Each of the three of us is a highly experienced business traveler. None of us found our experience at the Marriott Pinnacle (Vancouver) to be positive. The main reasons for our disappointment included: • Issues checking in. Took over 20 minutes from the time we arrived (3:30PM) because all of the available counter personal were busy checking out the British Airways crew (it seems this is a common complaint/problem); • While the room was adequate it was small and cramped for the price we paid and certainly not the standard we had expected for the price or what is available at establishments like Hotel Le Soleil, Sutton Place or the Four Season for less; • The bathroom details and the amenities were of a standard one would expect to find at a hotel half the price; • We had drinks at the bar and found the service to be good but have to say the surroundings do not compare with many other nearby hotels; • Each of us felt breakfast service was good but the pricing expensive and poor value for money, (tax + tip cost was over C$30 per person) for something that the word "mediocre at best" describes well. The coffee may be from Starbucks but is was not very good and the espresso very bitter such that it was undrinkable; • One of our party, who normally stays at Four Seasons properties, ate dinner the night before in the hotel restaurant and found it to be average and costly. He described it as “a big mistake”; • Issues checking out: took too long (about 20 minutes); and • We felt we had been “grossly overcharged”. Cost for each of the rooms, including taxes but none of the food or drinks, was C$313.39, far too much for the quality of the product and a real disappointment. There are several fine hotels in Vancouver that offer a fine experience and good value for money. WTS, the Marriott Pinnacle is not one in my mind or of my two colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - we felt at home as soon as we arrived”
Reviews.Author: cheshirepen
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights here in September 2009. At check in I was asked if I wanted to upgrade to a harbour view room for $30CAN a night. I declined and when we arrived at our room on the 27th floor, was I glad as we had a partial harbour view anyway which was perfectly acceptable!! The room was a good size with all the amenities you would expect and 2 large beds which were very comfortable. Good sized bathroom with separate walk in shower - no climbing over bath sides here!! Plenty of room by the wash hand basin to put all your things and there was a really efficient hair drier. Controlling the room temperature was easy and it was efficient and there was also a small window you could open. We had our breakfast in the hotel each day which we enjoyed. We also ate in their restaurant the first evening and this was very good. The hotel was very close to the float plane terminal and the harbour and about 10 minutes walk on the flat to Canada Place. The hop on hop off Trolley buses stop outside the hotel. However, if you want to go further into the city for a bigger choice of restaurants it is all uphill so we used to get a taxi to a restaurant and then walk back downhill to the hotel after our meal. This hotel is not cheap (in fact we found Canada not a cheap country to visit) but we enjoyed our stay and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: afxdes
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Pinnacle in Vancouver during a conference being held at the hotel. The location is good, being in easy walking distance of the bay and the main shopping street. I arrived early, and as my “bayview” room was not ready, they offered me a “cityview” room on one of the higher floors. This made it quieter as there was a lot of roadwork happening outside. The size of the room was what surprised me – it was rather like a largish closet. I had to jump over the bed to get to the other side of the room, and if I pushed the chair away from the desk, it would hit the end of the bed. The bathroom was very dated and the amenities were cheap. The hotel itself had friendly and efficient staff. Reception was, though, a bit of a disaster with too many people milling around. Be prepared to wait 10 ~ 20 minutes to be attended to, and if there was one of the frequent BA flight crew arriving – don’t bother waiting. Breakfast expensive at C$25~30/head – but I must say, I never experienced it as between 7,30 ~ 8.30 am it was a stand up queue outside the dining room as it was not really designed for the majority of guests wanting breakfast at around the same time. You could get better and faster outside at one of the many cafes for about C$15 (full breakfast). We had a meeting room booked for 3 days and the events organiser was very efficient. The coffee though, was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “mislead by other reviews, checked out after one night”
Reviews.Author: gaffelaar
Reviews.Content: As a Marriott fan I found this to be an average minus Marriott (the Victoria Marriott was far better) and instead of staying 6 nights I checked out after one and moved hotel to the Westin Grand. At the Marriott had a 31st floor harbour view room. View was good and the room small but OK. Problem was lack of sleep. The airco was old and very noisy and opening the windows let in even more noise form the rooftop airco machines nearby. We found this to be a problem throughout a two week stay in Canada, but this was the worst ever. I was on the internet at 4am rebooking to another hotel after a sleepless night. Area is also not top. It is OK to get to Canada place and the waterfront but the street itself is dead and lacks city buzz.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location - Nice Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: FoxTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three days after cruise to see sites & sounds ov Vancouver and Whistler. Hotel is perfectly located in heart of city w/lots to do around it. We ate breakfast at little place right across street (Moonpennies) and for $4.50 you can get a huge breakfast. There are numerous restaurants around hotel (5 minute walk to GasTown area for shopping) and I recommend eating at the Elephant and Castle Pub -- great food, atmosphere and prices. Hotel is very nice, room was very large and bathroom has all you need -- the staff is extremely friendly and will provide you with all sort of directions & things to see & do. The bed was very comfortable and the gym has some cardio and a very liitle selection of weights and machines. We did not use any of the ammenities (restaurant, bar, etc.) in the hotel as there are numerous places within 5 minutes Tip: Recommend taking the SkyTrain (Subway) from the airport to the hotel -- cost is $2.50 ($30+ for taxi) and it is a very easy 5-7 minute walk from the train station (Waterfront) to the hotel. We visited the area (rented from Alamo and their location is 5 minute walk from hotel) and saw Whistler and Stanley Park. Overall great vacation & we would most definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sparkling new Marriott with the wierdest shaped room EVER”
Reviews.Author: LondonBusinessAgent
Reviews.Content: The Vancouver Marriott Pinnacle seems to have it all going for it. It is a brand new hotel built in the last couple years with a great location in the centre of the city. Staff were friendly and warm, check in was swift and painless with luggage delivery to the room in a matter of single digit minutes. The concierge was efficient and did not sneer for an instant when asked for the location of coffee shops other than the one in the lobby, or restaurants that did not charge the earth. The room we had assigned was at the front of the hotel and offered great views overlooking the inlet. In fact, looking at the hotels web-site, I would say it was the very room (or same location in the tower) used in the main picture. The room is very odd in shape, the door leads to a short hall (with bathroom to the right) then a curved right hand turn into the room propper. The rounded shape of the building is very obvious when in the room, the shape feeling somewhat like an oddly cut wedge of pie. The upside of this however is that one entire wall (the rounded edge of the pie) is floor to celing windows overlooking Vancouver. Our room was on the 11th floor and had the view partially blocked by the buildings opposite, however I expect that if one had a higher floor, this room type would be jaw on the floor stunning. As this hotel is a Marriott, not much more to add - Marriott bed (one of the best of the chains), Marriott amenities, Marriott Desk, Marriott red glass bubble lamp, Marriott plush carpet etc etc etc as it is in all Marriott's. - Farmiliar, luxurious and 'nice' , but perhaps a little uniform from hotel to hotel by the time you get into the 'gold' status of Marriott Rewards....

Reviews.Title: “It's a Mariott!”
Reviews.Author: HelpfulTraveler
Reviews.Content: Modern high rise, convenient to Robson Street shopping and the Canada Place Port. Large room and bath on the 18th floor. Clean. Excellent Concierge but expensive restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Best Marriott ever”
Reviews.Author: anelizon
Reviews.Content: This Marriott hotel is far better than most of the ones I've stayed before. Considering that Marriott is already a high standard, I would say that the Pinnacle will surpass all your expectations. This hotel is amazing! Beautiful rooms, nice pool and awesome restaurant. Friendly staff during the whole stay. Highly recommended, five star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: quilter9
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and loved this hotel, we were on the 28th floor with harbour views and the views were great the best view was from room 2818 . The rooms were spacious and had a fridge, kettles were available on request and the room had a coffee maker. Breakfast was not included but we went every day to Moonpennies just behind the hotel it was excellent. We did eat in the hotel restaurant and this was really good and the prices where comparible with else where. This hotel is located just minutes from the harbour, and also the main shopping areas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelguylazy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Marriott Pinnacle recently and I had a great experience. My room was on a higher floor and the view (of downtown) was great. It's easy to walk from the hotel to the most downtown area restaurants and attractions. The parking can be expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: dentaltraveler
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an overnight at this hotel. Staff were very helpful and went out of their way to help us see as much as possible in a short time. The location couldn't be better. Was directly on the bus line (Pacific Coach) and we were able to walk all over downtown Vancouver. Rooms were clean and lovely. Bathrooms spotless. Beds very comfy as usual in a Marriott. We would certainly recommend this hotel if you are visiting Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: sharknes
Reviews.Content: Everything here was fine except I had a problem with the internet linking up. Other than that everything was great and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An experience not to be missed”
Reviews.Author: Canada1andonly
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Canada and we picked the best hotel - it was excellent. Service was fantastic with nothing too much trouble - it made the holiday. Restaurant had great food and wine - we would fully recommend this hotel. We will certainly be staying there when we go back. Rooms were very clean and spacious - try and book a bay view if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In My Lifetime - A MUST STAY!!”
Reviews.Author: Metamorp
Reviews.Content: This hotel is Fabulous! Not to mention the grand area, Beautiful Pool and Rooms, And a Overall 5 Stars. There was nothing wrong with the service at all, Perfectly friendly and efficient. Nothing much else to say about this hotel but that its a grand stay and you will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Convenient and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Andy_L680
Reviews.Content: I have used this hotel several times as an overnight stay when arriving from or travelling back to London. I know that I am always going to have a comfortable bed and a good night’s sleep with friendly and warm Canadian service! The reception and concierge staff are very efficient and make you feel that you have “come home”. Nothing seems too much trouble. Rooms are large and if you are higher up the building you have good views across the river including to Stanley Park, Lions Gate Bridge, the Float Plane Terminal, etc. Executive Rooms have bath and separate shower cubicle. If you've got the energy there's a huge swimming pool. Staff in executive lounge are particularly helpful and can resolve any queries about what to do in Vancouver. Restaurant food is excellent with attentive and friendly staff. This is definitely a hotel I shall use when in Vancouver again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel in Central Location”
Reviews.Author: rjc260
Reviews.Content: We had no complaints regarding our stay here. Our room was on a high floor with wide floor to ceiling windows and superb views. The shower was a little small but the room was large enough. All furnishings were in good shape and the room had a contemporary look. We had a decent breakfast on the concierge level..another fine view but a little crowded. The lobby isn't that exciting..there is a restaurant/bar that always seems kind of sleepy when we walk by. The valet service was exceptional and very welcoming..wish the front desk staff had the same atitude (not bad just seemed to have lack of energy). Fitness center was very good and had nautilus, some free weights and cardio equipment. Overall a very high quality property that is in a great location. We would recommend staying here if you are looking to be downtown or near the water.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Mel_fuzz
Reviews.Content: The first plus about this hotel is its location. It is so close to everything so there is no need to rent a car. We arrived around 10.30am and there was no room available but they hoped to have something at 11.30. They took our luggage and we went for a short walk. At 11.30 it still wasn't ready but they did have a room on the concierge level which was $60 a night extra. It included free internet and free breakfast so decided to go for that. The room itself was of standard size but the bathroom was huge. The major disappointment was the shower. Its a good size but the water pressure was awful. It felt like light rain rather than a shower. The only other minor issue is the tv was not good quality - towards the edges the picture got distorted. The bed was extremely comfortable and turndown service was a nice extra. The internet was a good speed. The breakfast was good. There was a limited amount of hot food but the fruit was fresh and the pastries were fantastic. We ate twice in the restaurant and found it great both times. The food was fantastic and staff very friendly. Overall our stay was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Epitomy of Comfort & Convenience”
Reviews.Author: dandms11
Reviews.Content: Just what you would expect of a Marriott. Beautifully furnished rooms, superbly comfortable beds. Friendly helpful staff. Convenient to downtown Vancouver and the old Gas Town area of shops and restaurants. What more can be said. Good value for high quality. Take a trip on the city tour tram and up to Grouse Mountain. A day trip to Whistler is a must by the Rocky Mountaineer - but return by road or even better Sea Plane!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but well located”
Reviews.Author: Have_Bags_Can_Travel
Reviews.Content: The Vancouver Marriott Pinnacle is pricey but given its location that isn't surprising. It is moments away from the waterfront and not far from the famous Gas Town. We had a 'View' type double room on the 29th floor which, as the name suggests, looked out over Vancouver harbour and across to North Vancouver. Couldn't really ask for more! Excellent location, service and facilities. We did notice some major construction work across the road infront of the hotel. It is possible that once finished, the new building may block some of the view.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SurfaceTravel
Reviews.Content: Although a fairly typical bog-standard North American business/leisure 5-star hotel, the Pinnacle did tick all the boxes and it does have a good location. Our view was all right, if not spectacular, parking was easy, the breakfasts were excellent, and the rooms large. We were able to easily walk to anywhere in the West End and to Stanley Park. I don't remember hearing any noise from the hallway or other rooms. We had once stayed at the Fairmont at the waterfront and, over-all, I think that was a better hotel, but the Pinnacle's location would make me choose it the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in the heart of downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Generic90
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vancouver numerous times, and when I have stayed there on previous occasions, the hotels have run the gamut from decent to poor. On this occasion, while attending a Canucks hockey game, I decided to give the Marriott Pinnacle a try. The property is relatively easy to get to, though it could be easy to miss as the signage on the side of the building is somewhat subdued. But from check-in throughout the course of the stay, the guest feels as if he is in a luxury hotel. I had a room on the top floor with a king bed and harbor view. The decor is standard Marriott - nothing terribly flashy - but the layout spacious and very comfortable. The view was panoramic and provided much scenic beauty. The bathroom was also spacious and featured stand-alone shower and bathtub. There is turndown service in the evening, in which a complimentary bottle of water is provided. From a location standpoint, the traveler couldn't do much better. Since the hotel is in a business district, the hustle and bustle does taper off in the evenings. But one is virtually steps away from Canada Place (including a SkyTrain stop), and a 5-minute walk from much of the prime shopping and entertainment in the downtown core. I walked to and from GM Place for the hockey game, which was an easy 15-minute walk. Parking is in a garage below the hotel; guest have the option to self-park or valet (I chose self-park, which was easy). I did not have much chance to sample the pool or other facility amenities, with the exception of the street-side lounge, which offers a nice range of drinks and - even better - late-night dinners after other restaurants and room service have closed. Breakfasts are also superb. Service - from the concierge to the front desk to servers and housekeeping - are all first-rate. The room rate - with the currency exchange factored in - was exceedingly reasonable given the quality of the facility and overall experience. I would definitely stay at this hotel again on future overnight or longer stays in Vancouver, and would recommend it wholeheartedly to friends and family alike.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: koshigatana
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, neat orderly. The rooms were spacious and cozy. Great bed. The staff at the hotel are what made my two weeks there unforgettable. They were at all times professional, courteous, kind and went more than once beyond the call of duty. This was everyone from the bellman to the manager. I travel allot and I cannot remember the last time the service of a hotel has impressed me so. The showcase bar & restaurant in my view is a waste of time. We had martinis and were not impressed, breakfast was also nothing to write home about.

Reviews.Title: “Attentive service, wonderful views, yummy pizza...”
Reviews.Author: Tagger87
Reviews.Content: I just completed management of a small 3-day meeting at the Marriott Pinnacle and was very pleased with the property. As a meeting management professional, I work with many properties and was pleasantly surprised by the attentive service provided to our group. The front desk, bell staff, concierge and valet were friendly, courteous and very helpful. They went out of their way to get to know me during my 4 night stay. The banquet staff was also very attentive and helpful. The rooms on the upper levels have wonderful views. My attendees were very pleased with them. Housekeeping did a great job in quickly cleaning and refreshing the rooms. I had lunch one day in the Showcase Bar. The pizza was excellent. I'm sad that I didn't go back for another one before I left! We negotiated the inclusion of the internet/telephone package in our contract. But I was pleased that the small business center near the lobby was accessed for free, free internet, free printing and free basic photocopying. This was a refreshing change from most other properties I've visted recently. The location was great. Close to restaurants, Robson Street, Granville, Canada Place, etc... This was definitely one of the best Marriotts I have seen in North America. I was very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised.............................”
Reviews.Author: martythemonkey
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for the price. I booked the hotel via a third party booking site and got a great rate - booking this way is not somthing I do often, but the rates in the City were crazy during this time period so I went this route. The rooms were cozy and the staff were wonderful. The charging for pretty much everything you use is a downer; however, the internet / long distance package for $15 a day is well worth it if you want to talk on the phone for any amount of time at all. I didn't use my cell phone at all while in the hotel - as it was included - great value and more hotels should copy. The lounge was great also.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel lacks the luxurious feel that comparable hotels have.”
Reviews.Author: travellingwife6
Reviews.Content: It had all the basics, nicely, but no "pampering". No warm bathroom floor, only basic toiletries, no make up mirror, nothing. Lots of extras to buy - $26/day pkg., $15.95/day internet, $4.50 bottle of water, $1/ newspaper left at door, etc. etc. I don't know about anyone else, but I'm sick of getting nickle and dimed to death, when I've already paid a good fee for the hotel. Ironically, less expensive hotels often include more. However, back to the Marriot, I've stayed at 3 comparably priced hotels in Vancouver - the Pan Pacific , the Sutton Place, and the Fairmont, and they had it all over the Marriot for elegance and luxury. I'd suggest either of them over the Marriott. I don't see 4 stars for this one, I'm sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice to stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: cdnmo22
Reviews.Content: While on a recent trip to Vancouver we stayed a week at the Marriot Pinnacle. Hotel is clean and central to downtown. Staff are friendly and go out of the way to help you out. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business meetings, location, and food.”
Reviews.Author: isen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel(3 nights) as part of the organizers for a conference. Staff, food, and service were very good. My room was on the 29th floor which had a superb view facing the Burrard Inlet and the North Shore! Absolutely beautiful. Staff were very helpful, friendly, and accommodating to our needs. Food was fablous: great hot food items for breakfast (scrambled eggs, sausages, and bacon); lunch - grilled mahi mahi tuna, phyllo pastry, greens, hot sandwiches; breaks - lemon tart, nanaimo bars, rice crispies, brownies, cinnamon twists. Meeting rooms were spacious and roomy. Overall it was very good!!

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel, comfortable with very good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ontheotherside
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with my recent stay at the Marriott Pinnacle in Vancouver: the hotel rooms are quiet and nice (see attached picture), the view is great and the breakfast is very good. One of the best features of the hotel is the Concierge Lounge, where you can have breakfast and afternoon snacks in a quiet atmosphere (You will need to have a high Marriott Rewards status to access the lounge, though). One drawback of the hotel is its location, way too close to the buildings currently being erected in Coal Harbor, hence creating noise from 8am to 6pm. If you want full quietness for example to work from your room during the day, the Westin is a better option, as it is located off the contruction zone while still being within the Coal Harbor district. The gym at the Marriott is subpar.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: TuttoBene
Reviews.Content: I had a layover in Vancouver BC and my connecting flight home got cancelled for several days due to the Holiday snow storms. Instead of fighting with the crowds at the airport, I decided to camp out downtown. The check-in staff was amazing. We told them that we were stranded and would be in town for several days. They went above and beyond when it came to making my stay comfortable. They helped with extending my stay everyday after my flights were cancelled and even helped me find a rental car when I found out I wasn't going to make it home for Christmas. I was upgraded to a suite on the 23 level with a great view of the city and the water. The room amenities, decor, and furniture were amazing. Plus a great bathroom. I plan on returning in the spring to enjoy more of Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice!”
Reviews.Author: mrslauer
Reviews.Content: Booked a #19 room - thanks Tripadvisor - the view was spectacular, overlooking the bay and mountains. Everything was perfect. The concierge extremely helpful with reservations. Good location, near Skytrain and bus terminals. Excellent bartending in hotel bar - give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: frequent-traveler3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pinnacle for eight days and explored B.C. the best we could, there just isn't enough time to completely enjoy this jewel of western Canada. The Pinnacle is an excellent hotel with several amenities that you would expect. The restaurant on the bottom floor (name escapes me) is very good and going there instead of going out after a busy day is an excellent option. The Chef is a national award winner in Canada and any entree is a winner, too! The staff are very friendly and overall quite helpful. We had room service one night, and the attendant was so nice he brought complementary cheesecake and a local bottle of white wine. The room was spacious, comfortable with ethernet and quite nice with a great view. If a great view (north) is important, make sure you request it in advance. Parking is valet or you can do it yourself in the garage, either way it's easy. Okay, now for the criticism. We arrived at 5(ish) pm and our room was not ready, not good. I had an 18 hour travel day and I expected my suite to be ready. I waited for 40 minutes... This was not a good first impression after an already long day. All things considered, the Pinnacle is a great hotel with an excellent location for downtown Vancouver and close to Stanley Park (must see). Vancouver is an expensive area, so be prepared to budget an extra 15-20% in your travel budget. However, if you're a savvy researcher and plan trips like we do, you'll have a great time without getting caught in the hype of the fashion and shopping districts. There is A LOT to do!!! Have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Classy service in an above-average hotel with cracking views”
Reviews.Author: Stevie390
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Pinnacle hotel is located in the heart of the business district, close to the seaplane terminal and not too far from the shopping areas. The Airport Bus stops at the Renaissance opposite, but its very convenient. The hotel was of a high quality. The room was compact but had a superb panoramic view across the harbour so I was able to watch the seaplanes take off and look over towards North Vancouver and Grouse Mountain - very impressive. Breakfast was a little disappointing. There was a queue on both days that I was there, which shouldn't happen in a hotel of this quality. Service was good, although the buffet choice was slightly limited for a hotel of this class. I only had a room service meal, but that was top quality. The hotel has a small business centre with internet access that is chargeable. The front desk staff were superb.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Property”
Reviews.Author: Davidwatts
Reviews.Content: WOW! I was very impressed with this hotel. Very nice rooms, clean, well furnished, although not especially distinctive - standard Marriott decor. The staff is universally outstanding in all aspects of their performance. Great fitness room, good business center. The location is good, in the financial district and near Robson Street shopping, restaurants; not far from the crusie ship terminal and not far from the Waterfront and Burrard SkyTrain stations. The lobby is a bit small and unimpressive, but really, so what? I stay in 12 -15 hotels each year and this is the nicest all around property I've been too in good while.

Reviews.Title: “Brutal”
Reviews.Author: 123google123
Reviews.Content: Brutal.......... Valet dinged our car up and the toilet didn't stop running. Also, the room is so small you couldn't spin a top!! There was so much hair in the tub's drain it took forever for the thing to empty. Would not recommend at all. Had a better night at the Holiday Inn Express in Richmond..........brutal.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Marriott”
Reviews.Author: smvhou
Reviews.Content: Typical downtown/center city Marriott with no disappointments. Only 5 minute walk from SkyTrain Station direct to the combined AMTRAK/BUS Station, & soon go to the Airport (thanks to the 2010 Olympics). Recently remodeled. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rmpCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Pinnacleon 9/12, the night before our Alaska cruise. It was a wonderful experience. The customer service from every single employee was outstanding. This was the best experience we have ever had at any hotel. We had a corner room that looked out over the pier. The bed was very comfortable and the bedding luxurious. Although not a huge room, it was fine for the two of us; It certainly was larger than our stateroom on the ship. There were very nice toiletries including Neutrogena facial cleanser and moisturizer.

Reviews.Title: “Short but Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: lilchickadeesmommy
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay over Labor Day weekend. We checked in early on Friday and had a room on the 27th floor with a wonderful view of downtown, part of the port and the moutains. The hotel staff were very friendly and accomodating, attending to our needs very promptly. We travel with our 3 y/o so we're very fussy about who we stay with. We booked directly with Marriott, our room rate had included daily buffet breakfast for two (it would otherwise be approx. CAN$22 I believe) and daily valet parking (CAN$29 daily). We thought it was very affordable considering the comfort and great location. We would definitely return the next time we visit Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Despite a few problems, this is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dam&gwb
Reviews.Content: Near the end of our 3500-mile driving trip through the western U.S. and Canada we stayed in Room 1516 at the Marriott Pinnacle Hotel in Vancouver, BC. The Pinnacle is located a short stroll from the waterfront and Stanley Park is within walking distance. The main business district is 3 or 4 blocks away. Upon our arrival the front desk receptionist, “Kat”, tried to get us to “upgrade" into a $50/night more expensive "room with a better view", but did not initially say that it would be at our expense. When we found out that we would be paying for it, we declined. “Kat”, at the front desk was aware, from our Marriott Rewards member profile that we wanted a quiet room away from ice machines and elevators. “Kat” confirmed this with us at the reception desk. Nonetheless we were taken to a room on the 8th floor directly opposite the ice machine. The bellman who accompanied us, Taylor, phoned “Curtis” to get our room changed. "Curtis" also hit Taylor with the $50 upgrade suggestion which once again we declined. Curtis then "found" Room 1515, a double-double that had "just become available". While waiting for an appropriate room at our reservation price of $239/night before taxes, we had time to read the fine print on the keycard envelope saying that it was the responsiblity of the guest to decline delivery of USA Today or the Wall St. Journal or else Marriott automatically charges $0.75/day for it. We called to decline as soon as we were settled. The Pinnacle charges $15.95/day for wired internet – highest rate on this trip to date – but it does include local and long-distance phone. The internet works fine, as it should at these prices. The bathroom was the best of trip with a huge countertop and a separate stall shower. The air conditioning works well and the bedroom is nicely furnished with comfortable beds and a corner window -- mostly overlooking other nearby buildings. Upon our arrival we found a partially used $4.50 bottle of water in the bathroom and it took 2 calls to the “At-Your-Service” line to get it removed from the room and off the bill. We also had to call “At-Your-Service” once, and got quick response, to get a water glass for the bathroom after housekeeping removed the one we'd been using. Apparently at Marriott hotels there is some sort of contest between housekeeping and room service regarding which is responsible for providing clean glasses for guests. We're not sure if it's housekeeping taketh away and room service returneth, but Marriott management sure needs to figure it out. Except for outrageous laundry prices, we enjoyed the rest of our stay at the Pinnacle. The doormen, bellmen and valet parking staff are great. Whenever we returned with our car they would welcome us "home" and ask when we would next be needing the car. Whenever we called "At-Your-Service" to ask for the car it was there when we got to the lobby. The bottom line is that The Pinnacle is a very good hotel. The front desk and housekeeping staffs need to clean up their acts, but they were redeemed by the friendliness and efficiency of the staff at the front door and by the comfort and convenience of the guest rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: mcxl5
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several Vancouver hotels -- with the exception of the Fairmont Vancouver Airport, this is the best. Service was fantastic. Food was great. View was unbeatable. Really couldn't ask for more. Yes the price is high - but if you do not like the price you do not have to stay here and in my opinion the price is actually worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view”
Reviews.Author: Solochicky
Reviews.Content: We paid for our stay mostly with Marriott Points so please take that into account when reading this review. We were very pleased with the location and the fact that our room was available when we arrived at lunchtime on the day of check-in. Yes, the carpeting and the bathroom could use some updating as could the TV and TV wardrobe but all that was trivial when it was compared to the view. I can only imagine what the view was like before the office buildings across the street went up but we were in room 1602 and had a full wall of panoramic windows. Unbelievable. We could see the water and the mountains and the beautiful blue sky. The bed was pretty comfortable and the linens were the updated Marriott linens. Didn't eat at the restaurant so no comment there but there are many coffee shops nearby and it is within easy walking distance to several bus stops and the Sky Train. Overall, it was a good choice for our Vancouver stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Xcalibur
Reviews.Content: I took my girlfriend to the Marriott to propose to her. So I had emailed them earlier to ask for a nice ocean view room, and anything extra for the special weekend would be appreciated. Before the stay, I emailed the concierge several times to get advise on restaurants and cruises to book. He was very helpful. I booked a package with buffet breakfast and valet parking included ($299). When we got there, they had upgraded us to an ocean view room. The front desk, the concierge, customer service, valet parking and especially the waiter at their restaurant during breakfast were very, very courteous and helpful. They arranged for champagne and chocolate covered strawberries in the room, for when we returned after dinner and the proposal. My girlfriend and I were overjoyed with our stay and made the weekend extra special. We have stayed at Fairmonts before, and this is the first time we have ever stayed at a Marriott. We thought Marriott's service was superior to Fairmonts. After we got home, they even sent us a postcard thanking us for staying there. This extra touch just raised our opinion of them.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel desperately needs a competent general manager”
Reviews.Author: Elithecat
Reviews.Content: I'm really furious with the online site that classified the Marriott Pinnacle as a four-star hotel and then booked us there on my bid of 200.00 a night. This is NOT a four-star hotel. The room was small and the staff was completely incompetent in absolutely every transaction and encounter, from our check-in, when the person at the desk commented, in a friendly way, "Wow. Your room is really small but for 50.00 more I can give you something with a view," and then proceeded to try and up-sell us on everything he could think of through our check-in, to the miserable performances of the bell and parking staff....I'm simply positive that many of them had decided to go on break, or simply hide, during a.m. checkout on the day we were trying to leave. For long stretches of time, not a bell person nor a valet parking person was to be found, and the front desk staff, including the concierge, adamantly refused to (a) find us someone, or (b) acknowledge that there was no one on the floor, or (c), at the point of desperation, to give us the stupid keys to our stupid car so we could get out of there. We are pretty sure that the problem is management. No one was in charge, and this busy hotel desperately needs to have its various parts coordinated by a supervisor. On the upside: Vancouver is beautiful and wonderful under all circumstances....also, if you pay that extra 50 bucks (yes, we caved), the views over Coal Harbour from the 24th floor are stunning, and make up for the size of the room (if not the aggravation).

Reviews.Title: “WOW but not that WOW”
Reviews.Author: tigme
Reviews.Content: We were very tired of driving and not knowing the city we took the place we found. When my partner returned to the car after booking the room, I was aghast at the cost. $300 per night and $23 per night if we park our own car. I thought the room should be spectacular but it was average, no better than any $150 per night we have had. The only asset was the bedding was luxurious. The room was clean and tidy but not worth $300. If we were not so tired we would have kept looking. That's what I get for not prebooking an online hotel. This was a spontaneous 3 day get away and boy were we astounded at the prices in BC. May come back but, not to this hotel unless I bring a number of friends to share expences.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: heb999
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here three times. I like the large windows and the fact that my room has been rounded, not square, owing to the shape of the building. Very comfortable bed, good bathroom and a good choice of tv. channels.Good staff and a good breakfast. Location is good near the waterfront and a short walk from the shops. The first time I stayed I had a great view of the water, the second a small balcony but the last time I was on a low floor and felt a little overlooked by the surrounding offices. So I recommend asking for a room on one of the higher floors.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great views”
Reviews.Author: obdocSanJose
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel in July for a professional conference. The hotel staff were very nice and always helpful. The woman helping me at check in was so kind to give directions to a nearby restaurant when we requested a place to eat near the hotel. I was sent an email requesting my preferences prior to my stay and a top (30th) floor room was reserved per my request. It had a lovely view of Coal Harbor and the mountains in North Vancouver. I had 2 queen beds and the room was not overly crowded as it was only my daughter and I staying together. The bathroom has a separate shower and tub which was nice. The gym facilities and indoor pool were great. I used the workout room each morning and pool each evening. Although the hotel was very busy during my stay neither were overly crowded. There is also a jacuzzi spa, dry sauna, and steam room. The mattresses are firmer than what I am used to but comfortable and the linens are luxurious with lots of pillows on the bed. The TV broke down on our second day but a repair engineer was sent up right away and it was fixed within 20 minutes. Likewise a request for toothpaste received prompt attention. I didn't try the hotel restaurant and I didn't bring a car so I can't comment on those aspects of the hotel. The conference facilities were very nice and conveniently located to the rooms. They provided a full buffet breakfast every morning with Canadian bacon, sausage, bacon, eggs and pastries. I can't recall a conference which served a full breakfast like this. There were also wait staff who were extremely friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel is perfect. If one is in moderately good physical shape nearly all downtown locations are within walking distance. The waterfront walkway is absolutely lovely. Stanley park can be walked to but is absolutely huge. Renting a bike will allow a better exploration or plan to use the free shuttle in the summer. The Burrard skytrain station which is essentially an above ground transportation is very close by and got me to and from the train station in downtown. We even took a bus from the Burrard station to get to the ferry terminal and took BC Ferries to Victoria on Saturday. Robson street is nearby with a vibrant night scene and lots of places to eat and shop. Moonpennies across from the hotel serves a nice breakfast and Starbucks is on the other corner. We did go to Chinatown on Friday night for an open air market - caution is recommended in surrounding areas as homeless people with drug and mental health issues hang around on the surrounding streets. The open air market was fun and there are a lot of fresh food stalls to eat and stalls to buy all sorts of imported items, jewelry, socks, knickknacks, etc. Vancouver is a wonderful place to visit in July and the Marriott Pinnacle is a great choice of location with wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “MARRIOTT PINNACLE IS A GREAT CHOICE IN VANCOUVER”
Reviews.Author: KULADOG
Reviews.Content: A wonderful choice for our three-night pre-cruise visit to Vancouver was the Marriott Vancouver Pinnacle. I chose this hotel because of its downtown location. We were able to walk to all of the sights we wanted to see...Stanley Park, the harbor, Gastown, Chinatown, False Creek. We were also very close to the main cruise terminal, Canada Place. However, note that not all ships leave from this dock. Ours left from Ballantyne Pier, a 10-minute cab ride from the hotel. Our flight arrived mid-morning and the desk clerk was very accommodating in putting a rush on our room and holding our bags until it was available. The concierge was helpful in encouraging us to walk (instead of taking a bus) to nearby Stanley Park. Our corner room was very spacious with two walls of floor-to-ceiling windows. The bathroom was very well appointed....granite countertops, large tub, separate glass shower and a window. If we return to Vancouver, I will certainly book again at the Marriott Vancouver Pinnacle.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to the usual Marriott standards”
Reviews.Author: franzen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with high hopes that the Marriott Brand comes with an assurance of quality. The hotel itself is well located near to downtown and within walking distance of Stanley Park / west end / downtown. The hotel was certainly not of five star quality and someway below four star standards. Room was small and no bathroom toiletries such as shampoo or conditioner were provided. No bathrobe in the room and no minibar- if you wanted provisions then there was a kiosk service which you could ring down for which was inconvenient. I asked for an adaptor and a $20 charge / deposit was added to my bill for this. Internet connection extremely fast but again pricey for 24 hour use- not wireless in the room (wireless only in public areas). The staff were generally friendly and eager to please. Laundry was not returned within the day for regular service- arrived in the middle of the next day when I enquired about it. It seems as if the hotel has lost touch and is perhaps relying on its brand recognition for custom. For a Marriott it disappointed for the price paid ($225 ++ a night) and would consider Westin or Sheraton better bets. It will be interesting to see how the Shangri La's arrival (2009) forces hotels in Vancouver to pull their socks up a bit. Good location wise, but better service, rooms etc available elsewhere in Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Looks out over the water and the seaplanes.”
Reviews.Author: MrAJZ
Reviews.Content: We had a great view from our room - 30th floor, looking down on the water, with sea planes taking off and landing right in front of us. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The concierges directed us to a great restaurant (Joe Forte's) and they helped us navigate the city for our one day trip. If one person wasn't knowledgeable, there was always someone else to help. The room was a fairly typical Marriott room. The bed was comfy, but that is more than expected in a Marriott these days. The room is near all of the downtown tourist venues. You could walk to Stanley Park, Granville Island, Gastown and Canada Center. We opted for a paid sightseeing bus tour so we could see the sights in our limited time and it stopped right outside the hotel. It's dead center in the middle of the biz district. It's not east getting to downtown Vancouver from the airport, but apparently that will be solved when the train is completed prior to the 2010 Olympics. We suggest a cab for now. The Airporter took forever, although it was slightly cheaper. The Marriott was the sixth stop. I would recommend the Marriott to anyone visiting Vancouver for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent position”
Reviews.Author: mumph
Reviews.Content: Had three nights in this very good well run hotel.Very helpful and friendly and welcoming staff. Ask for high room to get wonderful panoramic views of the harbour and mountains.

Reviews.Title: “Surprsingly good, did not meet my expecttaions, but better then that!”
Reviews.Author: MrCanada
