Reviews.Content: I alwqays have stayed in Fairmont Hotels in Vancouver. This was the first time that I have been in the Marriot. And as the same in Halifax, it was a great stay. The building is very open, a lots of glass, so you get the feeling that the city is coming to you and you can go to the city. It's situated in a quiet surrounding but downtown and close to the cruise center. A 7 minute walk. And in two minutes you are at the water side, close to the floatplanes. Open reception and good staff. You can only go to your room with using your roomcard in the elevator. Oterwise you won't get up. The rooms are spacious. The windos are all glass, so when you are situated at the highest level, you have marvellous views. There is a high speed internet connection for a daily rate around CA$16. The bathroom is spacious with a bath and a seperate shower. There is enough space for your clothes etc. I went one morning to the swimming pool. Well maintained, good facilities, nice spa and open 24 hours. I had breakfast there every morning and you can choose between buffet or a a la carte. Perfect! I really and truly enjoyed my stay there and Marriot is on my list to advice other people. At the corner you have a coffee shop with the best sandwiches and coffee in Vancouver. If you see how long the queue is before the shop.. :)

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: vicsoz
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Whistler for 7 years now and each time have stayed at the same hotel whilst stopping over in Vancouver. However, this year we tried the Pinnacle and were very impressed. The room wasn't overly big but more than sufficient for our stopover. It is very near to Stanley Park etc and a very easy walk into the hub of the city. The gym was great and the bed, as always in the Marriotts, was just lush! The public rooms and the bedrooms were spotlessly clean and the separate shower was fab. We did not eat in the restaurant but it did look good. We will no doubt be staying at the hotel next year as we found the value excellent and booked it through BA when we booked the flights. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent start to our 10th anniversary trip”
Reviews.Author: Mully516
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Pinnacle and we have nothing but great things to say about our time there. We were fortunate enough to be on the top floor and the view was spectacular. The staff was very attentive and thoughtful, from the doormen to the concierge and front desk to the cleaning staff, and they do a great job with the little touches that make a big difference. (For example, whenever my husband returned from a run, the doorman offered him a chilled bottle of water.) The room was very comfortably appointed and clean. We were also glad to find that the location was very convenient (we were able to walk or catch a bus just about everywhere we wanted to go). I would gladly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous Marriot”
Reviews.Author: lynne47
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights as part of a Rockies/cruise package. The bedrooms were amazing,huge bed, soo comfortable, we were on the 30th floor and could see the waterfront and Stanley Park. The staff were so helpfull and efficient and friendly. We ate breakfast at the hotel and found it quite keenly priced for a hotel of this type, a Canadian Breakfast which is like our full English was 15 dollars, a wonderfull Granolla Parfait (granolla layered with youghurt and fresh strawberries) was 7 dollars. We found it very conviently situated for the skytrain, 9 dollars for a days unlimited use, also valid for the bus. Nearby Urban Fayre deli had amazing sandwiches/cakes/saladbowls/coffe to eat in or take out , and check out the food hall! pity you cant bring food back to UK as this shop is really something. Went on e evening to Joe Fortes Seafood/Chop House, excellent, about 10minutes easy walk. Vancouver is a great city, everyone so nice, dont think Canadians know how to be rude!

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: Atenant
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights after a trip to Whistler. I chose this hotel because of the reviews and the great package offered via the Marriott website. I read several of the negative reviews and after my stay I could only agree with the quote "you can't please all of the people all the time". My experience was like the majority of the reviewers. The hotel was exceptionally clean, the staff was very courteous and helpful and the location is excellent. I booked the package for "Cars eat free" for $179, which included a $25 gas card for each night of stay, and complimentary parking (self or valet). Like most large cities, downtown hotel parking is not free, and the price at the Pinnacles is on par with other hotels. Based on the recommendation of a previous reviewer, I chose valet parking so I didn't have to hike to and from the garage. The valet service was quick. The two times I called for the car, it was at the front door waiting for me after I came down from my room. This is not a luxurious hotel and the price reflects that, so people should not have the same expectations as if staying at the Fairmont or Pan Pacific and paying twice the rate. The location of the hotel is most convenient. The waterfront and Canada Place is two blocks north. Pacific Center shopping mall is three blocks to the east. If you are looking for stores and restaurants just walk two blocks south to West Georgia Street. Their refrigerator did not have any mini bar items, but they did provide us with two bottles of water. Considering the price that hotels charge for the convenience of mini bar snacks and drinks, I'm thankful they provided a refrigerator for me to store my own drinks. We stayed in an upper floor unit and did not hear any street noise and the neighbors were very quite. I enjoyed my stay and would be back if I'm in Vancouver, especially if they have those great packages.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: goehringw
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in an excellent location. We walked to everthing except Stanley Park (Aquarium-nice), Lynn Canyon Park (hiking, suspension bridge-free) and Granville Island (shops, art). The rooms were clean, nicely furnished and modern. The bathrooms have a separate shower and tub. The beds were quite comfortable. The hotel was very quiet. Self parking ran $23.00/day and is under the hotel with elevator access to the lobby. If you want a view of the water, get a room above the 25th floor that ends with a 1, 2, 19 or 20. We did not eat at the hotel but the restaurant looked good. We ate breakfast at Goodfellas and Christines (both across the street). Goodfellas was probably a little better but both were fine. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Marriott in BC?”
Reviews.Author: identraveler
Reviews.Content: Just moved from the Renaissance Harbour View to the Marriott Pinnacle. It's much, MUCH better by comparison. Staff was extremely professional and efficient. Pool and gym are also 24 hours. Feels a lot cleaner and newer. Wonderful view - though partially obstructed - but still nice. We even got to see the seaplanes takeoff and land right from our room. We had a problem with our safe and they fixed it promptly. They even delivered us extra shampoo and toothbrush promptly. Just a overall POSITIVE experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel @ the edge of the Financial District and Coal Harbour”
Reviews.Author: rchilde
Reviews.Content: I just completed a wonderful stay at the Pinnacle Hotel in downtown Vancouver. The staff at the hotel were very hospitable and the room decor was clean, modern, and luxurious. The ONLY gripe I have with the hotel is the ridiculous charge they have for internet (which they group with the phone). Otherwise. You can't beat the location for business, right immediately next to the towering skyscrapers of the Financial District yet also near the posh Coal Harbour neighbourhood. And being in the big city, there's plenty to see and do and all of it is within the confines of the downtown peninsula core! Vancouver is my favourite city in the world and the Pinnacle Hotel is definitely one of the city's best be it business or pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Great central place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JB611
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights on Marriott points. Great, safe and central location to all downtown Vancouver destinations. Nice hotel, great views from rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value if You Get the Right Rate...”
Reviews.Author: lagunadallas
Reviews.Content: Although the Marriott Pinnacle is not what I'd consider a 5-star hotel, it easily gets a 5/5 here when considering the value factor. The location was within an easy walk of shopping, dining, and the water, the staff was friendly, check-in was efficient, parking is expensive but easy to access, the room was nice with amazing views and better linens than expected, and the $15.95/day for in-room internet and unlimited long-distance calling to the U.S. was a deal considering how ridiculous hotel phone charges usually are. My 5 rating is based on the $139 rate for all of the above that I found on the Marriott.com site by pre-paying (non-refundable) the room and tax. I'd have gone elsewhere for over $200/night, but $139 was a steal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bjca
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the last 2 nights of our holiday. What a great hotel. It is located in the Business District but we had fabulous views from our hotel room. The room was large (especially by European standard), very clean and had everything we needed. The valet parking is a must and only costs a few dollars more. The Concierge was also excellent and offered great advice on what to do and where to eat. One night we decided we wanted to try a real fish restaurant and the hotel booked us in at "Joe Fortes" and this is a must - although it was very busy, so booking is a must. We felt the only downside to the hotel was the bar area and this was very "business" orientated and although we tried it a couple of times, we never felt comfortable. This is our first time to Vancouver, having toured the Rockies, and we were pleasantly surprised. The city is very clean and the location of the hotel was great. Will definately stay here again when visiting Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: mayabellamom
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on the hotel through Hotwire for President's day weekend. Sure, the bedroom is a little cramped for a family of four but that's normal for any hotel. The rooms were pretty average for a Marriott, nice beds, spacious bathrooms with a split shower and bathtub arrangement. The hotel is in a great location (depending on where you want to go). It's just a few blocks from Robson, a block from the Seawall/Canada Place and there are plenty of restaurants, shops and grocery stores nearby. We drove to Stanley Park but you could walk there if you wanted if the weather was nice. We ate in the restaurant for breakfast. The food was good, service was a bit slow. Used the gym which is nice and spacious. There is a heated indoor pool, separate hot tub and coed sauna and steam room. My kids swam in the pool on the first day but on the second day it was closed unexpected due to a guest breaking a glass in the pool and they had to drain the whole system. We were pretty bummed out since the pool is THE big thing when staying at a hotel with kids. I promptly emailed the hotel manager, at the suggestion of the front desk agent (who was very nice) and she credited me 5000 Marriott points for the inconvenience which I thought was very generous. I didn't really have any noise problems as mentioned by previous guests. I guess the only bad thing I have to say about the hotel was the expensive parking - $27/night. Other than that, I would surely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value; Great Location; Comfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Velvalee
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on this hotel via priceline.com, which helped offset the $27/day valet parking. Rooms were nicely appointed with comfortable beds: a bit firm for me, but my partner loved it. Great bedding, too: good linens with fluffy pillows and pretty bed scarves. Bath was also roomy, clean, with lots of nice towels and generous name-brand toiletries. The "rain" style shower head is a nice touch. Hotel is in a great location, not far from Canada Place and walking distance to many shopping and eating areas. About 3 or 4 blocks to Burrard SkyTrain station. This is a clean, safe area of Hastings Street, although you will want to be extremely careful if you head too many blocks east on Hastings on foot, especially after dark. This problem area of homeless/drug-addicted Vancouver has been mentioned in previous posts, but is a good 10 blocks from the hotel. Lobby and other public areas are nice and modern, well within 4* standards. Staff was friendly and professional, but it was a busy weekend, so can't say they were particularly attentive...but that's how it is when you are hosting a crowd, I suppose. Did not eat in the restaurant, but ordered room service. While the service was fast and wonderfully executed, and the prices were average for room service, the food fell well below our expectations. Soggy tempuras, greasy spring rolls, overcooked vegetables and too-small portions disappointed. My only real issue with staying at this hotel again would be the noise problem, mentioned by previous posters. Some rooms are in a cul-de-sac configuration at the end of the halls, and this creates a distinct disturbance as your neighbors come and go: their voices sound as if they are right in your room, and the slamming of doors as people come and go actually interrupted conversation in our room. This is a design flaw; not sure what the hotel could do to improve upon it. That being said, these sounds generally die down once everyone retires for the evening, so our sleep was not interrupted. However, I could see that being roomed next to "party" guests who come and go at late hours might be a problem. All in all, we had a pleasant, enjoyable stay at this convenient, comfortable 4* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bintang
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in January for 4 nights as an add-on city break following our trip to Whistler. This is a lovely hotel in the business district of Vancouver. The rooms were lovely. We had room 1819 which had a small view of the harbour. The room follows the arch of the building so was an odd shape which was lovely. It was also quite spacious. The lobby of the hotel is quite bland and we did not use the bar or restaurant as it did not seem very relaxed or friendly; too businesslike and cold. We did use the room service. The food was lovely and the Starbucks coffee was perfect to wake you up. The cost was quite cheap - it was certainly cheaper than the restaurant. The pool and jacuzzi etc was nice but it could do with a bit of a spruce up pretty soon. Location is good, only two blocks from Robson Street. We also walked to Chinatown from here but would not recommend it as Chinatown was a complete dive with druggies and homeless people everywhere. You can also walk to Stanley Park from here eand Gas Town. Enjoyed our stay here and would possibly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: scott006
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times over the past three years and have been impressed each and every time. The customer service displayed by staff at this hotel is the best I've ever encounterd anywhere. From the doorman to the desk manager, they smile and greet you by name, trying to meet your needs as best they can. And they hustle!! What a pleasure to experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Wonderful Room!”
Reviews.Author: misseattle
Reviews.Content: Awesome new Marriott right across the street of the Harbour with fantastic views! We were on the 31st floor, and it was great to get up every morning and peek out the large wraparound windows. A few notes: if you are parking a car, you may as well do valet for only a few more dollars because the self parking is confusing in how they charge (it rolls over to hourly charges after a certain amount of time), plus the lot is underneath and hard to get in and out of. While we didn't use the pool or fitness club, we did take a peek and it looked fantastic! There is a vending machine in there if you don't feel like getting something from the restaurant or walking outside. The location is awesome, very easy to find and right in the heart of the city. The front desk and concierge were very knowledgeable about where to go and what to see. The bellman provided excellent service and walked over luggage from two rooms to Renaissance across the street as we had to continue our stay there. One of the best Marriott's I have ever stayed in!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service and Marriott Comfort”
Reviews.Author: reclermo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott in the heart of downtown Vancouver for 5 nights and had a very pleasant stay. What sets this particular Marriott apart from other top quality hotels is the extra effort by the front desk staff to make their guests feel special and appreciated. My stay was jointly for business and pleasure and the front desk staff assisted in numerous ways whenever I needed help by sending faxes or offering tips to great restaurants in the area. Upon entering the lobby, I was regularly greeted by my proper name which was really a nice touch that I appreciated. This type of service is uncommon in most hotels in this day and age. The room was very comfortable and as always, Marriott supplied an outstanding bed. The valet parking team always had my vehicle ready on time and assisted loading my snowboard equipment in the car whenever I left for the slopes. All in all, I would highly suggest this hotel when staying in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to the usual standards”
Reviews.Author: OkanaganBCTraveler
Reviews.Content: I really don’t think this property was as great as the reviews. I have stayed at several Vancouver hotels and several excellent Marriott’s this is not one of the best. Several things were not what they should have been; ·The assigned room had a bad TV it was fixed promptly but only partially. It really was a poor TV for the expected quality of the room. ·The shower could have been cleaned a little better, a little rough for a newer hotel. ·The noise from adjacent rooms was substantial when people arrived and departed. ·You will have to pay for parking at this hotel there just isn’t any street parking in this part of Vancouver. ·You will also have to pay for Internet use. To many hotels just include this service to be charged $18 a day ·I also don’t think the location is as good as other hotels. Major shopping is four blocks. ·If you want a restaurant selection, you will also need to walk a good four blocks. On the good front, the staff were all very friendly There are many nicer hotels at the same price range to come running back to this one soon. Try the Waterfront, Pan Pacific or Four Seasons for much better value.

Reviews.Title: “A better than expected experience”
Reviews.Author: fryfrye
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property with my wife for five nights in November. I was expecting the typical Marriott business hotel... but we got a better than expected hotel that we would choose again for our next stay in Vancouver. The hotel is fairly well located for most of the Vancouver attractions (both business an pleasure). I walked to the convention center each morning and my wife walked or biked to most of the main Vancouver attractions. The staff were very friendly... Here's a tip... get your dinner recommendations from the doorman...

Reviews.Title: “Will be back for sure”
Reviews.Author: OilersFan79
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for four days in September. I had a great view of the park and the room was top notch. I can't say enough about the staff, they were very professional. The food in the hotel was good, the food outside the hotel is fantastic! Vancouver has some of the best dining experiences I've seen.

Reviews.Title: “Fanatastic”
Reviews.Author: FrostD
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Vancouver for 12 days and had no problems at all. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful.The breakfast and restaurants are very nice. The hotel is also located fairly close to the main high street in Downtown (abt 5mins). There ample places to eat out and try various types of food. Everything about this hotel was spot on. Only negative is that it is a little expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Iain____Mitchell
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Marriott Vancouver Pinnacle at the end of Aug 2007. I originally booked 3 nights at the hotel using their own website and after re-organising my itinary for my trip to Canada decided to change this to 4. This was a disaster and I ended up having to call the hotel manager directly to complain about the number of errors that resulted for a simple extra night alteration and was ready to give up and cancel completely. I was offerred an immediate apology and was given the manager's personal assurance that things would be put right. I was not disappointed and when I arrived at the hotel was pleased to be informed that I had been given a room upgrade and then a personal call from the manager to check I was happy with my room. The Hotel is modern and clean and although on the expensive side breakfast was good. The hotel concierge was informative and the location of the hotel excellent for walking to Stanley Park and downtown Vancouver. There are lots of nice restaurants nearby to choose from and if you don't want to pay upwards of CAN$ 50 for breakfast for 2 there is a nice diner across the road.

Reviews.Title: “well situated hotel”
Reviews.Author: mark666
Reviews.Content: Very good situation down town ,in walking distance of the harbour and the main shopping /restaurant areas. Top floors give reasonable view across the harbour. Staff friendly and efficient . Bedroom well kitted out. Breakfast buffet or a la carte. Dinner expensive, do not touch their "Lumberjack fries " which appeared to be mashed potato deposited in a mould and lightly fried, disgusting!! Wine expensive as it was in most places Disappointed that on the first day of our stay we went out at 9a.m and came back at 2.30p.m and the room had not been touched. Good business facilities. Their porters need special praise as they handled the luggage of our 40 strong party speedily with no problems and with a smile. Good pub nearby as well as good Malaysian,thai and Chinese restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Best Marriott I've Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: floshane
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Marriott Pinnacle before our cruise. First of all, the location is great. I felt like we were centrally located for the 2 days we spent in Vancouver. ( Two days is not really enough. There's so much to do and see there.) After reading prior reviews, I was prepared to see homeless people all around. This was not the case. I don't even remember seeing one. Now about the hotel. It was fabulous. This was the best Marriott and probably one of the top hotels I've stayed at in terms of customer service. Everyone from the front desk people to the waiters in the restaurant were great. The concierge in EXCEPTIONAL. There are enough concierge working that you don't have to wait to talk to someone ane they are so knowledgeable and helpful. We had a room looking over the water and we were able to watch the float planes take off and land. It was a great view. The Marriott beds are so comfortable. You won't be disappointed if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but beware of check-in time”
Reviews.Author: Chemicalguy123
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good location. You are steps away from transit and all of the main attractions in Vancouver. We got a corner room and it was gigantic. Our view was awesome, you could see Stanley Park and North Vancouver on one side and downtown Vancouver on the other. It was nice to have windows that opened up. The beds were very comortable and the place was very clean. I would easily give this hotel atop rating had it not been for their 4pm check-in policy. I had read ahead of time that it was 4pm instead of the standard 3pm but since we were downtown already, we went to see if the room was ready. Had they said no it's not, come back at 4, that would have been fine with me. The front desk told us to wait five minutes, then they would send someone every 10 minutes to tell us it would be ready shortly. It took us about 45 minutes to finally get our room. It would have been better to have just told us to come back in one hour instead of teasing us and making us wait in the lobby. We weren't the only ones in this situation as at least 2 other guests were having the same problem. Despite that, I would recommend this to anyone visiting Vancouver, especially if you want to do alot of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: BruceT
Reviews.Content: Everything was great except for the cost of the food in the resturant. The food was average but quite pricey. However, there are plenty of other places to eat in the immediate area & thus we would defintely stay there again. Very conventiently located to most everything.

Reviews.Title: “Good Pick”
Reviews.Author: HJS11
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay at the Marriott Pinnacle Vancouver. The location was great. In the heart of downtown in walking distance from Stanley Park, Chinatown, shopping and restaurants. Nice rooms. We stayed on the 9th floor and had a pretty good view of the water. Bathroom had both shower and tub. There is a charge for parking, I think it was around $20 a day. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place - with some minor issues”
Reviews.Author: inconel738
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here recently for 6 nights and loved the place! Great rooms, very clean and very friendly staff. overall experience was really good considering they were quite busy during this time. Only complaint is the room service - One day they did not have our rooms cleaned until late evening! However, to be fair to the front desk - when we complained about it, they asked us to wait at the bar and provided a free round of drinks while we were waiting for our rooms to get cleaned. Also, the supervisor personally came and told us our rooms were done and left water/chocolates for us. So - definitely made up for the delay. Overall - great place but pricey (upwards of $265 before tax and parking of $25). But worth it. LOCATION - Great location - if you are having a vacation in Vancouver, this is a good place to stay since you can access granville Island, Stanley Park, Yale Town and China Town/Gastown - all are really close. We both love walking and pretty much walked everywhere. The only time we used our rental car was for driving up to Whistler. All other places are between 5 minutes and 20 minutes away from the hotel location. While booking - ask for breakfast to be thrown in. If not for all the days - they might give it to you for a few days. Great breakfast buffet in the mornings. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location,with minor issues”
Reviews.Author: JudgeTravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on two separate nights within a 2 week period in July 2007. My husband and I were going on a cruise so we spent the day before and after our cruise in Vancouver. I had requested a high room when I booked the hotel through American express, plus it is in my Marriott Rewards member profile that I prefer a high room. I arrived at the hotel around 2 pm in the afternoon and the receptionist said that my room was not ready but she would hold my bags for me. She could not tell me when the room would be ready, but she said that check in time was 4. She recommended a place to eat within walking distance (The Mill, which I do not recommend). We returned to the hotel around 4 and our room was not ready. She put us in another room, a corner room ending in the # 19. I was so excited since I had read reviews which instructed to get the room ending in the # 19. The room had a gorgeous view, but was a bit on the small side. Also the bed in this room was a bit uncomfortable and firm which is unusual for Marriott. I had two problems during my first stay. 1: the shower head & pipes in the wall started shaking violently when I took a shower. The only way for it to stop was to bleed off the pressure in the bathtub. So I had the bathwater running the whole time I was taking a shower to prevent this. 2: The other problem that I had on this first night was that the bellman put my bags under the aircon vent, which was leaking. I did not realize this until I went to leave and my 40 lbs suitcase was soaked through the top, through all my belongings to the bottom of the suitcase. I notified the receptionist when I left, that I was leaving for a cruise, and did not have time to check the contents, but it was wet soaked through. He told me to let them know upon my return if anything was damaged. The second stay proves Marriott’s exceptional customer service. I contacted the same receptionist about my soaked suitcase and gave them the laundry bill for some of the clothes that got wet. The happily deducted the amount from my room cost. This time we got another corner room ending in the # “11”. It was even better than the room ending in “19” because it was bigger and better proportioned. The view was of the city, but we loved it. We had the same problem with the violently shaking shower in this room. The service in the dining room was disappointing for breakfast, they were very busy and we had to wait about 15 minutes for a table. When we got a table, we never saw our waiter. It was buffet, so we helped ourselves and I even went and got our own beverages and poured my drinks from the waiters drink stations. The waiter eventually stopped by when we were finished and apologized and asked us if we needed anything… I said “Yes, check please”. Overall this is a beautiful hotel. I would have given it 4 stars in a heartbeat but we just had too many problems to say it was above average. However, they were quick to remedy our issues and have great customer service. I would definitely stay here—the location is prime!

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: flaminhotmamma
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights, excellent service, very clean, courteous and friendly staff, need I say more, yes the beds were great...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sally66
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in June 2007 and we both really liked this hotel. Our room on the 21st floor overlooked the city and so had great views. It was very comfortable, nice furnishings and just what we wanted. Staff were very polite and helpful. Very close to Canada Place but few restaurants in immediate 5 min locality but the main shopping streets with lots of restaurants lie 10+ mins away so we really liked the location being close to the sea front. We didnt try the restaurant but the bar was nice. Ate breakfast at 2 cafes closeby as breakfast not standard inclusion. Decent swimming poool but quite narrow so it desnt take many people to make it more suitable for a dip than 20 lengths. Definate recommendation and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: DWhiteBasingstoke
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in order to explore Vancouver. Had a bay view room on the 30th floor with great views over the harbour, Stanley Park and North Vancouver. The location of this hotel meant that places such as Robson Street, Stanley Park, Gastown and the Waterfront Centre (for ferries, buses and the Sky Train) were all within easy walking distance. All of the staff were very friendly and had the same attitude whether or not you were a tourist or travelling on business. Particularly liked the security system where you needed to insert your room card to activate the lift. The breakfast was a bit pricey but there is always somewhere to eat which is cheaper. Would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not worthy of 4 stars!”
Reviews.Author: forever450
Reviews.Content: Poor management- Average room- Nice looking bed - but that's about it- Older rooms, slightly revamped- Mostly business people- Would not recommend for leisure or romance seekers- Consierge poor job-Never got our faxes- could not get reservations at the restaurants, need higher standards to be able to claim those 4 stars- ( restaurant onsite however was great!) They also try really hard to upsell you to an "even better view" room for additional $40.00 ! The hotel is full of business travelers to the point of too overbooked- Very small lobby too-

Reviews.Title: “Fine weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: lgoldstar
Reviews.Content: Quite a nice hotel. Good view from the 22nd floor, they graciously gave us an upgrade to a king bed with a numerous pillows - made for a good experience. Spacious room had a bathroom with separate tub and shower; both were spotless. Well located, within walking distance to Gastown, the museum, and shopping. On-site parking was 21/day. Not sure if better rates are available nearby as it was convenient enough. Generally good service - only hitch was getting a porter to take our bags on the way out as there was a tour bus with 200 other people just pulling in. Besides this minor hassle, service was good and the concierge was helpful. Gym/sauna/steam room open 24 hours a day. Would stay there again for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EMS8
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 2 nights prior to our cruise departing on July 1st. We sailed out of Ballantyne pier so we had to take a cab which was less than $10 not including tip. We chose this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews and hotel location. This is a nice hotel with very good service and an excellent location. 3 blocks to Canada Place, about 3/4 of a mile to Stanley Park and a short walk to just about anything you might want. We had a view room with a great view of the harbor and some of Stanley Park. The room was nice sized and very clean with a window that opened, which was nice since the weather was nice and cool. We had lunch one day in the restaurant which we thought was extremely overpriced ($4 for a glass of iced tea) however, the bar had good food and drinks at more reasonable prices. For coffee lovers, Cafe Artigiano, just around the corner from the Marriott, has great coffee drinks and pastries/sandwiches at very reasonable prices. Overall we liked this hotel and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view”
Reviews.Author: sezme
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night prior to a cruise, but loved it. We did not have the "famous" room ending in 19, but ours ended in 20 and it was great. The view was beautiful--directly facing the water, mountains, seaplanes, could even see Stanley Park to the side. The construction in the area was not a problem. It was very quiet, never heard anyone else. Very clean, comfortable, and fast efficient check-in. Walked to Stanley Park and Robson Street easily.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: karlyn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Pinnacle in Vancouver for one night. We had come into the city on a short relocation cruise arriving at 7:00 am. We only had one day to visit the city so were eager to get checked in and on our way. When we arrived we were greeted warmly and told that the room might not be ready, as it was only 7:00 am. Then the nice young man said, "I bet you would really like to get into a room and freshen up before going out." We said yes we would but that we understood that it was very early. He said just a minute and I will see what I can do. In just a jiffy he had us in a room on the club floor. The room was a bit on the small side but everything else was just great. Marriott beds and linens are wonderful. Everything was very clean! As we were only going to sleep there and be gone by midmorning the next day the room size was no problem. The club floor included the lounge with snacks and breakfast which was great. Views of the harbor from the lounge are spectacular. The location was terrific as we walked the whole city and saw all that we wanted to that day. Every staff person we had contact with was friendly and eager to please. We had a great stay and I would highly recommend this hotel. A really great thing about Marriotts is they are completely nonsmoking. Yeah!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Great Location, Clean Rooms, Nice Hotel, Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: oyster54904
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Pinnacle Downtown Vancouver hotel from June 30 thru July 4, 2007. We booked through Priceline and paid about $150 total per night, which was excellent for that level of hotel in the downtown area, during Canada Day weekend. I travel quite a bit and usually do extensive shopping-around on the Internet, so I did my research before choosing this place, and Priceline seemed the most cost effective way. Our room on the 16th floor had a decent view, but the office building across the street blocked a clear view of the harbour - which really didn't matter a whole lot since we spent very little time in the room. If you're going to downtown Vancouver to sit in your room and enjoy the view, you are going to the wrong place for the wrong reason. Vancouver and the surrounding area is a great place to explore. Housekeeping did a good job every day of cleaning the room, and overall it was a very modern and nice room. The bed was comfortable and better than at most hotels. The fitness center had several treadmills/cardio machines as well as some free weights and a universal machine, so not bad if you want a quick workout before starting your day. The pool area was average, with a whirlpool and sauna. There is an outdoor patio area on the floor above the pool (5th floor), which may be a nice place to unwind depending upon the time of day and the weather. We never used it but walked up there one morning after a bit in the sauna. We spent a day in Whistler hiking and mountain biking, another day strolling around Granville Island and biking in Stanley Park; also went whale watching out of Victoria. All in all, Vancouver is a really good place to visit in the summer with a variety of activities for everyone, and the Marriott Pinnacle is a great place to base your vacation from. It's close to the bus, sky train and sea bus terminal, so use them as much as you can. One word of caution - don't go to Chinatown at night, unless you are heavily armed or looking for trouble :) We made the mistake of taking the Sky Train there around 6pm and it was like a ghost town. The only normal people in sight were a few tourists. There are countless shady-looking people in the area. East Hasting street is as bad as the travel guides tell you, avoid it at all costs. We ended up walking around Chinatown for only a few minutes and then went north of Chinatown and west back to Gastown to have dinner, which was really nice.

Reviews.Title: “For the price - it's just OK”
Reviews.Author: wvchick
Reviews.Content: I was so excited about staying at this hotel because almost all of the reviews raved about the Marriott. For the price - $289 per night, I expect better especially since this is a four diamond hotel. We checked in on June 28 for three nights. The view was outstanding from our room on the 28th floor - right on the waterfront overlooking the seaplane ternimal. We ordered room service that evening and it took over an hour to get our food. Dinner was good - nothing special but not bad. Reviews on this site state the beds are confortable. I didn't find them all that great - not bad but nothing like the Heavenly Beds at Westin or Grand Beds at Hyatt. On Friday, we left our room at 7:30 AM and returned at 3 PM to a messy room. Housekeeping had not even come yet. My daughter took her nap and we left again at 5:30 PM after calling Housekeeping to tell to to clean the room. They acted suprised that we even needed service. When we returned you could tell that the maid just quickly did her job...dirty glasses were left on the desk, no conditioner in the bathroom, etc. The next day we tried to use our in-room safe. It was broken. We called for service but the guy thought he was supposed to fix our phone. He left, never to return. The hotel's solution was to use the safe downstairs...for which we'd have to wait in the always present line at the check in counter. Overall, the experience was OK. But I kept finding myself looking at the Westin wishing that I had booked there. The location is good and the views can't be beat. However, when I pay top dollar I expect top notch service. Broken items and medicore housekeeping are not acceptable at a four diamond hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: rob3066
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in mid June. Upgraded to higher floor (28th) for a better view. Great view of Harbour and the seaplanes constantly taking off and landing. However, like much of Vancouver, there is a lot of construction work going on including near this hotel, therefore view affected by this. Room ok but not too large, but very clean. Staff very friendly and helpful. Was very disappointed with dinner, had steak and chips, chips 4 in number, also service very slow and it was expensive. Would not eat dinner there again, however, breakfast was fine. There is a bar with drinks reasonably priced for this class of hotel. Wireless internet available in lobby at a small charge or wired in your room also at extra charge. Well situated for shopping (10 mins to Robson Street) and the harbour (5 mins). Very close to the bus routes and skytrain about 10 mins walk. Cost us $49 for a stretched limo from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with easy access to sights”
Reviews.Author: MrsThree
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this beautiful hotel from May 31-June 2, 2007, on our Marriott Rewards points. After learning from this site that we should ask for a high floor with a room ending in 19, we did just that. We arrived at the hotel around 2:30 (before check-in) and were told all that was available was a city-view room on the 10th floor. But we were offered a higher room if we were willing to wait! So, we wandered over to the bar, relaxed awhile and planned our pre-cruise visit while we waited. About 4:30 we looked at a couple of rooms with an employee and were upgraded to room 2419. This room was definitely worth the wait. We had that great harbor view (with several cranes and new buildings right in the middle) and were blessed with three sunny days in Vancouver. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The hotel hosted a stop for the Vancouver Trolly hop on/hop off bus. Right across the street is the Renaissance where we ate dinner one night at Vistas Revolving Restaurant. We could walk to Canada Place and Robson Street. We found it to be a very comfortable place to stay and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: scotts93
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Pinnacle Vancouver was outstanding! The staff was very prompt and friendly at check-in. They honored my reservation with no problems. The room was spotless, the bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was huge. All of the linens were clean and fresh. The concierge, along with all of the other staff, was very friendly and helpful. The concierge was extremely knowledgeable of the area and recommended great restaurants. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone, and would surely stay there again! Put this hotel on your list if you are planning to stay in Vancouver!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYHammer
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel whenever I'm in Vancouver for business. It's a no-nonsense hotel with an excellent staff. The rooms are modern, the gym is good and always available, and the location is great. You really can't beat it. I've also stayed at the Renaissance across the street but that one is a bit old and run-down. Definitely stay at this one if you have a choice.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice for Marriott-loyal travelers in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: PHXroadwarrior
Reviews.Content: I stay at Marriott properties about 150 nights a year and am very loyal to the chain as a business traveler. I have also stayed at all the other Marriott-branded properties in the area, and the Pinnacle is the best. The hotel has a great view from higher floors, and I found the service to be very attentive during my stay. The rooms are very inconsistent in size and shape due to the hotel's architecture, so it does pay to inquire about the layout and view from your room. The rooms were fresh and light and bright. Compared to the slightly more tired Renaissance across the street, I would choose the Marriott for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine411
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after our cruise. The location is great, we walked from Canada Place (about 10 minutes and easy.) The room we had was spacious, quiet and the bed was very comfortable. We enjoyed walking along the water, over to Robson St., and through the park and nearby neighborhoods. We took a taxi to the airport and the taxi driver was so very nice and polite and informative about the area. There's a lot of construction going on all over Vancouver but it doesn't detract from a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: bobina007
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Marriott for two nights in early May before a cruise to Alaska. It is an above-average, super clean Marriott hotel with VERY comfy beds. The hotel staff were overwhelmingly friendly and helpful with a luggage problem I encountered with the airline, and the concierge was very efficient and knowledgeable about the area. The location of the hotel is very convenient for exploring Vancouver on foot. It is literally two minutes from the harborside of Vancouver, about a 5-10 minute walk from Robson Street with its shopping and dining, and approximately 10-15 minutes from Stanley Park on foot. It is also a few blocks from the main cruise terminal, but about a 10-minute taxi ride from the Ballantyne pier (where our ship left from). If you like to spend a lot of time in the hotel, I agree with previous reviewers that the lobby is kind of small and not very interesting. For us, it was exactly what we expected and hoped for, a very comfortable and convenient home base for exploring Vancouver. If you go to Granville Island, go to the public market hungry! There's lots of good stuff to eat from the different vendors. Just as a tip, avoid East Vancouver past Gastown. We drove through there on our way to the Ballantyne Pier, and it was a VERY seedy place that I would not want to wind up wandering into on foot by accident.

Reviews.Title: “Wonerful location and outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: Clete
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two days at the Marriott Pinnacle Vancouver after a cruise. We chose the hotel for its location and past reviews. It turned out to be a great choice. The location was excellent, allowing us to walk to most destinations such as Robson Street, Gastown, Chinatown and the waterfront. The room was somewhat a strange shape, but the bed was very comfortable, it was very clean, and had a wonderful view. The bathroom was large and had a great shower. The staff at the hotel was very helpful with directions, suggestions and in making transportation arraignments. On our last day, the Vancouver Marathon ran right in front of the hotel, and the staff arraigned to have a taxi pick us up at the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Three cheers for the front desk”
Reviews.Author: M-man11
Reviews.Content: We, too, watched the marathon from our room on the 31st floor and from the lobby. In fact, on my way to Cafe Artigiano's around the corner, I felt like a participant. It's been almost two weeks since we stayed at the Marriott, and I deferred writing this until after I could achieve some sort of objectivity. You see, we were given the best room on floor 31, the one that everyone says to snag, the one ending in --19. Not being a member of the hotel's loyalty program, I'm still wondering how this was done. Perhaps it had something to do with contacting the hotel itself three times before check-in. Our friends traveling with us were given a room on the 23rd floor with a nice but not as sweeping a view. All floors in many Canadian hotels seem to be accessed by cards that must be inserted in the elevator and will service that floor only. An excellent security measure. The front desk and Concierge desk couldn't have been more helpful. They dispensed information from what bus to catch (and where to catch it) to how to find the nearest store that sells tonic water. No request too small. Our room itself, with its magnificent views of Stanley Park, Canada Place with its terminal, and sea planes, is an anomaly. A third of the room is given to a long hallway that curves around to reveal the bedroom. Yes, the bed is very comfortable and you have 7 pillows to play with and adjust accordingly. One guidebook criticized the hotel for its lack of imaginative room furnishings, and I suppose this could be a problem for someone who wants dramatic color contrasts. But it's very much like the plain pine furnishings found in many Swiss hotels. Our bathroom contained both bath and separate shower. During our stay, we were issued four different notices, placed on our desk: window washers, road closures due to Marathon, water treatments during the night (!), and fire alarm inspections. Quite a list for the first weekend in May! But being prepared meant there would be no rude surprises during the day or night. Because we are seniors, we paid $191 CA each night for the first three nights and $221 for the final night, probably to announce the beginning of the high season May 7. What is unusual is that as of April 1, the GST will no longer be refunded to visitors, and with the US dollar eroding even further, dollar parity will soon be achieved. Much praise has already been given to Cafe Artigiano, which is now opened Sunday's. A superb Chinese restaurant two blocks near Canada Place is Imperial Chinese Seafood Restaurant, with very fresh fish specialties. (You must peruse the menu and look that the prices for Shark Fin soup without wincing.) CinCin is OK but prix fixe is definitely overpriced and the Tiramisù should be banned. Stick to the à la carte items. Canadians love Sunday brunch and one of the most popular places is Shaughnessy Restaurant at the Van Dusen Botannical Garden, easily reached by bus #17 four blocks away. Everyone seems to make it to Vij's, the #1 venue for Indian cuisine. And yes, the rumors are founded. Even on Monday, you will wait an hour for a table if you arrive at six or later. Get there early! These recommendations were given to us by the concierge and also the result of asking around. The hotel itself is quite nice and very well located. If you don't demand perfection, you will be satisfied with the decent rates and you will be won over by the desk personnel and concierge staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice, but there are better options in this class”
Reviews.Author: cruzship
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel for a long weekend in Vancouver and was somewhat disappointed by the hotel because I was expecting more given some of the reviews. The main negatives were: -Rooms are quite small, we stayed at 2 other hotels in the area over the past couple of years (Renaissance, Westin Grand) and these are the smallest rooms of them all. It was very tight, especially with the baby crib in the room -They have an odd parking system, in which you park your car, receive a ticket for your dashboard, and you go back down to the garage to place it on your car. So, in the time req'd to check in, the parking attendant gave me a ticket! So, I had to wait in line (again) to dispute the ticket with the front desk and they indicated that it happens "all the time". If so, why not change the system? -A couple of times I was looking for the concierege and couldn't find him/her, so the front desk would help instead. The postives were: -Great and friendly housekeeping & front desk staff -Clean and modern rooms (although the decor is somewhat bland) -Great views from my room -Great location - very close to Robson St -The coffee house attached to the hotel (Cafe Artigiano) had the BEST coffee drinks (and I live in Seattle)

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: DesertBorn54
Reviews.Content: Everything about our stay was first-rate. The staff was friendly and very helpful and the room was clean, comfy and well-appointed. We were upgraded to the 28th floor without asking - what a view! Best of all, the location was so convenient. We walked almost everywhere within 15 minutes; Robson St., Gastown, Stanley Park, even the ferry to Granville Island. The Sky Train station and bus stops are very close, and the hop-on, hop-off city tour shuttle stops right in front. The concierge was very helpful with directions and tips about what to see and how much time we'd need to plan for. We always felt safe in the area. On our last day, the Vancouver Marathon ran right in front of the hotel, and the staff prepared the guests so that no one would be inconvenienced. The doorman even was able to drive cars along a small section of sidewalk so people could get out. The only mild complaints would be that the Internet access rate ($16/day) was quite steep. The lobby was very small and sterile- looking, but who stays in the lobby? Also, there is huge construction in the area preparing for the Olympics, so traffic can be bad, with occasional noise. Try the blueberry oatmeal and lemon ricotta muffins from the Cafe Artigiano coffee shop on the corner behind the hotel - YUM! Great coffee, too, puts Starbucks to shame. Also, the Victoria Chinese Restaurant in the Hyatt complex nearby had delicious food, a touch pricy, but huge servings. Authenic Chinese, not Americanized. The Lion Pub near Canada Place has excellent beer (try the Granville Island Creme Ale) and good pub grub.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shliben
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife on the way to and from Whistler in early March. Booked on skoosh.com at an incredibly low rate for both stays. The room was really good and on our second stay we paid a small amount to upgrade to a higher floor with a great view of the bay. In the future I would be careful re the view as there is a huge amount of building going on and it was not clear if this view would be there forever! We ate twice in the hotel (breakfast which was extensive but not cheap and at the bar one evening which was very good too). Staff were very helpful. The hotel is well located for Stanley Park and the main shopping centre, We would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Pinnacle exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: wagolfetc.
Reviews.Content: Okay here is the short version of my stay at the Marriott Pinnacle. Booked through Priceline, got a great deal and was not expecting to have very much pull in room requests when I got to the front desk. As it was just my daughter and I travelling, we wanted to have 2 beds, her only request would have been to have one of the higher floors, but we were prepared for anything. When we were checking in the receptionist (should have gotten her name) asked about the bed type and no problems with the 2 beds then looking at my kid she said "how about something on the 29th floor?" (my daughters smile from ear to ear). Room was perfect, view of the harbor, perfectly clean. Indoor pool was a great plus, hot tub, sauna, steam room. Room key required to use elevators & enter pool area, which was a great touch having stayed in hotels where way too many people seem to be roaming the halls. Never ate at the hotel, way too many choices within a few blocks, but from the prices posted on the menu seemed a little overpriced and why would anyone eat there with Robson Street just a few blocks away? Ate my years supply of Asian food in these four days. *Here's my own little tip- just because some sandwich shop or non- coffeehouse restaurant serves espresso, doesn't mean they know how to prepare it, I think alot of them are just trying to cash in on the craze, stick to the coffehouses (Blenz, Starbucks etc.) I'm no Coffee Snob (Folgers at home) but I am from Seattle

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Alternative in Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: VacationPlanner
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for two nights prior to traveling up to Whistler. We didn't know anything about the hotel prior to our visit and were pleasantly surprised once we did some research. It is a fairly new hotel and was very clean and comfortable. The rooms were of decent size with nice bathrooms. The lobby area is a bit small compared to some other downtown properties, but that didn't really matter to us. I liked that there was always a doorman or bellboy watching the front door as guests entered or exited, just an added security touch. Service from the front desk and housekeeping was professional and competent. The location was fairly convenient, a short walk to the Pacific Mall, Robson Square, the harbor and nearby hotels like the Hyatt and Fairmont. Robson Street was just a few minutes away for shopping and restaurants. The Perimeter bus to Whistler makes a stop at the lobby so that was an added convenience for our stay. We would definitely consider staying here again for another visit to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Overall - Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: dfranko
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Vancouver Marriott Pinnacle for 6 nights last week primarily because of price and location relative to where I had to go for business and it's closeness to the water. Excellent choice. I took the advice of other reviews found here and requested ahead of time a high floor number ending in 19 and they had it waiting for me. Great room at a great price with a panoramic view of downtown, the harbor, sea planes landing and taking off, the mountains, and a part of Stanley Park. A really uniquely shaped room too that made it seem like a suite. Very clean room also, absolutely no complaints. From check-in to check-out all staff were extremely courteous. Real nice and clean fitness center also. Small pool for laps but good for a hotel. I tried both breakfast and dinner in the hotel restaurant and found it typical of most good hotels - good food at inflated prices. Their breakfast was especially good, but expensive. Great location - easy to walk to any downtown location. I walked back and forth on two different nights tor hockey games at the GM Place from the Marriott in about 20 minutes each way. Five minute walk to the Convention Center / Imax / SeaBus. Great location also if you're a runner. Catch a really nice running path along the waterfront basically right across the street. Across the street the other way is a Starbuck's. Only complaint but not the Marriott's fault is lack of restaurants real close to the hotel that are open after 6:00pm, other than the Marriott's. Have to walk a little for that but not unreasonable. Plenty available for breakfast and lunch though. Many of the other hotels nearby looked nice also, but I think next time I'd just go with the sure thing and stay at the Marriott Pinnacle again.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Service at the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: qdarlinq
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough about the excellent customer service at this hotel, from the front desk to the housekeeping staff. Everyone we encountered on our stay was very friendly and helpful. I especially commend the concierges for their knowledge of Vancouver. The rooms were very clean and they had great views. I stayed on the 25th floor. I also got to see a room on the 29th floor. I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Good Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: titantraveller
Reviews.Content: The Marriot Pinnacle is located Downtown on W.Hastings. Walking distance to Robson Street and the Skytrain. The hotel overlooks the harbour and edge of stanley park. The seaplane terminal is very close to the hotel and you can get great views of them taking off and landing from the hotel. We had a corner room overlooking the harbour. The entire wall was glass which gave a suberb view. The room was a good size, large king bed, TV, good size desk and other standard kit. The bathroom was a good size with good mirror and huge shower and seperate bath. Not quite as good a hotel as the Hiltons but overall still a good choice. The staff were friendly and attentive and could not fault the front desk, bellmen, concierge etc. Good gift shop open until 10pm for most souveniers, papers, snacks etc. Restaurant and bar at the hotel was great. Very relaxed atmosphere with geat food and service. The hotel participates in the Dine-out vancouver scheme where you can get a 3 course meal from a special menu for $35 (the scheme has a list of participating restaurants listed by $15,$25 and $35 menus) This scheme does offer a very good value for money dinning option. You can also have the menu with the wine for each course for $65. The cocktails/martinis at the hotel were excellent as well according to my wife!! I couldnt fault the wine either! Overall....great service, good room, clean and tidy......bit of paint pealing from bathroom ceiling (being picky now!) hole in one towel that was changed. Good location but be warned.....Vancouver is not the safest feeling city! They have a major problem across the whole city with homeless and beggers! We covered most of the city when sight seeing and shopping etc and everywhere except the shopping malls felt unsafe. We were approached by beggers on most streets, even the locals were complaining about them as they ask everyperson that they pass or that passes them. Loads of construction at the moment for the Olympics in 2010 but Vancouver still has a long way to go in other areas!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: rza
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel for a great price. The rooms were a bit small, but the bathrooms were really nice and so was the customer service. The location is good as well, walking distance to Robson St. I definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: BLondon
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay in the Marriott, plush furnishings and really comfortable beds. Breakfast was not included in the room rate, but there are plenty of cafes nearby to have breakfast Canadian-style (waffles...pancakes...hash browns...). The hotel bar was a pleasant place for a drink in the evening, modern and good service - and all at a reasonable price. Nice swimming pool (although a little cold) and relaxing sauna and spa pool. Would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Mary-Natalie
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband and our 5 month old son. Initially we were at Coast Plaza Suites because I was so concerned with having a full kitchen to accommodate baby needs - but we left after staying there for 1 night only. So glad we switched hotels! The Marriott suite was clean. Staff is super friendly. Provided us with a mini fridge and electric kettle. Room service food was excellent. View was amazing. We were within walking distance to paths to Stanley Park, downtown attractions, restaurants and shopping. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CillaL-D
Reviews.Content: My son & I spent 3 nights at The Marriott to get over our jetlag before travelling on up to Whistler. Easy walking distance of Stanley Park, shops on Robson Street, Gastown, in fact ideally situated and on waterfront. I chose it by reading reviews on TripAdvisor and found all staff to be friendly & helpful. We were given a room with a view , (excellent for watching seaplanes!) and enjoyed using the pool & hot tub. Would recommend eating breakfast at Goodfellas or Moonpennies at the back of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mkrittmeyer
Reviews.Content: I was given a room ending in 16 which is still considered a city view room but since it is a corner room, it has a view of the harbor and the city. It had a great view and I didn't have to pay the premium for the harbor view room. The beds were very comfortable. The staff provided extra toiletries that I requested and offered our family the use of umbrellas which was nice. I would definitely return to this hotel again when I visit Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: nikki156
Reviews.Content: My husband, mum and I stayed here fro 2 nights overall before and after an Alaskan cruise out of Vancouver. All I can say is that the hotel was superb!! I advised the reception staff that we had two rooms and were staying as part of a cruise and that it was also our first wedding anniversary plus my mums 50th birthday, we were immediatley upgraded for free to a harbour view room on the 22nd floor. The room was modern, spacious, spotlessly clean and had amazing views of the waterfront and mountains through the floor to ceiling windows. The bathroom was large and spacious with a bath and seperate shower. With a good dose of jet lag we opted for room service not long after we had arrived. The meals were big, tasty and came with champagne and chocolate truffles courtesy of the Marriott, remembering that our stay was a special occasion...a nice touch! We had breakfast in the hotel restaurant on one morning which again was excellent and non greasy with a good selection of hot and cold food. Service was good and friendly, as we found all of the staff within the hotel to be. The health club area had a decent sized pool which was immaculately clean as well as a sauna, steam room and gym area complete with views over the city. Reception and concierge were excellent and I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, very confortable”
Reviews.Author: SeatravelerWA
Reviews.Content: What a surprise after booking a very great rate that included breakfast to find ourselves on the top floor with a great views of the city. The room which was semi circular had windows floor to ceiling, the bed was positioned to look out at the great view from the 31st floor. Even the bathroom had the same large windows, with a shower stall and tub it was easy to lose your thoughts staring out. Service levels upon check-in and checkout were very good. The only weak point was the Marriott breakfast, while OK the first morning, on a Sunday morning the staff was over whelmed. Major food items took 10-15 mins to resupply, yet the staff did remain pleasant. All in All a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Will not be coming back to this Marriott.”
Reviews.Author: icetoi
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 2909, was terrible small and the mildew in the washroom. C'mon for a Marriott, even a Holiday Inn is better in certain ways. The person that checked us in was not friendly at all was promised a harbour view room but got a city view instead. The restaurant Show Case really has a pretty limited items on the menu. Stayed at the Westin Bayshore a couple of times and that hotel is a hundred times better. Will not recomment this hotel to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not quite what I expected.”
Reviews.Author: rkuef
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on reviews here, and the fact it was available over the busy Thanksgiving weekend. Booked a view room, we were placed on the top floor. The view was excellent, we could see Stanley Park, the water, and part of downtown. Service was also excellent, we once came back to our room while it was being cleaned, the maid was very nice, not like the surly illegals one finds on staff in the U.S. The downside, our room was much smaller than what I expected, barely enough room for two double beds and a desk. Perhaps I didn't pay close enough attention when booking, but I expected there would be a microwave and fridge, there was not. There was a locked mini-bar fridge, it would have been nice to be able to open it, but it was not important enough to us to call the front desk. Overall, it was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: scarlett345
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Marriott in Vancouver at the end of October. We chose the Marriott based on the reviews we had read and we were not disappointed. We booked a view room, and requested a higher floor, and were delighted to be given a room on the 29th floor with fabulous views over Vancouver harbour. We could see the seaplanes taking off each morning and the lights over the harbour at night. The room was very comfortable, with lots of fluffy pillows and upmarket toiletries in the bathroom. We were also very impressed with the level of service shown by the staff, who went out of their way to be friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay at the Marriott again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: riggs101
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Pinnacle Thursday night thru Saturday night and enjoyed our weeekend getaway immensely. From the great view on the 30th floor to the comfortable bed to the cleanliness of the room, we haven't seen better. Ate out at the Dining Room once and had a very nice meal and then a tasty lunch at the lounge the next day. Staff is very friendly and attentive to say the least, even the ladies in the hotel store were nice. They didn't give us the impression that it was all for their almighty tip either. We thought the Marriott in Victoria was awsome but the pinnacle has it beat.

Reviews.Title: “Just wonderful! Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: clarinistica
Reviews.Content: This is a top notch hotel and you will enjoy your stay here. The staff manages to show sincere concern for the guests' comfort without being cloying. I ordered room service during my visit and found all meals to be fresh, hot and delicious. The view of the bay/harbor is well worth the extra fee you might charge. The hotel is located close to Robson Street, but not so close that you feel in the middle of things. Also very close proximity to Stanley Park. The lobby and restaurant are elegant and well appointed. In general, I couldn't have been more pleased. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lexiee
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Very friendly staff. Very comfortable beds. Perfect location downtown and close to everything. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Moosi
Reviews.Content: Stayed night of September 23, 2006. We arrived early and our room was ready. Staff was friendly and very helpful. The room was quiet and had a great view from the 23rd floor overlooking the harbour. Although we prefer a King Size bed we opted for a room with two double beds as we have stayed in this Hotel before and found that the bathroom is much larger and more modern with this configuration. Easy walking distance to downtown and cruise ship terminal. Will definitely use this Hotel again

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: pole2pole
Reviews.Content: My husband and my parents stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in September. It was the being of a 3 week holiday to Canada and could not have got off to a better start. The service in the hotel was excellent. The concierge was very helpful and all staff polite and friendly. The hotel is in an excellent location, close to Robson Street, Canada place,the harbour lookout tower and the waterfront. It is also near Stanley Park. For breakfast we followed the advice of another review and would agree with the recommendation for Moonpennies just around the corner. It was the best breakfast we had during our stay in Canada

Reviews.Title: “so-so hotel, not so good value”
Reviews.Author: twhitney
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel, but not sure it's worth the money. We were able to book a room for $135 through priceline. When we got there I asked if we could get a room with a view because it was our anniversary. The desk clerk looked something up on the computer and told me he could offer me something for an extra $40 charge. I politely declined. Now the standard room rate there is I guess around $220+ so I know I guess we got a better deal than a lot of people, but $135 isn't exactly free. We got one of the smallest hotel rooms I've ever stayed in, with essentially no view. I'm not sure I get it. I guess Vancouver is just an expensive place to get a hotel. My wife and I got a better deal in mid-town Manhattan, in terms of size of room and decor. In addition, the Marriott Pinnacle charges about 15 bucks to use their wireless service in the room. They also charge for the business center, and they charge about $22 per night to park at the hotel I will say though that the bed was very comfortable and the staff were friendly. Also - If you want to use the gym, the fitness center isn't bad - nice pool, nice jacuzzi, steam room and sauna open 24 hours, and decent cardio equipment. so-so weights in the weightroom. One more thing about the hotel. The hotel restaurant is ok, but somehow between a few drinks, a little tiny salad, a side of mussels and one order of lamb the bill hit almost $100. I don't mind paying for things, but I like to at least feel like I'm getting what I'm paying for.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Pinnacle - excellent service, great room”
Reviews.Author: tutravelers
Reviews.Content: We were at the Marriott Pinnacle Aug.2006. We stayed on the 31st floor, water view. The room was very nice, on the small side, but the view made up for the size. One side of the room was all windows. We could see mountains in the distance and the coming and going of cruise ships and float planes. The staff were very friendly and gave excellent service. We walked to the sea wall and rented bikes. I would recommended walking or riding the sea wall in Stanley Park. I would also recommend staying at the Pinnacle. It is pricey but so are all the other comparable places in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Compleatangler
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Pinnacle was our hotel of choice to stay at after an Alaskan cruise on Carnival lines. My wife and I are Marriott Rewards members and often stay at Marriotts for free. I must say that our stay in Vancouver was more fun than the cruise. Due to a massive cold front packing 50knt winds our ship, the SPIRIT was forced to forgo Prince Wm. Sound and Glacier Bay and the continued miserable weather canceled out our helicopter excursion in Juno. As a matter of fact it rained almost the entire cruise. Don't get me wrong though, Alaska is breathtakingly beautiful. We are going to have to go back! But we needed to make up for lost sightseeing in Vancouver. The Pinnacle is a lovely hotel in a great location. Just a short walk to Canada Place, the sea plane terminal, shopping on Robson St., dining, etc etc. Just a wonderful location. We paid for a 5 day stay using Marriott points and when checking in we were treated just great. The desk attendant booked us into a 29th floor corner room with a spectacular view of the harbor. The concierge staff went out of their way to help us book our tours to Victoria, Butchart Gardens, the Capilano suspension bridge and Grouse Mountain. On our last night which was our wedding anniversary we had a delicious dinner at Morton's steak house that rounded out a great time in Vancouver. Great city and a fine hotel. You will like it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: jrsungrules
Reviews.Content: My trip was from August 3-7, 2006 at Vancouver Marriott Pinnacle. Even though the Lobby should be a little bigger, everything was EXCELLENT. The staff was very friendly and I love our cleaning lady. They left little chocolates when I came back in the evenings with next day weather info. I used marriott rewards for four nights and they gave us free breakfast buffet, which was very good. I HIGHLY recommend everyone to stay at the marriott. Better than the Vancouver Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent attention to all details by a charming staff!”
Reviews.Author: fendifendi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in July using our Marriott Rewards points and were treated like Royalty every moment by their fanatastic staff. We had mentioned that we were celebrating our 40th anniversary in our email confirming our reservation. We were upgraded to a very attractive room on the 28th floor with a corner window view of Vancouver. We returned to our room the first night to find 2 bottles of Champagne and chocolate covered strawberries and truffles set up by the window - a lovely gesture orchestrated by the front desk staff. The concierge crew and the doormen were extremely helpful. There is currently construction all over the city but we did not hear any noises from our room. The hotel enjoys an excellent location in the city - near the harbor and away from the traffic of Robson St. The health club complex with it's lap pool, whirlpool, steam rooms and workout room was complimentary to hotel guests. We prepurchased tickets to Storyeum in Gastown at the Canadian border tourist booth ~ it's a presentation with separate vignettes about the history of Vancouver - featuring actors and some singing and interesting stage settings. Families with older children may want to check it out - in the same complex is a production about Dinosaurs. Gastown has typical tourist shops that are not unique. We preferred exploring the end of Robson Street - nearer to the hotel - with it's authentic ethnic restaurants and shops - that's where all the action is. We had dinner at an all you can eat for $10 Mongolian Hot Pot restaurant that was excellent. We drove north to Whistler on the Sea to Sky Highway - there are lovely views but also alot of serious construction on the road. We stopped off enroute to see the famous waterfall - if you go that way keep your eyes open for the very small road sign. If you are taking a ferry to Victoria make sure to reserve a space for your car well in advance using the BC Ferry website - and allow enough time to get to the ferry which is a 60 minute drive - or more from Vancouver to Twaussen. The Dr. Sun Yat Sen Gardens in Chinatown was worth exploring - we skipped exploring Chinatown as advised by the police - due to the masses of homeless and frequent car break ins. The Museum of Anthropology at the University of Bristish Columbia is brilliant and well worth the detour by car to it's location outside of the city. Be sure to taste the local Ice Wines - and take notice of the water features, terraces and gardens set into all of the newer buildings.

Reviews.Title: “A fine experience”
Reviews.Author: Colleague
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 10 p.m. on a Saturday and left at 4 a.m. on the following Thursday and from start to finish the experience at this rather new Marriott was flawless. Everyone we encountered was both nice and competent and everything was pleasant, comfortable, clean and worked. The view of Burrard Inlet from the 29th floor was magnificent, particularly the comings and goings of cruise ships, float planes and ferries. The hotel restaurant was airy and attractive and the food and service were of a high standard.
