Nearby, the Tourist Info center proved to be a gold mine and the walk along the Coal Harbor seawall and around Stanley Park was truly "awesome." (Robson Street, on the other hand, is highly overrated.) This is a fine hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Dudley UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel for four nights early June. On arrival found reception staff very friendly. Could have had one of the famous rooms ending in 19 but would have had to wait for two hours so settled for the one we were given. This was on 19th floor facing towards the city. The room was very comfortable and reasonable in size. There is building work going on down the road and across from the Hotel front but we hardly noticed it. I also liked the idea that you could only operate the elevator by means of your room card key. Found all the staff we came into contact with friendly and polite. Used the Showcase restaurant a couple of times. The food was good but thought the menu was a bit limited.We had a really good meal at the Keg Restaurant which is nearby. We found the location very good for our needs. Not to far from Robson Street and Stanley Park. Also only a five minute walk from the Float Plane Terminal which we used for a whale watch tour from Victoria. We also used public transport to get to Grouse Mountain and Capialano Suspension Bridge. Caught the sea bus from by Canada Place to Lonsdale Quay then No 236 bus up to Grouse Mountain. All in all would gladly recommend this hotel. As an after thought we used the Airporter Transfer Bus from Vancouver Airport, big mistake for us as it did not go direct to the hotel but dropped us off six blocks away where we had to wait 30 minutes for another bus to complete journey.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel in a surprisingly great location...”
Reviews.Author: roanoke4
Reviews.Content: Great, great hotel. The staff are more than accomodating and we really liked the location as well (near Stanley Park, Robson Street, ferries to Grouse Mountain, etc.) Speaking of location, a walk along the water from the hotel towards Stanley Park is a must, and I'd recommend Lift Restaurant which is on the way. If possible, try to get a corner room which will give you sweeping views of the area---we really enjoyed our high floor, corner room for our stay. The hotel restaurant is actually very good as well, as is the indoor fitness center and pool. Overall, this is a top-notch place and I'd highly recommend it to anyone, whether you're visiting for business or pleasure. Like most Marriott properties, they really are customer service oriented and I'll definitely be staying at the Pinnacle the next time I'm in beautiful Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Major construction going on across the street”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Be Warned - there is MAJOR construction going on across the street from this hotel. It starts at 7 AM and can be heard with defeaning force even from the 31st floor, where I now sit typing this. I was "upgraded" to a room facing the Bay, they sold me on it at the front desk - a big mistake, as we are now directly above a three story pile driver and fifty or so workers building a new dock on the bay. I'm from NYC, so I'm no stranger to construction and city noise - this is extraordinary!! I'm going to tape it for my home answering machine. Otherwise, it's a clean property in an unremarkable and empty area. The hotel itself has the usual services you would expect. It has a nervous, strained-cheerful staff that all seem to want to go home (can't blame them). Room service closes at 11 PM but we called at 10:50, and was told the kitchen was in the "process of closing." Sigh! I travel quite a bit and am fairly easily pleased - just give me a reasonably quiet bed somewhere, or an interesting area, or a little charm. Three strikes! Frankly there are much better choices.

Reviews.Title: “What a Treat!!!”
Reviews.Author: Belli123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel May 13-15 and had an absolutely wonderful experience. Not only is the hotel beautiful, it is centrally located downtown. I was most impressed by how the entire staff treated me as soon as I walked in the door. Everyone from the two concierge to the reception (Ting) were exceptional and always very pleasant and helpful. Also, as a priceline customer I appreciated that this was not mentioned at check-in and my request for a room ending in the numbers "19" was easily accomodated. (At other princeline hotels I found that this is not usually true). I recommend requesting a "19" room, you will get floor to ceiling windows overlooking the marina and downtown area. We didn't have a car and were able to get around town easily. Outside the back of the hotel (off of Pender Street) bus 19 picks up right outside and drops you off in Stanley Park. The bus driver announces which stop to get off to rent bicycles for the park. Across the street from the bus stop is an inexpensive breakfast diner called Moonpennies, that had delicious scones for about $2.25 CAN. You can also easily walk to Robson Street, which is about a 10 minute or so walk. I personally would have skipped Robson Street as it seemed just like any upscale shopping area in the US, nothing special. We walked to Yaletown on Saturday night and found some cool bars with live jazz music and cocktails at a restaurant called Capone's. Another plus about the hotel is that it is only about a 5-10 minute walk from Canada Place, convenient if you are arriving by cruise ship. We walked it with our luggage no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: pdxrobyn
Reviews.Content: We visited Vancouver over Easter Weekend 2006 - April 13-16th. Our stay at the Marriot Pinnacle was great. We lucked out (without even asking) to get one of the corner rooms on the 21st floor. The view was very nice and the windows were huge. Everything was very clean, bed was comfortable and bathroom was spacious. The front desk staff were also very friendly to us. Location is alright. We walked around a lot from there, but also ended up using the car a fair bit to get places. The best part for us is that we ended up at this hotel by using priceline and bidding $70 USD a night. I think it was an amazing deal at that price. Parking was $18 USD a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: maxwell5555
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Marriott Pinnacle for a conference. I chose the Pinnacle based on reviews from this site, and must say it was a very good choice. Here are reasons why I enjoyed my stay: 1) Extremely friendly staff. I didn't walk into the hotel once without a "welcome back" or "good afternoon". 2) Based on a few reviews, I asked for a room ending in 19 (I got 1119). I had to wait about an hour for the room to be serviced, but it was well worth it. There is a large window that spans the length of the room, giving nice views of the city and harbor (although not for long, there's a building under construction that will soon block all water views). The bathroom has both a shower and a bathtub. I had the chance to see two other rooms which were much smaller. One only had a shower and the other was missing a desk due to space restrictions. I highly recommend asking for a -19 room. 3) I had to change my plans and leave one day earlier than expected. I expected and offered to pay for the last night's stay considering I checked out at 5pm, but the front desk staff immediately took the final night off of my bill. 4) Upgraded Marriott bedding. This Marriott has the nice pillowtop beds and comforters, which I find extremely comfortable. Overall, I was very pleased with this hotel. It is cheaper and nicer than the Renaissance across the street (which I also considered). I would highly recommend it to anyone travelling to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Service & Price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: THe Pinnacle Marriott in Vancouver is GREAT - love going up for weekends (from Redmond, WA). Service is so friendly and gracious, but not "over the top"...they make you feel comfortable. They just got new beds and are much better than the ones they had last summer...a ton of pillows and really soft mattresses. The views are really nice of Vancouver - try to get a room overlooking the water and you can watch the seaplanes take off just a block away. The hotel is just a couple blocks from Robson Street and many great restaurants. I used to pick my hotel based on price, that's how I found the Pinnacle. I don't know how they do it, but are usually $20-50 cheaper than the other higher-end hotels in VAncouver. A tip -if you won need to park at the hotel during the day, park on the street at night - it's free on weekends and always a lot of spaces in front of the hotel. You'll save $25 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here all the Time! Love It!”
Reviews.Author: Cosette132
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I take 2 'Mother/Daughter' weekends a year downtown Vancouver for a concert or show, and always stay at the Pinnacle. Service is incredible. The pool is beautiful. Quite large. Nice hot tub, sauna and steam room. There is a large work out center (have not used it). There are also very large change rooms with multiple showers. Plenty of towels available for use as well as lockers. Free apples in this area as well. The rooms are clean and the beds and pillows are a dream to sleep on! They have in room movie service (about $11-$12 depending on the movie you choose) and in room minibar. Cordless phone and regular phone. Newspaper at your door every morning (I always request a local paper and it is always there for me!). If you don't request a local paper you will get the Globe and Mail. The big corner rooms are the best, and on our past stay we got a smaller room. Didn't mind because it was only for 2 nights. Large ceiling to floor windows for a great view of the city or harbour. Here is a tip - rather than using their business center if you need to, take the elevator or stairs up to the next floor. As soon as you get off the elevator there is a large print & post type store with computers/internet access for 2.99/15 min. The business center in the hotel is $5.95 for 15 mins plus $1 a page to print. There is also a coffee shop and things like that just outside from there. We usually order room service. The regular meals are HUGE and we can never finish. The kids meals come with plenty of food and your little one will not go hungry. The food is tasty. The breakfast was another story. Perhaps we should have just ordered the eggs and toast type breakfast and it would have been good, but my daughter's choc chip pancakes were terrible. I ordered french toast and got some odd concotion of egg dipped bread then rolled in cornflakes and then cooked. ICK! Dry and gross! Just don't order this! There is an inroom coffee maker and lots of mugs and glasses can be found. Plenty of towels. Stand up shower stall and separate small bathtub. Don't hesitate to stay here! It is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Marriott.”
Reviews.Author: lucycan
Reviews.Content: This is a nice new hotel. All the staff is very friendly. The rooms are a bit small so ask for one ending in 19, such as 2419, 2519. These are a bit bigger and offer great views of the harbor. The rooms are comfortable and the bathrooms have a seperate tub/shower which is nice. The best part about the rooms are the beds. They are some of the BEST I have ever slept on. I think this is Marriotts new bedding. It is SUPER comfortable. Worth the stay alone. I stayed for a week. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent; enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: AndrewMichael
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at a hotel outside from the Starwood Hotel Group, and it is pretty comparable. Pros: 1) Though website states check-in is 4 pm, I was able to get a room right away at 2:45 pm. (I asked for a room ending in 19/20, per suggestions from this site) 2) Room did not dissapoint. Weird layout: hallway entrance, but room/bedroom area curves around to accomodate floor to window curved layout. (see pics) 3) Comfy king bed with 6 pillows 4) Room service (breakfast) was prompt, hot, and delicious (had the 3 egg omelet with potato hash brown) 5) Spacious bathroom: stand-up shower separate from soaking tub (see pics) 6) Large toiletries from Bath & Body Works 7) 55+ (yes!) channels available on TV. 8) Very prompt and polite front desk. (I had a Do-Not-Disturb sign overnight, thus not needing housekeeping, and front desk left a voicemail saying if I still need linen changing/room cleaning even after 9 pm, don't hesitate to ask) 9) Heat + A/C has 3 levels: high, medium, low. (usually hotels just have 1 level) 10) Gym, pool, sauna, lockerroom was good 11) My room- 819 was at the corner, so absolutely no noise from next door neighbors. Cons: 1) No wireless internet in guest rooms. 2) After paying for high-speed internet through a provided ethernet cable for the 1st day, I could not get service back on the 2nd day. Clearing cache + calling front desk did not help + restarting laptop + ejecting cable all did not work. 3) Elevator a bit slow. (2 separate services for residential part of hotel, and hotel part)

Reviews.Title: “Top of the world at the Pinnacle”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Marriott Pinnacle for two days of combined business and pleasure. We were able to use our Marriott Rewards points for one night but even without this bonus, the hotel was still a bargain at the Cdn $139/night we paid for the second night. I arrived at the hotel in the late evening and checked in ahead of my husband, who came a few hours later (close to midnight). The front desk staff had no problem accomodating my request to keep an eye out for my husband and to direct him to my room. All the staff we encountered from the doormen, hotel operators, and the front desk staff were friendly and provided excellent service. They really made the difference at this hotel. We were upgraded to a superior room on the 21st floor, which was a corner room with a city view and featured one wall of near floor to ceiling windows. The furniture was modern and functional. I appreciated the nice comfy bed and the bathroom was superior to many hotels in this category with a separate bath and shower,and better than average design. The location turned out to be better than we anticipated because it was close to the harbour and only about a 10 minute walk to the shopping mecca on Robson street. If you like Thai and Malay cuisine you should definitely try the award-winning Tropika on Robson street, which was a real treat. The ambiance, presentation, and food were memorable particularly for the price. Our experience at the Marriott will be a big reason for a repeat visit to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: super nice. friendly people, clean room - one of the nicest Marriotts I've ever stayed at. And at $199 per night ($150-175 in US funds) one of the best values too!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, very modern and plush. Wish I could have such a nice bed at home. Spacious updated rooms with designer touches. Big bathroom with separate shower/tub. My only complaint about Marriot hotels is they nickel and dime you to death. $1 for phone calls (two of which were dropped, charges taken off when i complained at check out), no free internet access. Most budget motels have free local calls, why does an expensive luxury hotel at triple the room rate have to charge for calls? and why such exuberant rates? and if a coffee shop can have free wireless access, why charge for it in your hotel room?

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: RedSpyder
Reviews.Content: Simply a great hotel.... great service, great rooms, and great food. I can't believe this is the hotel I got on Priceline for US$80. The room was superb, the service was perfect, and the food (both room service and restaurant) was wonderful. A great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kruizerkarol
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our stay at the Marriott Pinnacle. Very nice hotel. Booked it on Priceline, not a great rate for Priceline but okay. Busy weekend in Vancouver I guess. I called the day before to let them know we would have a late check in. They asked if we wanted 1 or 2 beds and smoking or non. When we arrived I asked about their upgrade program. You could pay $30 (CAD) a nite for an upper floor no concierge lounge, or for $60 (CAD) a nite you got a room on the 24th floor or higher and the lounge. I thought with the concierge lounge you got free wine and beer but found out you have to pay for liquor. Only freebie is coffee and soft drinks. The evening hors'deurves were okay. There was fried shrimp, cheese, crackers, bread, cookies, etc. nothing too extravagant. Breakfast was a continental breakfast. Cereal, yogurt, toast, fruit, oatmeal, juice, coffee. The lounge is not very big and finding a table is difficult sometimes. There were chairs and a sofa you could sit on but had to do a balancing act with your plate. We had breakfast every morning but only went our first evening for hors'deurves. I read here, on trip advisor to ask for a room with XX19, that all the 19 rooms were better. We asked but were told there was none available but that the XX20 were just as good if not better. We had room 2420 and the view was spectacular. Huge windows that looked out over the bay right above the float plane area, very nice. Never saw a XX19 room so have nothing to compare it to. We had a king bed, desk, chair, TV armoire. Bathroom was nice, had a tub and a shower stall. Water pressure okay. Very clean. I liked the location of the hotel, being near the water and not too far from Robson and downtown. We walked to Robson St. and Gastown in the evening, felt safe enough. Took a cab to Canada Place for our cruise, too much luggage to walk down. There is a liquor store up Thurlow on Albernini, very convenient. Staff were all very nice. No problems. Would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “will not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: upon arrival at 3:15pm, we were told that we could not check in for another hour and a half. they suggested we "go on a walk and come back". after we checked in, at 4:30, we proceeded to our room. Upon arrival, we realized that our bags were not there. after calling to inquire, we were told that they would look into it and would call back. they didn't call back so we went downstairs to the front desk. they rudely told us it was our mistake because we didn't ask for the bags to be brought up when we checked in. c'mon...seriously. when they finally brought our bags, one was missing. all in all, we found the customer service to be completely unacceptable and we wil never return.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: gaudygecko
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for an August family reunion based on TripAdvisor reviews and some additional research. Arrived early afternoon, and was told our room was ready, but having seen the suggestion to ask for a room ending in 19 as they are larger rooms, I did so. There was one available, but it wouldn't be ready for several hours; the wait was well worth it! It was one of the highest floors, beautiful views of the harbor with the sea planes coming and going as well as the cruise ships, and the harbor was just as beautiful when it was fully illuminated at night. The room was spacious (not all rooms are according to other family members who stayed there also), nicely decorated and it was also quiet. The bathroom was large and brightly lit. Since we had to wait for our room, we had lunch at the hotel restaurant, and it was a treat. Definitely not what comes to mind when one usually thinks "hotel restaurant." Sat outside people-watching, had a glass of local Chardonnay with a salmon Caesar salad. Since everyone had a long day of driving to get there, we opted to have dinner at the hotel the first night-again, excellent service, ambience, food and wine. The hotel was also running a special I happened to see advertised in the elevator-the Concierge would provide a $15 gift card for the restaurant just for the asking, and two were permitted per table, so we took advantage of that offer. Our package included the breakfast buffet each morning, and there were lots of nice selections of hot items and fresh fruit. The hotel is conveniently located for many of the downtown attractions and shopping areas. We had dinner at The Five Sails in the Pan Pacific Hotel the second night which is in walking distance; another wonderful restaurant experience. We found that the lobby Concierge staff was very friendly and helpful, whether it was making reservations or hailing a cab. Will stay here again, but hopefully for longer!

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough”
Reviews.Author: fancyn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights using frequent stayer points and spent the extra $30 per night for access to the concierge level. We felt that the money was well spent on breakfast alone and it was nice to have beverages and snacks available most of the day. Also, the concieges on the 25th floor were quite helpful, although one was a bit pushy regarding tours and the hotel restaurant. The rooms are small with very little space for clothing. The bathrooms are also small and the separate tub is only viable for very small persons. The bed and pillows were comfortable. Did have a great view of the sea planes taking off and landing as well as Canada Place. Easy walk to shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Brief stay Turned out okay”
Reviews.Author: Cynde
Reviews.Content: In July we stayed at the Marriott Pinnacle for one night while waiting to embark on a cruise though the inland passage. We booked using Marriott Rewards. I contacted the hotel directly 1 month prior to arrival to make sure everything was in order...which I was told it was. Upon arrival we were told that they had no non-smoking rooms left (one of the criteria I had called a month earlier to make sure was available) ..upon further query we established that there were NS rooms available, but in a higher class catergory and were told we would have to pay $40 to upgrade. Needless to say I was flabergasted, especially we stay at Marriotts exclusively for all our business travel and have silver status! After negotiating with the desk clerk for 40 minutes, we were offered a view room (concierge level, but without access to all the goodies like evening reception and breakfast) on the 26th floor overlooking the harbor at no additional charge. It was a very nice room with a great view...a bit on the small side, not super plush, but quite nice overall. Our bellman felt so bad for the fact that we had to haggle with the desk clerk for so long, that he gave us access to the concierge level reception area on the 25th floor so we could have a drink...lots of other great goodies as well (lamb chops, crackers & cheeses, veggies, egg rolls, fresh cookies, wine, beer, sodas, etc...). We ended up making it our dinner. Even though it started out rough....we were happy guests in the end. Location was great...near the waterfront and So close to Canada Place (cruise port) that we were able to walk with our pull luggage in tow.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge level worth the extra bucks!”
Reviews.Author: DPDDDS
Reviews.Content: Loved hotel and Vancouver. Stayed in a 25th floor room with a great view. Our family of four enjoyed the continental breakfast. It was a great start to a busy day of sightseeing and shopping. Next meal was lunch everyday so it really saved to stay on concierge level. Good beds, large and modern rooms. Great gym and indoor pool.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Vancouver Marriott Pinnacle”
Reviews.Author: tprgran
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the Vancouver Marriott Pinnacle. It was a bad start to the vacation with the hotel having my room only available 2.5 hours later than their published check-in time of 3pm. This totally messed up the first evening. Although the staff was apologetic, the excuse was they had booked a group of pilots from Air Canada and Transat who would only be checking out after 4:30pm (at my expense). They offered me a complementary beverage as compensation.. I am sure it would have cost me a lot more if I were to check-out 2.5 hours late. It is apparent that they stretch the rules for groups at the expense of other regular paying customers, who do not have as much clout. I will not use Marriott chain again. Also the hotel is not worth the price ($229/night).

Reviews.Title: “Great view & customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Frankie_Friends
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pinnacle prior to a cruise. Great experience began when I got out of the cab. Bellhop greeted me with smile and offer of assistance with bags. I asked for nearest place to bottled water and he directed me to London Drug on Robson (?) street - within walking distance of hotel. Well worth the visit to Robson (fantastic downtown mall). He also offered a map. Bags were in room within 5 minutes of arrival and they helped me leave within 5 minutes of requesting service. At check-in, I asked for a room with a view of the harbor and got a room on the 29th floor (out of 31 floors). Secured the room on Priceline for $75/night (great savings over normal rack rate). Our room was one of the curved ones which were narrow and long. The half circle room had floor to ceiling windows. I watched sea planes take off and land, dinner cruises in harbor and saw the Carnival Spirit and the Holland America ship arrive in the morning. The bathrom was clean with a separate tub and shower. I walked to Canada Place twice during stay. Once to check it out before the cruise and once to get on one of the Big Bus tours (great tour). Excellent customer service and great property.

Reviews.Title: “Energetic Staff!”
Reviews.Author: IggleDoer
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pinnacle prior to a cruise. Asked for a room with a view of Canada Place (the cruise ship pier) and got a room on the 26th Floor. Unfortunately, they were starting to build offices and condos across the street near the water which blocked most of our view. Our room was one of the curved ones which were narrow and long. It worked well for us and provided extra space to keep our spare suitcases for the cruise. The bathrom was clean with a separate tub and shower. The staff was energetic and was determined to make everything right for us. The bellhop knew our name when we returned later that day. Excellend customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Free shaving cream...you can't beat it...”
Reviews.Author: WWUVIK
Reviews.Content: We had to leave the property at 7AM. I forgot my shaving cream. I went down stairs looking for the gift shop to be open at 6AM...it wasn't...but...the valet/busboy/savior asked if he could help...35 seconds later...I had some shaving cream...5 star service...thanks!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect pre or apres cruise”
Reviews.Author: nuheart
Reviews.Content: On our latest trip to Vancouver, my wife and I decided to try the marriott Pinnacle and were extremely pleased with our choice. The hotel was first rate. The rooms and furnishings were clean,fresh, and well designed and the hotel staff seemed to be very concerned about making our stay a pleasant one. We were always greeted with a smile at the door and the desk and by any room service employee. The hotel is close to the waterfront and an easy walk to Canada place and the cruise terminal. It is also about three or four blocks from Robson street and not that far from Gastown.' Easy walking distance or a quick cab ride. But Vancouver is such a nice city to walk in. It's so clean and fresh with lots of interesting shops and a coffee shop on nearly every corner. We used the 21 day advance purchase on marriott wesite and received a great price on the room. It is a good hotel for a nice romantic and leisure weekend or a great business hotel as well. We will return to the pinnacle on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Superb customer service you'd expect from a 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: taminator
Reviews.Content: Don't believe the negative reviews you see in this section. We just stayed one night and came away very satisfied with the level of customer service that was delivered, the room, and the location. The start of my joy began with getting a room for $70 US via Hotwire, while the hotel's web site listed a basic room for $209 CDN. When I arrived to check in, there were three people working the counter and I didn't have to wait more than a few minutes before I was served. The clerk was courteous and delightful to work with. My research showed I should ask for a room number that ended in "19" in order to get one of the hotel's corner rooms. The clerk immediately knew the exact room I was looking for and said she would do her best. After a few taps of the keyboard, she moved me from 1208 to 1519 but it would take housekeeping about 30 minutes to clean the room. I opted to wait the half-hour to get the better room. I returned to the front desk exactly 30 minutes later and my room was ready as promised. You need your room card key to access the elevator and I appreciated this added security feature. Once I got to my room, it was nicely decorated and had curved floor-to-ceiling windows and a partial view of the harbour and float planes taking off and landing. Amenities include a cordless telephone, large computer desk, ergonomic chair, and a separate bath and shower. I had forgotten something in my car and went down to get it at about 2:30 a.m. When I was leaving the room, I could clearly hear 2-3 people through their door in the adjacent room. I stepped back inside and closed the door to check the noise and was impressed that the soundproofing worked between rooms. I've been in hotel rooms where I could hear conversations through the wall. That wasn't the case here! All in all, this was a plesant stay and I wouldn't hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the price”
Reviews.Author: gmt61
Reviews.Content: Spent 2.17.5 to 2.20.05 at the Marriott Pinnacle. The room was rather small and at an odd angle, but fine for one person. Requested a room with an ocean view that was non-smoking. Got it. The bathroom was nice and roomy. Bigger than mine at home. The shower stall did have some moldy grout, which was unexpected. The towels were a decent size. I did not see any bathrobes. I prefer feather pillows and housekeeping responded to my request. Did not use the honour bar but laughed at the prices. Calls were 1.07 {CAD} The lattes at Caffe Artigiano which is around the corner are pretty darn yummy. Got the room from Priceline for 55.00 {USD} so I can't really complain. A fair price for a better than average room in downtown Vancouver. I would stay here again only if I got the same rate.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, though not ultra-luxe.”
Reviews.Author: PNWShawn
Reviews.Content: Perfect downtown location! Walk to Robson St shopping, Stanley Park, Gas Town. I have yet to be disappointed at a Marriott property, although this one isn't quite as luxurious as, say, the Hong Kong Marriott. My wife and I wanted a romantic weekend to reconnect. Had a wonderful stay, though we definitely prefer the more oppulent Westin Marina Bayshore. Bid $57 on priceline for a 4-star in downtown. Total was $75 US after taxes and fees. "Jennifer" at reception was very helpful. Offered a standard room on 19th floor with city view. We opted to upgrade to slightly larger room on 31st floor for $30 CAD (about $25 US). Room was lovely, but still fairly small and oddly shaped - like a slice of pie with a bite missing. Bay view was gorgeous, with floor-to-ceiling wraparound windows. Stocked honor bar, stereo clock/radio, separate bath and standup shower. Pool/sauna/fitness room open 24hrs. Had to call housekeeping to request bathrobes (at midnight), which arrived at room within 5 minutes! Reception told us about a promotion available only to guest who booked via Internet. Full buffet breakfast for 2 for only $20 CAD ($16 US) including tax and tip. Good deal for a deluxe hotel. Wonderful breakfast, with belgian waffles, fresh fruit and pastries, omlet bar, etc... They told us very few people actually get the special deal, because nobody knows about it. You have to purchase the bkfst promo the day you arrive (we booked at 11 pm). Parking was $23 CAD per 24hrs.

Reviews.Title: “Going downhill.. fast!”
Reviews.Author: deanhill
Reviews.Content: I was surprised how quickly this hotel has declined since my last visit visit 3 years ago.. it's starting to show wear & tear - and rather quickly. The most uncomfortable bed & worst night's sleep (and back ache!) I have had in a long, long time. The mattress looked (and felt) like it belonged on a pull-out sofabed. When I inquired at the front desk if they were getting the new Marriott signature 'Sleep Well Bed' anytime soon, no one knew what I was referring to. The guest rooms are kinda 'blah' (modern with lots of beige with blonde wood accents). The carpet (also light beige) is already matted and dingy looking - which makes the entire room look & feel dirty. The floor to ceiling drapes (that cover one entire wall) are also light beige. The temp in our room remained a constant stuffy 75 degrees.. no matter how much we tinkered with the A/C controls or left the window open/closed. That, combined with the prison-grade mattress & bedding = the worst night's sleep I can remember. Would not return unless the rooms (and beds) are redone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in the heart of the Central Business District”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Pinnacle for 5 days during the New Year's holiday and our stay was exceptional. This hotel is easily a 4.5 star gem in the middle of the towering skyscrapers of the Financial District in downtown Van - close to the shops on Robson, the danceclubs on Granville, Stanley Park and the seawall, and some of the best views of the city. We stayed on the 31st floor in a city view room (for $99 CAD per nite, a bargain for new years in a 4-star hotel) and I have to say I was totally impressed with the room, albeit the bathroom was sort-of small. We come up to Vancouver often as it is our favourite city and we live so close and I just have to give kudos to the Pinnacle and Vancouver for always exceeding our highest expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: SFO-World-Traveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel (formerly a Delta) is quite nice, if not a little business-like. Its rooms are stylish and modern enough, some of the rooms have gorgeous views of the harbor. This is clearly a business hotel - its location is a bit out of the way for leisure travelers but, Vancouver isn't THAT big. As such, its weekend rates are pretty attractive and you can score a nice harbor view room for a song. If its comfortable accomodations that you are after and you don't mind walking a bit to your destinations, give this hotel a try. Its not going to disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Customer Service was wonderful & though the rooms were small, they were clean and space efficient. The views from the room were amazing. The facilities are quite enjoyable too, & they're open 24 hours every day.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Is Great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was super. From the Check In to the Check Out. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and the decor was very nice. We stayed there from Sept 1st to the 4th. Not a complaint. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “You might be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: travelduck111
Reviews.Content: This is not one of the better Marriotts which I have stayed at. I originally booked the hotel on the web for $330CD a night. However, the night before my stay I was able to get it on Priceline for $55USD. For $55, it is a steal. However, if you are paying the going rate, you might be disappointed. Although I am a Silver Elite member, the front desk personnel was not very friendly and seemed to be just moving people in and out. Other hotels don't even note Priceline but this hotel seemed like it was doing me a favor by letting me stay there. The bed was extremely unconfortable - even in the water view room. Also, the rooms are small and very few have a full water view. On the plus side, the conceriege was very helpful and friendly. In short, if I was paying $330 a night for this hotel, I would have checked out early. In my view, the Renaissance across the street or Westin Bayshore are better places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Some rooms are better than others”
Reviews.Author: Jerri_Blank
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed here two times. The first time I loved it, I had a corner room. So I had a panoramic view that was fantastic. The room was small, but I could see across the water to West Vancouver, and had a city view of the high rises as well. Nice bathroom, with a separate tub and shower. Loved it. The second time, I came with a friend and got a double. The room was smaller, wasnt a corner room - so the view wasnt as spectacular. Close quarters for two people. It's great for one person, but they don't have any suites. Also, there was a movie being filmed on the street outside one of the nights, which made getting to and from the hotel difficult. Good location, and the staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view from upper floors”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Offered room upgrade, which we took. Upper floors have great view of harbor, as hotel is basically across the street from water. Check-in service was great. Parking was $20/day. Hotel is 3-4 block walk from Robson (the shooping street) and near lots of restaurants as you go towards Robson.

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver Marriott Pinnacle is a real fine!”
Reviews.Author: VAChuck
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a real pleasure. The room was luxuriously appointed with bright and cheery colors. It was also very clean and located in the heart of the tourist attractions. Two blocks to the Burrard Inlet/Coal Harbor promenade; 4 blocks to Gastown; 4-8 blocks to Robson and Yaletown; 4 blocks to Harbor Center and Canada Place. Stanley Park, the highpoint of the trip for us, was a nice mile walk along the scenic harbor promenade. From our room we could see the harbor and mountains in the distance. The staff was very friendly; the concierge was particularly helpful in locating good nearby restaurants; but she was also helpful regarding logistics such as to how much time to allow for the escape out of town at Vancouver International Airport (at least 2 hours). This hotel did not have any noticeable drawbacks and we would love to visit this city again and we would surely stay at here again.

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver Marriott Pinnacle--wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We ended an Alaskan cruise in Vancouver on 7/5/04. We decided to stay over one night in Vancouver and tried Priceline. For a bid of $85 US, we were assigned to the Marriott. This is a very convenient location for anyone pre- or post-cruise as it is a reasonable walk and a short taxi ride ($4 CDN) to the hotel. The hotel is very friendly and efficient; our reservation was processed immediately. We were offered a bay-view room (instead of a city-view) for an additional $30 CDN. We accepted and got a corner room on the 31st floor (top floor of the hotel; there are residential units above the hotel). There were floor to ceiling windows curving around the entire room with a breathtaking view of the harbor, Stanley Park and North Vancouver. We were able to watch our ship, the Dawn Princess, as it pulled out of port later in the day. It was fascinating to watch both the boat and seaplane traffic in the by. At night, the view was even better! The room was very clean and well appointed with the usuals but a few surprises...cordless phone, separate marble shower from the tub and a desk stocked with business items such as scissors (helpful when you have to be careful packing them!), rubber bands and paper clips. All in all, a great deal and splendid stay. The Marriott is also a short walk to the shopping/dining areas on Robson and Granville Streets.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1beachroamer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March 2004 and loved our experience. Have stayed in the Renassance, Westin-bayshore, Hyatt and Marriot. This property was by far our best experience of the lot. They have a 24 hour fitness and pool facility, the room we got was a corner wrap-around with views of the harbor and mountains and quite large. Parking was pricey, so I parked on the street at night for free. The property is maybe 5-or 6 blocks from Robson street and a few blocks from the harbor. We brought our 19 month old baby and the hotel had a crib in the room with a bath kit for him. Very Nice service. If I had my choice, I would stay here exclusively, but Priceline determines that. Check biddingfortravel for great hotel deals.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant!!”
Reviews.Author: Time2GoNow
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th trip to Vancouver for business and have stayed in a different hotel each time. I chose this hotel due to the location and all the great reviews on tripadvisor. From the moment I entered the hotel until I left, the service was excellent. My room was on the 31st floor with a view of the water and Canada Place. The room was a decent size, clean, and well appointed. It was also nice to be able to open the window and hear the seaplanes coming and going. The main restaurant was a bit pricey, but the bar had a light menu to choose from. This hotel is in a great location and perfect for first time visitors to Vancouver. It's a block from the water and several blocks from downtown shopping. Stop by Cafe Artigiano around the corner to have some delicious coffee -- the Barista designed a heart in my coffee each morning! I will definitely stay at the Marriott Pinnacle again (next time on vacation!).

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pinnacle May 14-16/04. Even though we only paid $47US/night through priceline.com we were treated great. The staff are very friendly and professional, the room immaculate, the pool & spa open 24/7. We arrived at 10:30am and they had our room ready for us, didn't have to wait till the regular 3pm check-in. When we checked out they stored our luggage for the day & had a cab ready to take us back to the airport. This hotel is in a great location, walking distance to many downtown attractions. Would definitely recommend it, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pinnacle is very nice.”
Reviews.Author: yes2travel
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights the week of May 10th at the Pinnacle. Room was beautiful with floor to ceiling windows. Excellent desk and high speed internet access for business travelers. The bathroom was large with seperate tub/shower. Sink space was a little limited for setting out cosmetics and hair things. Room service was excellent. Excellent walking proximity to restaurants and shops. I would definitely stay here again. FYI..there is a $20 CAD to self park your car. Not surprising in downtown Vancouver.
